properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Azure Maps Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the Azure Maps Account should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku_name
properties.description: • sku_name - (Required) The sku of the Azure Maps Account. Possible values are s0 and s1.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Azure Maps Account.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the resource group. Must be unique on your Azure subscription.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the resource group should be created. For a list of all Azure locations, please consult this link or run az account list-locations --output table.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Analysis Services Server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure location where the Analysis Services Server exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the Analysis Services Server should be exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) SKU for the Analysis Services Server. Possible values are: D1, B1, B2, S0, S1, S2, S4, S8 and S9

properties.name: admin_users
properties.description: • admin_users - (Optional) List of email addresses of admin users.

properties.name: querypool_connection_mode
properties.description: • querypool_connection_mode - (Optional) Controls how the read-write server is used in the query pool. If this values is set to All then read-write servers are also used for queries. Otherwise with ReadOnly these servers do not participate in query operations.

properties.name: backup_blob_container_uri
properties.description: • backup_blob_container_uri - (Optional) URI and SAS token for a blob container to store backups.

properties.name: enable_power_bi_service
properties.description: • enable_power_bi_service - (Optional) Indicates if the Power BI service is allowed to access or not.

properties.name: ipv4_firewall_rule
properties.description: • ipv4_firewall_rule - (Optional) One or more ipv4_firewall_rule block(s) as defined below.
<hr/>
A ipv4_firewall_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the firewall rule.

properties.name: range_start
properties.description: • range_start - (Required) Start of the firewall rule range as IPv4 address.

properties.name: range_end
properties.description: • range_end - (Required) End of the firewall rule range as IPv4 address.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure location where the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service should be exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: publisher_name
properties.description: • publisher_name - (Required) The name of publisher/company.

properties.name: publisher_email
properties.description: • publisher_email - (Required) The email of publisher/company.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Deprecated) A sku block as documented below

properties.name: sku_name
properties.description: • sku_name - (Required) sku_name is a string consisting of two parts separated by an underscore(_). The fist part is the name, valid values include: Developer, Basic, Standard and Premium. The second part is the capacity (e.g. the number of deployed units of the sku), which must be a positive integer (e.g. Developer_1).
<hr/>

properties.name: additional_location
properties.description: • additional_location - (Optional) One or more additional_location blocks as defined below.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) One or more (up to 10) certificate blocks as defined below.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) An identity block is documented below.

properties.name: hostname_configuration
properties.description: • hostname_configuration - (Optional) A hostname_configuration block as defined below.

properties.name: notification_sender_email
properties.description: • notification_sender_email - (Optional) Email address from which the notification will be sent.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: • policy - (Optional) A policy block as defined below.

properties.name: security
properties.description: • security - (Optional) A security block as defined below.

properties.name: sign_in
properties.description: • sign_in - (Optional) A sign_in block as defined below.

properties.name: sign_up
properties.description: • sign_up - (Optional) A sign_up block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags assigned to the resource.
<hr/>
A additional_location block supports the following:

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Azure Region in which the API Management Service should be expanded to.
<hr/>
A certificate block supports the following:

properties.name: encoded_certificate
properties.description: • encoded_certificate - (Required) The Base64 Encoded PFX Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_password
properties.description: • certificate_password - (Required) The password for the certificate.

properties.name: store_name
properties.description: • store_name - (Required) The name of the Certificate Store where this certificate should be stored. Possible values are CertificateAuthority and Root.
<hr/>
A hostname_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: management
properties.description: • management - (Optional) One or more management blocks as documented below.

properties.name: portal
properties.description: • portal - (Optional) One or more portal blocks as documented below.

properties.name: proxy
properties.description: • proxy - (Optional) One or more proxy blocks as documented below.

properties.name: scm
properties.description: • scm - (Optional) One or more scm blocks as documented below.
<hr/>
A identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the type of Managed Service Identity that should be configured on this API Management Service. At this time the only supported value isSystemAssigned.
<hr/>
A management, portal and scm block supports the following:

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Required) The Hostname to use for the Management API.

properties.name: key_vault_id
properties.description: • key_vault_id - (Optional) The ID of the Key Vault Secret containing the SSL Certificate, which must be should be of the type application/x-pkcs12.

NOTE: Setting this field requires the identity block to be specified, since this identity is used for to retrieve the Key Vault Certificate. Auto-updating the Certificate from the Key Vault requires the Secret version isn't specified.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) The Base64 Encoded Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_password
properties.description: • certificate_password - (Optional) The password associated with the certificate provided above.
NOTE: Either key_vault_id or certificate and certificate_password must be specified.

properties.name: negotiate_client_certificate
properties.description: (Optional) Should Client Certificate Negotiation be enabled for this Hostname? Defaults to false.
<hr/>
A policy block supports the following:

properties.name: xml_content
properties.description: • xml_content - (Optional) The XML Content for this Policy.

properties.name: xml_link
properties.description: • xml_link - (Optional) A link to an API Management Policy XML Document, which must be publicly available.
<hr/>
A proxy block supports the following:

properties.name: default_ssl_binding
properties.description: • default_ssl_binding - (Optional) Is the certificate associated with this Hostname the Default SSL Certificate? This is used when an SNI header isn't specified by a client. Defaults to false.

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Required) The Hostname to use for the Management API.

properties.name: key_vault_id
properties.description: • key_vault_id - (Optional) The ID of the Key Vault Secret containing the SSL Certificate, which must be should be of the type application/x-pkcs12.

NOTE: Setting this field requires the identity block to be specified, since this identity is used for to retrieve the Key Vault Certificate. Auto-updating the Certificate from the Key Vault requires the Secret version isn't specified.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) The Base64 Encoded Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_password
properties.description: • certificate_password - (Optional) The password associated with the certificate provided above.
NOTE: Either key_vault_id or certificate and certificate_password must be specified.

properties.name: negotiate_client_certificate
properties.description: (Optional) Should Client Certificate Negotiation be enabled for this Hostname? Defaults to false.
<hr/>
A security block supports the following:

properties.name: disable_backend_ssl30
properties.description: (Optional) Should SSL 3.0 be disabled on the backend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Backend.Protocols.Ssl30 field

properties.name: disable_backend_tls10
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.0 be disabled on the backend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Backend.Protocols.Tls10 field

properties.name: disable_backend_tls11
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.1 be disabled on the backend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Backend.Protocols.Tls11 field

properties.name: disable_frontend_ssl30
properties.description: (Optional) Should SSL 3.0 be disabled on the frontend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Protocols.Ssl30 field

properties.name: disable_frontend_tls10
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.0 be disabled on the frontend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Protocols.Tls10 field

properties.name: disable_frontend_tls11
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.1 be disabled on the frontend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Protocols.Tls11 field

properties.name: disable_triple_des_ciphers
properties.description: (Optional) Should the TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA cipher be disabled for alL TLS versions (1.0, 1.1 and 1.2)? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Ciphers.TripleDes168 field
<hr/>
A sku block supports the following: (Deprecated)

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the Pricing Tier for the API Management Service. Possible values include: Developer, Basic, Standard and Premium.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) Specifies the Pricing Capacity for the API Management Service.
Note: This property has been deprecated in favour of the sku_name property and will be removed in version 2.0 of the provider.
<hr/>
A sign_in block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Should anonymous users be redirected to the sign in page?
<hr/>
A sign_up block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Can users sign up on the development portal?

properties.name: terms_of_service
properties.description: • terms_of_service - (Optional) A terms_of_service block as defined below.
<hr/>
A terms_of_service block supports the following:

properties.name: consent_required
properties.description: • consent_required - (Required) Should the user be asked for consent during sign up?

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Should Terms of Service be displayed during sign up?.

properties.name: text
properties.description: • text - (Required) The Terms of Service which users are required to agree to in order to sign up.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the API Management API. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The Name of the API Management Service where this API should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group where the API Management API exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: revision
properties.description: • revision - (Required) The Revision which used for this API.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The display name of the API.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The Path for this API Management API, which is a relative URL which uniquely identifies this API and all of it's resource paths within the API Management Service.

properties.name: protocols
properties.description: • protocols - (Required) A list of protocols the operations in this API can be invoked. Possible values are http and https.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the API Management API, which may include HTML formatting tags.

properties.name: import
properties.description: • import - (Optional) A import block as documented below.

properties.name: service_url
properties.description: • service_url - (Optional) Absolute URL of the backend service implementing this API.

properties.name: soap_pass_through
properties.description: • soap_pass_through - (Optional) Should this API expose a SOAP frontend, rather than a HTTP frontend? Defaults to false.

properties.name: subscription_key_parameter_names
properties.description: • subscription_key_parameter_names - (Optional) A subscription_key_parameter_names block as documented below.
<hr/>
A import block supports the following:

properties.name: content_format
properties.description: • content_format - (Required) The format of the content from which the API Definition should be imported. Possible values are: swagger-json, swagger-link-json, wadl-link-json, wadl-xml, wsdl and wsdl-link.

properties.name: content_value
properties.description: • content_value - (Required) The Content from which the API Definition should be imported. When a content_format of *-link-* is specified this must be a URL, otherwise this must be defined inline.

properties.name: wsdl_selector
properties.description: • wsdl_selector - (Optional) A wsdl_selector block as defined below, which allows you to limit the import of a WSDL to only a subset of the document. This can only be specified when content_format is wsdl or wsdl-link.
<hr/>
A subscription_key_parameter_names block supports the following:

properties.name: header
properties.description: • header - (Required) The name of the HTTP Header which should be used for the Subscription Key.

properties.name: query
properties.description: • query - (Required) The name of the QueryString parameter which should be used for the Subscription Key.
<hr/>
A wsdl_selector block supports the following:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: • service_name - (Required) The name of service to import from WSDL.

properties.name: endpoint_name
properties.description: • endpoint_name - (Required) The name of endpoint (port) to import from WSDL.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: operation_id
properties.description: • operation_id - (Required) A unique identifier for this API Operation. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The name of the API within the API Management Service where this API Operation should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The Name of the API Management Service where the API exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The Display Name for this API Management Operation.

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Required) The HTTP Method used for this API Management Operation, like GET, DELETE, PUT or POST - but not limited to these values.

properties.name: url_template
properties.description: • url_template - (Required) The relative URL Template identifying the target resource for this operation, which may include parameters.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this API Operation, which may include HTML formatting tags.

properties.name: request
properties.description: • request - (Optional) A request block as defined below.

properties.name: response
properties.description: • response - (Optional) One or more response blocks as defined below.

properties.name: template_parameter
properties.description: • template_parameter - (Optional) One or more template_parameter blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A form_parameter block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Form Parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Form Parameter Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Form Parameter, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Form Parameter.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Form Parameter.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Form Parameter.
<hr/>
A header block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Header.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Header Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Header, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Header.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Header.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Header.
<hr/>
A query_parameter block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Query Parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Query Parameter Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Query Parameter, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Query Parameter.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Query Parameter.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Query Parameter.
<hr/>
A request block supports the following:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description of the HTTP Request, which may include HTML tags.

properties.name: header
properties.description: • header - (Optional) One or more header blocks as defined above.

properties.name: query_parameter
properties.description: • query_parameter - (Optional) One or more query_parameter blocks as defined above.

properties.name: representation
properties.description: • representation - (Optional) One or more representation blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A representation block supports the following:

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Required) The Content Type of this representation, such as application/json.

properties.name: form_parameter
properties.description: • form_parameter - (Optional) One or more form_parameter block as defined above.
NOTE: This is Required when content_type is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.

properties.name: sample
properties.description: • sample - (Optional) An example of this representation.

properties.name: schema_id
properties.description: • schema_id - (Optional) The ID of an API Management Schema which represents this Response.
NOTE: This can only be specified when content_type is not set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.

properties.name: type_name
properties.description: (Optional) The Type Name defined by the Schema.
NOTE: This can only be specified when content_type is not set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.
<hr/>
A response block supports the following:

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: • status_code - (Required) The HTTP Status Code.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description of the HTTP Response, which may include HTML tags.

properties.name: header
properties.description: • header - (Optional) One or more header blocks as defined above.

properties.name: representation
properties.description: • representation - (Optional) One or more representation blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A template_parameter block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Template Parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Template Parameter Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Template Parameter, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Template Parameter.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Template Parameter.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Template Parameter.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The ID of the API Management API Operation within the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: xml_content
properties.description: • xml_content - (Optional) The XML Content for this Policy.

properties.name: xml_link
properties.description: • xml_link - (Optional) A link to a Policy XML Document, which must be publicly available.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The ID of the API Management API within the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: xml_content
properties.description: • xml_content - (Optional) The XML Content for this Policy as a string. An XML file can be used here with Terraform's file function that is similar to Microsoft's PolicyFilePath option.

properties.name: xml_link
properties.description: • xml_link - (Optional) A link to a Policy XML Document, which must be publicly available.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: schema_id
properties.description: • schema_id - (Required) A unique identifier for this API Schema. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The name of the API within the API Management Service where this API Schema should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The Name of the API Management Service where the API exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Required) The content type of the API Schema.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The JSON escaped string defining the document representing the Schema.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service where this Subscription should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The display name of this Subscription.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: product_id
properties.description: • product_id - (Required) The ID of the Product which should be assigned to this Subscription. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: • user_id - (Required) The ID of the User which should be assigned to this Subscription. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - (Optional) The state of this Subscription. Possible values are Active, Cancelled, Expired, Rejected, Submitted and Suspended. Defaults to Submitted.

properties.name: subscription_id
properties.description: • subscription_id - (Optional) An Identifier which should used as the ID of this Subscription. If not specified a new Subscription ID will be generated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the API Version Set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service in which the API Version Set should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the parent API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The display name of this API Version Set.

properties.name: versioning_scheme
properties.description: • versioning_scheme - (Required) Specifies where in an Inbound HTTP Request that the API Version should be read from. Possible values are Header, Query and Segment.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of API Version Set.

properties.name: version_header_name
properties.description: • version_header_name - (Optional) The name of the Header which should be read from Inbound Requests which defines the API Version.
NOTE: This must be specified when versioning_scheme is set to Header.

properties.name: version_query_name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the Query String which should be read from Inbound Requests which defines the API Version.
NOTE: This must be specified when versioning_scheme is set to Query.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service in which this Authorization Server should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: authorization_methods
properties.description: • authorization_methods - (Required) The HTTP Verbs supported by the Authorization Endpoint. Possible values are DELETE, GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, PATCH, POST, PUT and TRACE.
NOTE: GET must always be present.

properties.name: authorization_endpoint
properties.description: • authorization_endpoint - (Required) The OAUTH Authorization Endpoint.

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: • client_id - (Required) The Client/App ID registered with this Authorization Server.

properties.name: client_registration_endpoint
properties.description: • client_registration_endpoint - (Required) The URI of page where Client/App Registration is performed for this Authorization Server.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The user-friendly name of this Authorization Server.

properties.name: grant_types
properties.description: • grant_types - (Required) Form of Authorization Grants required when requesting an Access Token. Possible values are authorizationCode, clientCredentials, implicit and resourceOwnerPassword.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of this Authorization Server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>

properties.name: bearer_token_sending_methods
properties.description: • bearer_token_sending_methods - (Optional) The mechanism by which Access Tokens are passed to the API. Possible values are authorizationHeader and query.

properties.name: client_authentication_method
properties.description: • client_authentication_method - (Optional) The Authentication Methods supported by the Token endpoint of this Authorization Server.. Possible values are Basic and Body.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Optional) The Client/App Secret registered with this Authorization Server.

properties.name: default_scope
properties.description: • default_scope - (Optional) The Default Scope used when requesting an Access Token, specified as a string containing space-delimited values.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the Authorization Server, which may contain HTML formatting tags.

properties.name: resource_owner_password

A identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the identity type of the App Service. Possible values are SystemAssigned (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), UserAssigned where you can specify the Service Principal IDs in the identity_ids field, and SystemAssigned, UserAssigned which assigns both a system managed identity as well as the specified user assigned identities.
NOTE: When type is set to SystemAssigned, The assigned principal_id and tenant_id can be retrieved after the App Service has been created. More details are available below.

properties.name: identity_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned. Required if type is UserAssigned.

Possible values are v2.0 (which will use the latest version of the .net framework for the .net CLR v2 - currently .net 3.5) and v4.0 (which corresponds to the latest version of the .net CLR v4 - which at the time of writing is .net 4.7.1). For more information on which .net CLR version to use based on the .net framework you're targeting - please see this table. Defaults to v4.0.

properties.name: ftps_state
properties.description: • ftps_state - (Optional) State of FTP / FTPS service for this App Service. Possible values include: AllAllowed, FtpsOnly and Disabled.

properties.name: http2_enabled
properties.description: • http2_enabled - (Optional) Is HTTP2 Enabled on this App Service? Defaults to false.

properties.name: ip_restriction

properties.name: java_version

properties.description: • java_container - (Optional) The Java Container to use. If specified java_version and java_container_version must also be specified. Possible values are JETTY and TOMCAT.

properties.name: java_container_version
properties.description: • java_container_version - (Optional) The version of the Java Container to use. If specified java_version and java_container must also be specified.

properties.name: local_mysql_enabled
properties.description: • local_mysql_enabled - (Optional) Is "MySQL In App" Enabled? This runs a local MySQL instance with your app and shares resources from the App Service plan.
NOTE: MySQL In App is not intended for production environments and will not scale beyond a single instance. Instead you may wish to use Azure Database for MySQL.

properties.name: linux_fx_version
properties.description: • linux_fx_version - (Optional) Linux App Framework and version for the App Service. Possible options are a Docker container (DOCKER|<user/image:tag>), a base-64 encoded Docker Compose file (COMPOSE|${filebase64("compose.yml")}) or a base-64 encoded Kubernetes Manifest (KUBE|${filebase64("kubernetes.yml")}).

properties.name: windows_fx_version
properties.description: • windows_fx_version - (Optional) The Windows Docker container image (DOCKER|<user/image:tag>)
Additional examples of how to run Containers via the azurerm_app_service resource can be found in the ./examples/app-service directory within the Github Repository.

properties.name: managed_pipeline_mode
properties.description: • managed_pipeline_mode - (Optional) The Managed Pipeline Mode. Possible values are Integrated and Classic. Defaults to Integrated.

properties.name: min_tls_version
properties.description: • min_tls_version - (Optional) The minimum supported TLS version for the app service. Possible values are 1.0, 1.1, and 1.2. Defaults to 1.2 for new app services.

properties.name: php_version
properties.description: • php_version - (Optional) The version of PHP to use in this App Service. Possible values are 5.5, 5.6, 7.0, 7.1 and 7.2.

properties.name: python_version
properties.description: • python_version - (Optional) The version of Python to use in this App Service. Possible values are 2.7 and 3.4.

properties.name: remote_debugging_enabled

properties.name: remote_debugging_version
properties.description: • remote_debugging_version - (Optional) Which version of Visual Studio should the Remote Debugger be compatible with? Possible values are VS2012, VS2013, VS2015 and VS2017.

properties.name: scm_type
properties.description: • scm_type - (Optional) The type of Source Control enabled for this App Service. Defaults to None. Possible values are: BitbucketGit, BitbucketHg, CodePlexGit, CodePlexHg, Dropbox, ExternalGit, ExternalHg, GitHub, LocalGit, None, OneDrive, Tfs, VSO and VSTSRM

properties.name: use_32_bit_worker_process

NOTE: when using an App Service Plan in the Free or Shared Tiers use_32_bit_worker_process must be set to true.

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: • virtual_network_name - (Optional) The name of the Virtual Network which this App Service should be attached to.

properties.name: default_provider
properties.description: • default_provider - (Optional) The default provider to use when multiple providers have been set up. Possible values are AzureActiveDirectory, Facebook, Google, MicrosoftAccount and Twitter.
NOTE: When using multiple providers, the default provider must be set for settings like unauthenticated_client_action to work.

properties.name: facebook
properties.description: • facebook - (Optional) A facebook block as defined below.

properties.name: google
properties.description: • google - (Optional) A google block as defined below.

properties.name: issuer
properties.description: • issuer - (Optional) Issuer URI. When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.

properties.name: microsoft
properties.description: • microsoft - (Optional) A microsoft block as defined below.

properties.name: runtime_version
properties.description: • runtime_version - (Optional) The runtime version of the Authentication/Authorization module.

properties.name: token_refresh_extension_hours
properties.description: • token_refresh_extension_hours - (Optional) The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to call the token refresh API. Defaults to 72.

properties.name: token_store_enabled
properties.description: • token_store_enabled - (Optional) If enabled the module will durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows. Defaults to false.

properties.name: twitter
properties.description: • twitter - (Optional) A twitter block as defined below.

properties.name: unauthenticated_client_action
properties.description: • unauthenticated_client_action - (Optional) The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app. Possible values are AllowAnonymous and RedirectToLoginPage.
<hr/>
A active_directory block supports the following:

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: • client_id - (Required) The Client ID of this relying party application. Enables OpenIDConnection authentication with Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Optional) The Client Secret of this relying party application. If no secret is provided, implicit flow will be used.

properties.name: allowed_audiences
properties.description: • allowed_audiences (Optional) Allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by Azure Active Directory.
<hr/>
A facebook block supports the following:

properties.name: app_id
properties.description: • app_id - (Required) The App ID of the Facebook app used for login

properties.name: app_secret
properties.description: • app_secret - (Required) The App Secret of the Facebook app used for Facebook Login.

properties.name: oauth_scopes
properties.description: • oauth_scopes (Optional) The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Facebook Login authentication. https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login
<hr/>
A google block supports the following:

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: • client_id - (Required) The OpenID Connect Client ID for the Google web application.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Required) The client secret associated with the Google web application.

properties.name: oauth_scopes
properties.description: • oauth_scopes (Optional) The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Google Sign-In authentication. https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/
<hr/>
A ip_restriction block supports the following:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The IP Address used for this IP Restriction.

properties.name: subnet_mask
properties.description: • subnet_mask - (Optional) The Subnet mask used for this IP Restriction. Defaults to 255.255.255.255.

properties.name: virtual_network_subnet_id
properties.description: • virtual_network_subnet_id - (Optional.The Virtual Network Subnet ID used for this IP Restriction.
NOTE: One of either ip_address or virtual_network_subnet_id must be specified
<hr/>
A microsoft block supports the following:

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: • client_id - (Required) The OAuth 2.0 client ID that was created for the app used for authentication.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Required) The OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for authentication.

properties.name: oauth_scopes
properties.description: • oauth_scopes (Optional) The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Microsoft Account authentication. https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631845.aspx
<hr/>
A backup block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name (Required) Specifies the name for this Backup.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is this Backup enabled?

properties.name: storage_account_url
properties.description: • storage_account_url (Optional) The SAS URL to a Storage Container where Backups should be saved.

properties.name: schedule
properties.description: • schedule - (Optional) A schedule block as defined below.
<hr/>
A schedule block supports the following:

properties.name: frequency_interval
properties.description: • frequency_interval - (Required) Sets how often the backup should be executed.

properties.name: frequency_unit
properties.description: • frequency_unit - (Optional) Sets the unit of time for how often the backup should be executed. Possible values are Day or Hour.

properties.name: keep_at_least_one_backup
properties.description: • keep_at_least_one_backup - (Optional) Should at least one backup always be kept in the Storage Account by the Retention Policy, regardless of how old it is?

properties.name: retention_period_in_days
properties.description: • retention_period_in_days - (Optional) Specifies the number of days after which Backups should be deleted.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: • start_time - (Optional) Sets when the schedule should start working.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the App Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: app_service_name
properties.description: • app_service_name - (Required) The name of the App Service within which the Slot exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: app_service_slot_name
properties.description: • app_service_slot_name - (Required) The name of the App Service Slot which should be promoted to the Production Slot within the App Service.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the certificate. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the certificate. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: pfx_blob
properties.description: • pfx_blob - (Optional) The base64-encoded contents of the certificate. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: Either pfx_blob or key_vault_secret_id must be set - but not both.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The password to access the certificate's private key. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: key_vault_secret_id
properties.description: • key_vault_secret_id - (Optional) The ID of the Key Vault secret. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the Custom Hostname to use for the App Service, example www.example.com. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: A CNAME needs to be configured from this Hostname to the Azure Website - otherwise Azure will reject the Hostname Binding.

properties.name: app_service_name
properties.description: • app_service_name - (Required) The name of the App Service in which to add the Custom Hostname Binding. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the App Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ssl_state
properties.description: • ssl_state - (Optional) The SSL type. Possible values are IpBasedEnabled and SniEnabled. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: thumbprint
properties.description: • thumbprint - (Optional) The SSL certificate thumbprint. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: thumbprint must be specified when ssl_state is set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the App Service Plan component. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the App Service Plan component.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: • kind - (Optional) The kind of the App Service Plan to create. Possible values are Windows (also available as App), Linux, elastic (for Premium Consumption) and FunctionApp (for a Consumption Plan). Defaults to Windows. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: When creating a Linux App Service Plan, the reserved field must be set to true.

properties.name: maximum_elastic_worker_count
properties.description: • maximum_elastic_worker_count - The maximum number of total workers allowed for this ElasticScaleEnabled App Service Plan.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) A sku block as documented below.

properties.name: app_service_environment_id
properties.description: • app_service_environment_id - (Optional) The ID of the App Service Environment where the App Service Plan should be located. Changing forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: Attaching to an App Service Environment requires the App Service Plan use a Premium SKU (when using an ASEv1) and the Isolated SKU (for an ASEv2).

properties.name: reserved
properties.description: • reserved - (Optional) Is this App Service Plan Reserved. Defaults to false.

properties.name: per_site_scaling
properties.description: • per_site_scaling - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to false apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan. Defaults to false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
sku supports the following:

properties.name: tier
properties.description: • tier - (Required) Specifies the plan's pricing tier.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Specifies the plan's instance size.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Optional) Specifies the number of workers associated with this App Service Plan.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the App Service Slot component. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the App Service Slot component.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: app_service_plan_id
properties.description: • app_service_plan_id - (Required) The ID of the App Service Plan within which to create this App Service Slot. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: app_service_name
properties.description: • app_service_name - (Required) The name of the App Service within which to create the App Service Slot. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: app_settings
properties.description: • app_settings - (Optional) A key-value pair of App Settings.

properties.name: auth_settings
properties.description: • auth_settings - (Optional) A auth_settings block as defined below.

properties.name: connection_string
properties.description: • connection_string - (Optional) An connection_string block as defined below.

properties.name: client_affinity_enabled
properties.description: • client_affinity_enabled - (Optional) Should the App Service Slot send session affinity cookies, which route client requests in the same session to the same instance?

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Is the App Service Slot Enabled?

properties.name: https_only
properties.description: • https_only - (Optional) Can the App Service Slot only be accessed via HTTPS? Defaults to false.

properties.name: site_config
properties.description: • site_config - (Optional) A site_config object as defined below.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) A Managed Service Identity block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
connection_string supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Connection String.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of the Connection String. Possible values are APIHub, Custom, DocDb, EventHub, MySQL, NotificationHub, PostgreSQL, RedisCache, ServiceBus, SQLAzure and SQLServer.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value for the Connection String.
<hr/>
site_config supports the following:

properties.name: app_command_line
properties.description: • app_command_line - (Optional) App command line to launch, e.g. /sbin/myserver -b 0.0.0.0.

properties.name: always_on
properties.description: • always_on - (Optional) Should the app be loaded at all times? Defaults to false.

properties.name: cors
properties.description: • cors - (Optional) A cors block as defined below.

properties.name: default_documents
properties.description: • default_documents - (Optional) The ordering of default documents to load, if an address isn't specified.

properties.name: dotnet_framework_version
properties.description: • dotnet_framework_version - (Optional) The version of the .net framework's CLR used in this App Service Slot. Possible values are v2.0 (which will use the latest version of the .net framework for the .net CLR v2 - currently .net 3.5) and v4.0 (which corresponds to the latest version of the .net CLR v4 - which at the time of writing is .net 4.7.1). For more information on which .net CLR version to use based on the .net framework you're targeting - please see this table. Defaults to v4.0.

properties.name: http2_enabled
properties.description: • http2_enabled - (Optional) Is HTTP2 Enabled on this App Service? Defaults to false.

properties.name: ip_restriction
properties.description: • ip_restriction - (Optional) A List of objects representing ip restrictions as defined below.

properties.name: java_container
properties.description: • java_container - (Optional) The Java Container to use. If specified java_version and java_container_version must also be specified. Possible values are JETTY and TOMCAT.

properties.name: java_container_version
properties.description: • java_container_version - (Optional) The version of the Java Container to use. If specified java_version and java_container must also be specified.

properties.name: java_version
properties.description: • java_version - (Optional) The version of Java to use. If specified java_container and java_container_version must also be specified. Possible values are 1.7, 1.8 and 11.

properties.name: local_mysql_enabled
properties.description: • local_mysql_enabled - (Optional) Is "MySQL In App" Enabled? This runs a local MySQL instance with your app and shares resources from the App Service plan.
NOTE: MySQL In App is not intended for production environments and will not scale beyond a single instance. Instead you may wish to use Azure Database for MySQL.

properties.name: managed_pipeline_mode
properties.description: • managed_pipeline_mode - (Optional) The Managed Pipeline Mode. Possible values are Integrated and Classic. Defaults to Integrated.

properties.name: min_tls_version
properties.description: • min_tls_version - (Optional) The minimum supported TLS version for the app service. Possible values are 1.0, 1.1, and 1.2. Defaults to 1.2 for new app services.

properties.name: php_version
properties.description: • php_version - (Optional) The version of PHP to use in this App Service Slot. Possible values are 5.5, 5.6, 7.0, 7.1 and 7.2.

properties.name: python_version
properties.description: • python_version - (Optional) The version of Python to use in this App Service Slot. Possible values are 2.7 and 3.4.

properties.name: remote_debugging_enabled
properties.description: • remote_debugging_enabled - (Optional) Is Remote Debugging Enabled? Defaults to false.

properties.name: remote_debugging_version
properties.description: • remote_debugging_version - (Optional) Which version of Visual Studio should the Remote Debugger be compatible with? Possible values are VS2012, VS2013, VS2015 and VS2017.

properties.name: scm_type
properties.description: • scm_type - (Optional) The type of Source Control enabled for this App Service Slot. Defaults to None. Possible values are: BitbucketGit, BitbucketHg, CodePlexGit, CodePlexHg, Dropbox, ExternalGit, ExternalHg, GitHub, LocalGit, None, OneDrive, Tfs, VSO and VSTSRM

properties.name: use_32_bit_worker_process
properties.description: • use_32_bit_worker_process - (Optional) Should the App Service Slot run in 32 bit mode, rather than 64 bit mode?
Note: Deployment Slots are not supported in the Free, Shared, or Basic App Service Plans.

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: • virtual_network_name - (Optional) The name of the Virtual Network which this App Service Slot should be attached to.

properties.name: websockets_enabled
properties.description: • websockets_enabled - (Optional) Should WebSockets be enabled?
<hr/>
A cors block supports the following:

properties.name: allowed_origins
properties.description: • allowed_origins - (Optional) A list of origins which should be able to make cross-origin calls. * can be used to allow all calls.

properties.name: support_credentials
properties.description: • support_credentials - (Optional) Are credentials supported?

properties.name: allowed_external_redirect_urls

properties.name: token_refresh_extension_hours

properties.name: token_store_enabled

properties.name: twitter

A identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the identity type of the App Service. Possible values are SystemAssigned (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), UserAssigned where you can specify the Service Principal IDs in the identity_ids field, and SystemAssigned, UserAssigned which assigns both a system managed identity as well as the specified user assigned identities.
NOTE: When type is set to SystemAssigned, The assigned principal_id and tenant_id can be retrieved after the App Service has been created. More details are available below.

properties.name: identity_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned. Required if type is UserAssigned.

Important Default key pairs: ("WEBSITE_RUN_FROM_PACKAGE" = "", "FUNCTIONS_WORKER_RUNTIME" = "node" (or python, etc), "WEBSITE_NODE_DEFAULT_VERSION" = "10.14.1", "APPINSIGHTS_INSTRUMENTATIONKEY" = "").

properties.description: • websockets_enabled - (Optional) Should WebSockets be enabled?

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: • virtual_network_name - (Optional) The name of the Virtual Network which this App Service should be attached to.

properties.name: linux_fx_version
properties.description: • linux_fx_version - (Optional) Linux App Framework and version for the AppService, e.g. DOCKER|(golang:latest).

properties.name: cors

A cors block supports the following:

properties.name: allowed_origins
properties.description: • allowed_origins - (Optional) A list of origins which should be able to make cross-origin calls. * can be used to allow all calls.

properties.name: support_credentials
properties.description: • support_credentials - (Optional) Are credentials supported?
<hr/>
identity supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the identity type of the App Service. At this time the only allowed value is SystemAssigned.
<hr/>
An auth_settings block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is Authentication enabled?

properties.name: active_directory
properties.description: • active_directory - (Optional) A active_directory block as defined below.

properties.name: additional_login_params
properties.description: • additional_login_params - (Optional) Login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".

properties.name: allowed_external_redirect_urls
properties.description: • allowed_external_redirect_urls - (Optional) External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the app.

properties.name: default_provider
properties.description: • default_provider - (Optional) The default provider to use when multiple providers have been set up. Possible values are AzureActiveDirectory, Facebook, Google, MicrosoftAccount and Twitter.
NOTE: When using multiple providers, the default provider must be set for settings like unauthenticated_client_action to work.

properties.name: facebook
properties.description: • facebook - (Optional) A facebook block as defined below.

properties.name: google
properties.description: • google - (Optional) A google block as defined below.

properties.name: issuer
properties.description: • issuer - (Optional) Issuer URI. When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.

properties.name: microsoft
properties.description: • microsoft - (Optional) A microsoft block as defined below.

properties.name: runtime_version
properties.description: • runtime_version - (Optional) The runtime version of the Authentication/Authorization module.

properties.name: token_refresh_extension_hours
properties.description: • token_refresh_extension_hours - (Optional) The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to call the token refresh API. Defaults to 72.

properties.name: token_store_enabled
properties.description: • token_store_enabled - (Optional) If enabled the module will durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows. Defaults to false.

properties.name: twitter
properties.description: • twitter - (Optional) A twitter block as defined below.

properties.name: unauthenticated_client_action
properties.description: • unauthenticated_client_action - (Optional) The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app. Possible values are AllowAnonymous and RedirectToLoginPage.

properties.description: • client_id - (Required) The Client ID of this relying party application. Enables OpenIDConnection authentication with Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Optional) The Client Secret of this relying party application. If no secret is provided, implicit flow will be used.

properties.description: • allowed_audiences (Optional) Allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: oauth_scopes

properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • application_type - (Required) Specifies the type of Application Insights to create. Valid values are ios for iOS, java for Java web, MobileCenter for App Center, Node.JS for Node.js, other for General, phone for Windows Phone, store for Windows Store and web for ASP.NET. Please note these values are case sensitive; unmatched values are treated as ASP.NET by Azure. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Application Insights API key. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • application_insights_id - (Required) The ID of the Application Insights component on which the API key operates. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: read_permissions
properties.description: • read_permissions - (Optional) Specifies the list of read permissions granted to the API key. Valid values are agentconfig, aggregate, api, draft, extendqueries, search. Please note these values are case sensitive. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: write_permissions
properties.description: • write_permissions - (Optional) Specifies the list of write permissions granted to the API key. Valid values are annotations. Please note these values are case sensitive. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: At least one read or write permission must be defined.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: • frequency - (Optional) Interval in seconds between test runs for this WebTest. Default is 300.

properties.description: • timeout - (Optional) Seconds until this WebTest will timeout and fail. Default is 30.

Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • principal_id - (Required) The ID of the Principal (User, Group, Service Principal, or Application) to assign the Role Definition to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: The Principal ID is also known as the Object ID (ie not the "Application ID" for applications).

properties.name: skip_service_principal_aad_check
properties.description: (Optional) If the principal_id is a newly provisioned Service Principal set this value to true to skip the Azure Active Directory check which may fail due to replication lag. This argument is only valid if the principal_id is a Service Principal identity. If it is not a Service Principal identity it will cause the role assignment to fail. Defaults to false.
