properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Batch account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: To work around a bug in the Azure API this property is currently treated as case-insensitive. A future version of Terraform will require that the casing is correct.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: pool_allocation_mode
properties.description: • pool_allocation_mode - (Optional) Specifies the mode to use for pool allocation. Possible values are BatchService or UserSubscription. Defaults to BatchService.
NOTE: When using UserSubscription mode, an Azure KeyVault reference has to be specified. See key_vault_reference below.
NOTE: When using UserSubscription mode, the Microsoft Azure Batch service principal has to have Contributor role on your subscription scope, as documented here.

properties.name: key_vault_reference
properties.description: • key_vault_reference - (Optional) A key_vault_reference block that describes the Azure KeyVault reference to use when deploying the Azure Batch account using the UserSubscription pool allocation mode.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Optional) Specifies the storage account to use for the Batch account. If not specified, Azure Batch will manage the storage.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
A key_vault_reference block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) The Azure identifier of the Azure KeyVault to use.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The HTTPS URL of the Azure KeyVault to use.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the application. This must be unique within the account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: • account_name - (Required) The name of the Batch account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: allow_updates
properties.description: • allow_updates - (Optional) A value indicating whether packages within the application may be overwritten using the same version string. Defaults to true.

properties.name: default_version
properties.description: • default_version - (Optional) The package to use if a client requests the application but does not specify a version. This property can only be set to the name of an existing package.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) The display name for the application.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: • account_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Batch account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Batch account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Required) The base64-encoded contents of the certificate.

properties.name: format
properties.description: • format - (Required) The format of the certificate. Possible values are Cer or Pfx.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The password to access the certificate's private key. This must and can only be specified when format is Pfx.

properties.name: thumbprint
properties.description: • thumbprint - (Required) The thumbprint of the certificate. At this time the only supported value is 'SHA1'.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Batch pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Batch pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: To work around a bug in the Azure API this property is currently treated as case-insensitive. A future version of Terraform will require that the casing is correct.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: • account_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Batch account in which the pool will be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: node_agent_sku_id
properties.description: • node_agent_sku_id - (Required) Specifies the Sku of the node agents that will be created in the Batch pool.

properties.name: vm_size
properties.description: • vm_size - (Required) Specifies the size of the VM created in the Batch pool.

properties.name: storage_image_reference
properties.description: • storage_image_reference - (Required) A storage_image_reference for the virtual machines that will compose the Batch pool.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) Specifies the display name of the Batch pool.

properties.name: max_tasks_per_node
properties.description: • max_tasks_per_node - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool. Defaults to 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: fixed_scale
properties.description: • fixed_scale - (Optional) A fixed_scale block that describes the scale settings when using fixed scale.

properties.name: auto_scale
properties.description: • auto_scale - (Optional) A auto_scale block that describes the scale settings when using auto scale.

properties.name: start_task
properties.description: • start_task - (Optional) A start_task block that describes the start task settings for the Batch pool.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) One or more certificate blocks that describe the certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

properties.name: container_configuration
properties.description: • container_configuration - (Optional) The container configuration used in the pool's VMs.

NOTE: For Windows compute nodes, the Batch service installs the certificates to the specified certificate store and location. For Linux compute nodes, the certificates are stored in a directory inside the task working directory and an environment variable AZ_BATCH_CERTIFICATES_DIR is supplied to the task to query for this location. For certificates with visibility of remoteUser, a certs directory is created in the user's home directory (e.g., /home/{user-name}/certs) and certificates are placed in that directory.
Please Note: fixed_scale and auto_scale blocks cannot be used both at the same time.
<hr/>
A storage_image_reference block supports the following:
This block provisions virtual machines in the Batch Pool from one of two sources: an Azure Platform Image (e.g. Ubuntu/Windows Server) or a Custom Image.
To provision from an Azure Platform Image, the following fields are applicable:

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machines. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: • offer - (Required) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machines. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machines. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machines. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
To provision a Custom Image, the following fields are applicable:

properties.name: id-required-specifies-the-id-of-the-custom-image-which-the-virtual-machines-should-be-created-from-changing-this-forces-a-new-resource-to-be-created-see-official-documentation-for-more-details-
properties.description: » * id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the Custom Image which the virtual machines should be created from. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. See official documentation for more details.
A fixed_scale block supports the following:

properties.name: target_dedicated_nodes
properties.description: • target_dedicated_nodes - (Optional) The number of nodes in the Batch pool. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: target_low_priority_nodes
properties.description: • target_low_priority_nodes - (Optional) The number of low priority nodes in the Batch pool. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: resize_timeout
properties.description: • resize_timeout - (Optional) The timeout for resize operations. Defaults to PT15M.
<hr/>
A auto_scale block supports the following:

properties.name: evaluation_interval
properties.description: • evaluation_interval - (Optional) The interval to wait before evaluating if the pool needs to be scaled. Defaults to PT15M.

properties.name: formula
properties.description: • formula - (Required) The autoscale formula that needs to be used for scaling the Batch pool.
<hr/>
A start_task block supports the following:

properties.name: command_line
properties.description: • command_line - (Required) The command line executed by the start task.

properties.name: max_task_retry_count
properties.description: • max_task_retry_count - (Optional) The number of retry count. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: wait_for_success
properties.description: • wait_for_success - (Optional) A flag that indicates if the Batch pool should wait for the start task to be completed. Default to false.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: • environment - (Optional) A map of strings (key,value) that represents the environment variables to set in the start task.

properties.name: user_identity
properties.description: • user_identity - (Required) A user_identity block that describes the user identity under which the start task runs.

properties.name: resource_file
properties.description: • resource_file - (Optional) One or more resource_file blocks that describe the files to be downloaded to a compute node.
<hr/>
A user_identity block supports the following:

properties.name: user_name
properties.description: • user_name - (Optional) The username to be used by the Batch pool start task.

properties.name: auto_user
properties.description: • auto_user - (Optional) A auto_user block that describes the user identity under which the start task runs.
Please Note: user_name and auto_user blocks cannot be used both at the same time, but you need to define one or the other.
<hr/>
A auto_user block supports the following:

properties.name: elevation_level
properties.description: • elevation_level - (Optional) The elevation level of the user identity under which the start task runs. Possible values are Admin or NonAdmin. Defaults to NonAdmin.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: • scope - (Optional) The scope of the user identity under which the start task runs. Possible values are Task or Pool. Defaults to Task.
<hr/>
A certificate block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) The ID of the Batch Certificate to install on the Batch Pool, which must be inside the same Batch Account.

properties.name: store_location
properties.description: • store_location - (Required) The location of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate. Possible values are CurrentUser or LocalMachine.

NOTE: This property is applicable only for pools configured with Windows nodes (that is, created with cloudServiceConfiguration, or with virtualMachineConfiguration using a Windows image reference). For Linux compute nodes, the certificates are stored in a directory inside the task working directory and an environment variable AZ_BATCH_CERTIFICATES_DIR is supplied to the task to query for this location. For certificates with visibility of remoteUser, a 'certs' directory is created in the user's home directory (e.g., /home/{user-name}/certs) and certificates are placed in that directory.

properties.name: store_name
properties.description: • store_name - (Optional) The name of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate. This property is applicable only for pools configured with Windows nodes (that is, created with cloudServiceConfiguration, or with virtualMachineConfiguration using a Windows image reference). Common store names include: My, Root, CA, Trust, Disallowed, TrustedPeople, TrustedPublisher, AuthRoot, AddressBook, but any custom store name can also be used. The default value is My.

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: • visibility - (Optional) Which user accounts on the compute node should have access to the private data of the certificate.
<hr/>
A container_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of container configuration. Possible value is DockerCompatible.

properties.name: container_registries
properties.description: • container_registries - (Optional) Additional container registries from which container images can be pulled by the pool's VMs.
<hr/>
A resource_file block supports the following:

properties.name: auto_storage_container_name
properties.description: • auto_storage_container_name - (Optional) The storage container name in the auto storage account.

properties.name: blob_prefix
properties.description: • blob_prefix - (Optional) The blob prefix to use when downloading blobs from an Azure Storage container. Only the blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix will be downloaded. The property is valid only when auto_storage_container_name or storage_container_url is used. This prefix can be a partial filename or a subdirectory. If a prefix is not specified, all the files in the container will be downloaded.

properties.name: file_mode
properties.description: • file_mode - (Optional) The file permission mode represented as a string in octal format (e.g. "0644"). This property applies only to files being downloaded to Linux compute nodes. It will be ignored if it is specified for a resource_file which will be downloaded to a Windows node. If this property is not specified for a Linux node, then a default value of 0770 is applied to the file.

properties.name: file_path
properties.description: • file_path - (Optional) The location on the compute node to which to download the file, relative to the task's working directory. If the http_url property is specified, the file_path is required and describes the path which the file will be downloaded to, including the filename. Otherwise, if the auto_storage_container_name or storage_container_url property is specified, file_path is optional and is the directory to download the files to. In the case where file_path is used as a directory, any directory structure already associated with the input data will be retained in full and appended to the specified filePath directory. The specified relative path cannot break out of the task's working directory (for example by using '..').

properties.name: http_url
properties.description: • http_url - (Optional) The URL of the file to download. If the URL is Azure Blob Storage, it must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob. There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage: include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob, or set the ACL for the blob or its container to allow public access.

properties.name: storage_container_url
properties.description: • storage_container_url - (Optional) The URL of the blob container within Azure Blob Storage. This URL must be readable and listable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob. There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage: include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read and list permissions on the blob, or set the ACL for the blob or its container to allow public access.
Please Note: Exactly one of auto_storage_container_name, storage_container_url and auto_user must be specified.
<hr/>
A container_registries block supports the following:

properties.name: registry_server
properties.description: • registry_server - (Optional) The container registry URL. The default is "docker.io". Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: user_name
properties.description: • user_name - (Optional) The user name to log into the registry server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The password to log into the registry server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: platform_update_domain_count
properties.description: • platform_update_domain_count - (Optional) Specifies the number of update domains that are used. Defaults to 5.
NOTE: The number of Update Domains varies depending on which Azure Region you're using - a list can be found here.

properties.name: platform_fault_domain_count
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of fault domains that are used. Defaults to 3.
NOTE: The number of Fault Domains varies depending on which Azure Region you're using - a list can be found here.

properties.name: proximity_placement_group_id
properties.description: • proximity_placement_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Proximity Placement Group to which this Virtual Machine should be assigned. Changing this forces a new resource to be created

properties.name: managed
properties.description: • managed - (Optional) Specifies whether the availability set is managed or not. Possible values are true (to specify aligned) or false (to specify classic). Default is false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) Specified the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_virtual_machine_id
properties.description: (Optional) The Virtual Machine ID from which to create the image.

properties.name: os_disk
properties.description: (Optional) One or more os_disk elements as defined below.

properties.name: data_disk
properties.description: (Optional) One or more data_disk elements as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zone_resilient
properties.description: (Optional) Is zone resiliency enabled? Defaults to false. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: zone_resilient can only be set to true if the image is stored in a region that supports availability zones.
os_disk supports the following:

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the type of operating system contained in the the virtual machine image. Possible values are: Windows or Linux.

properties.name: os_state
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the state of the operating system contained in the blob. Currently, the only value is Generalized.

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of the managed disk resource that you want to use to create the image.

properties.name: blob_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the URI in Azure storage of the blob that you want to use to create the image.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching mode as ReadWrite, ReadOnly, or None. The default is None.

properties.name: size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the size of the image to be created. The target size can't be smaller than the source size.
data_disk supports the following:

properties.name: lun
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk.

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of the managed disk resource that you want to use to create the image.

properties.name: blob_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the URI in Azure storage of the blob that you want to use to create the image.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching mode as ReadWrite, ReadOnly, or None. The default is None.

properties.name: size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the size of the image to be created. The target size can't be smaller than the source size.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the managed disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the managed disk.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specified the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_type
properties.description: • storage_account_type - (Required) The type of storage to use for the managed disk. Allowable values are Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS or UltraSSD_LRS.

Note: A storage_account_type of type UltraSSD_LRS and the arguments disk_iops_read_write and disk_mbps_read_write are currently in private preview and are not available to subscriptions that have not requested onboarding to Azure Ultra Disk Storage private preview. Azure Ultra Disk Storage is only available in East US 2, North Europe, and Southeast Asia regions. For more information see the Azure Ultra Disk Storage product documentation, product blog and FAQ.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: create_option - (Required) The method to use when creating the managed disk. Possible values include:

properties.name: Import
properties.description: Import a VHD file in to the managed disk (VHD specified with source_uri).

properties.name: Empty
properties.description: Create an empty managed disk.

properties.name: Copy
properties.description: Copy an existing managed disk or snapshot (specified with source_resource_id).

properties.name: FromImage
properties.description: Copy a Platform Image (specified with image_reference_id)

properties.name: Restore
properties.description: Set by Azure Backup or Site Recovery on a restored disk (specified with source_resource_id).

properties.name: source_uri
properties.description: • source_uri - (Optional) URI to a valid VHD file to be used when create_option is Import.

properties.name: source_resource_id
properties.description: • source_resource_id - (Optional) ID of an existing managed disk to copy create_option is Copy or the recovery point to restore when create_option is Restore

properties.name: image_reference_id
properties.description: • image_reference_id - (Optional) ID of an existing platform/marketplace disk image to copy when create_option is FromImage.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Optional) Specify a value when the source of an Import or Copy operation targets a source that contains an operating system. Valid values are Linux or Windows

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: • disk_size_gb - (Optional, Required for a new managed disk) Specifies the size of the managed disk to create in gigabytes. If create_option is Copy or FromImage, then the value must be equal to or greater than the source's size.

properties.name: disk_iops_read_write
properties.description: • disk_iops_read_write - (Optional) The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes.

properties.name: disk_mbps_read_write
properties.description: • disk_mbps_read_write - (Optional) The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second.

properties.name: encryption_settings
properties.description: • encryption_settings - (Optional) an encryption_settings block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A collection containing the availability zone to allocate the Managed Disk in.
Note: Availability Zones are only supported in select regions at this time.
For more information on managed disks, such as sizing options and pricing, please check out the azure documentation.
<hr/>
encryption_settings supports:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Is Encryption enabled on this Managed Disk? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: disk_encryption_key
properties.description: (Optional) A disk_encryption_key block as defined below.

properties.name: key_encryption_key
properties.description: (Optional) A key_encryption_key block as defined below.
disk_encryption_key supports:

properties.name: secret_url
properties.description: • secret_url - (Required) The URL to the Key Vault Secret used as the Disk Encryption Key. This can be found as id on the azurerm_key_vault_secret resource.

properties.name: source_vault_id
properties.description: • source_vault_id - (Required) The URL of the Key Vault. This can be found as vault_uri on the azurerm_key_vault resource.
key_encryption_key supports:

properties.name: key_url
properties.description: • key_url - (Required) The URL to the Key Vault Key used as the Key Encryption Key. This can be found as id on the azurerm_key_vault_key resource.

properties.name: source_vault_id
properties.description: • source_vault_id - (Required) The URL of the Key Vault. This can be found as vault_uri on the azurerm_key_vault resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: offer
properties.description: • offer - (Required) The Offer of the Marketplace Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: • plan - (Required) The Plan of the Marketplace Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) The Publisher of the Marketplace Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Snapshot resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Snapshot. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: • create_option - (Required) Indicates how the snapshot is to be created. Possible values are Copy or Import. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: One of source_uri, source_resource_id or storage_account_id must be specified.

properties.name: source_uri
properties.description: • source_uri - (Optional) Specifies the URI to a Managed or Unmanaged Disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_resource_id
properties.description: • source_resource_id - (Optional) Specifies a reference to an existing snapshot, when create_option is Copy. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of an storage account. Used with source_uri to allow authorization during import of unmanaged blobs from a different subscription. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: • disk_size_gb - (Optional) The size of the Snapshotted Disk in GB.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Shared Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gallery_name
properties.description: • gallery_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Shared Image Gallery in which this Shared Image should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the Shared Image Gallery exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the Shared Image Gallery exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: • identifier - (Required) An identifier block as defined below.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Required) The type of Operating System present in this Shared Image. Possible values are Linux and Windows.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Shared Image.

properties.name: eula
properties.description: • eula - (Optional) The End User Licence Agreement for the Shared Image.

properties.name: privacy_statement_uri
properties.description: • privacy_statement_uri - (Optional) The URI containing the Privacy Statement associated with this Shared Image.

properties.name: release_note_uri
properties.description: • release_note_uri - (Optional) The URI containing the Release Notes associated with this Shared Image.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Shared Image.
<hr/>
A identifier block supports the following:

properties.name: offer
properties.description: • offer - (Required) The Offer Name for this Shared Image.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) The Publisher Name for this Gallery Image.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) The Name of the SKU for this Gallery Image.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Shared Image Gallery. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Shared Image Gallery. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this Shared Image Gallery.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Shared Image Gallery.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The version number for this Image Version, such as 1.0.0. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gallery_name
properties.description: • gallery_name - (Required) The name of the Shared Image Gallery in which the Shared Image exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: image_name
properties.description: • image_name - (Required) The name of the Shared Image within the Shared Image Gallery in which this Version should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure Region in which the Shared Image Gallery exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the Shared Image Gallery exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: managed_image_id
properties.description: • managed_image_id - (Required) The ID of the Managed Image which should be used for this Shared Image Version. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: The ID can be sourced from the azurerm_image Data Source or Resource.

properties.name: target_region
properties.description: • target_region - (Required) One or more target_region blocks as documented below.

properties.name: exclude_from_latest
properties.description: • exclude_from_latest - (Optional) Should this Image Version be excluded from the latest filter? If set to true this Image Version won't be returned for the latest version. Defaults to false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A collection of tags which should be applied to this resource.
<hr/>
The target_region block exports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Azure Region in which this Image Version should exist.

properties.name: regional_replica_count
properties.description: • regional_replica_count - (Required) The number of replicas of the Image Version to be created per region.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Resource Group in which the Virtual Machine should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the Azure Region where the Virtual Machine exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_interface_ids
properties.description: • network_interface_ids - (Required) A list of Network Interface ID's which should be associated with the Virtual Machine.

properties.name: os_profile_linux_config
properties.description: • os_profile_linux_config - (Required, when a Linux machine) A os_profile_linux_config block.

properties.name: os_profile_windows_config
properties.description: • os_profile_windows_config - (Required, when a Windows machine) A os_profile_windows_config block.

properties.name: vm_size
properties.description: • vm_size - (Required) Specifies the size of the Virtual Machine.
<hr/>

properties.name: availability_set_id
properties.description: • availability_set_id - (Optional) The ID of the Availability Set in which the Virtual Machine should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: boot_diagnostics
properties.description: • boot_diagnostics - (Optional) A boot_diagnostics block.

properties.name: additional_capabilities
properties.description: • additional_capabilities - (Optional) A additional_capabilities block.

properties.name: delete_os_disk_on_termination
properties.description: • delete_os_disk_on_termination - (Optional) Should the OS Disk (either the Managed Disk / VHD Blob) be deleted when the Virtual Machine is destroyed? Defaults to false.
Note: This setting works when instance is deleted via Terraform only and don't forget to delete disks manually if you deleted VM manually. It can increase spending.

properties.name: delete_data_disks_on_termination
properties.description: (Optional) Should the Data Disks (either the Managed Disks / VHD Blobs) be deleted when the Virtual Machine is destroyed? Defaults to false.
Note: This setting works when instance is deleted via Terraform only and don't forget to delete disks manually if you deleted VM manually. It can increase spending.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) A identity block.

properties.name: license_type
properties.description: • license_type - (Optional) Specifies the BYOL Type for this Virtual Machine. This is only applicable to Windows Virtual Machines. Possible values are Windows_Client and Windows_Server.

properties.name: os_profile
properties.description: • os_profile - (Optional) An os_profile block. Required when create_option in the storage_os_disk block is set to FromImage.

properties.name: os_profile_secrets
properties.description: • os_profile_secrets - (Optional) One or more os_profile_secrets blocks.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: • plan - (Optional) A plan block.

properties.name: primary_network_interface_id
properties.description: • primary_network_interface_id - (Optional) The ID of the Network Interface (which must be attached to the Virtual Machine) which should be the Primary Network Interface for this Virtual Machine.

properties.name: proximity_placement_group_id
properties.description: • proximity_placement_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Proximity Placement Group to which this Virtual Machine should be assigned. Changing this forces a new resource to be created

properties.name: storage_data_disk
properties.description: • storage_data_disk - (Optional) One or more storage_data_disk blocks.
Please Note: Data Disks can also be attached either using this block or the azurerm_virtual_machine_data_disk_attachment resource - but not both.

properties.name: storage_image_reference
properties.description: • storage_image_reference - (Optional) A storage_image_reference block.

properties.name: storage_os_disk
properties.description: • storage_os_disk - (Required) A storage_os_disk block.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Virtual Machine.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A list of a single item of the Availability Zone which the Virtual Machine should be allocated in.
Please Note: Availability Zones are only supported in several regions at this time.
For more information on the different example configurations, please check out the Azure documentation
<hr/>
A additional_unattend_config block supports the following:

properties.name: pass
properties.description: • pass - (Required) Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to. The only allowable value is oobeSystem.

properties.name: component
properties.description: • component - (Required) Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content. The only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

properties.name: setting_name
properties.description: • setting_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies. Possible values are: FirstLogonCommands and AutoLogon.

properties.name: content
properties.description: • content - (Optional) Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.
<hr/>
A boot_diagnostics block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Should Boot Diagnostics be enabled for this Virtual Machine?

properties.name: storage_uri
properties.description: • storage_uri - (Required) The Storage Account's Blob Endpoint which should hold the virtual machine's diagnostic files.
NOTE: This needs to be the root of a Storage Account and not a Storage Container.
<hr/>
A additional_capabilities block supports the following:

properties.name: ultra_ssd_enabled
properties.description: (Required) Should Ultra SSD disk be enabled for this Virtual Machine?

Note: Azure Ultra Disk Storage is currently in preview and are not available to subscriptions that have not requested onboarding to Azure Ultra Disk Storage preview. Azure Ultra Disk Storage is only available in East US 2, North Europe, and Southeast Asia regions. For more information see the Azure Ultra Disk Storage product documentation, product blog and FAQ.
<hr/>
A identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The Managed Service Identity Type of this Virtual Machine. Possible values are SystemAssigned (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), UserAssigned (where you can specify the Service Principal ID's) to be used by this Virtual Machine using the identity_ids field, and SystemAssigned, UserAssigned which assigns both a system managed identity as well as the specified user assigned identities.
NOTE: Managed Service Identity previously required the installation of a VM Extension, but this information is now available via the Azure Instance Metadata Service.

NOTE: When type is set to SystemAssigned, identity the Principal ID can be retrieved after the virtual machine has been created. More details are available below. See documentation for additional information.

properties.name: identity_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned to the VM. Required if type is UserAssigned.
<hr/>
A os_profile block supports the following:

properties.name: computer_name
properties.description: • computer_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Virtual Machine.

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: • admin_username - (Required) Specifies the name of the local administrator account.

properties.name: admin_password
properties.description: • admin_password - (Required for Windows, Optional for Linux) The password associated with the local administrator account.
NOTE: If using Linux, it may be preferable to use SSH Key authentication (available in the os_profile_linux_config block) instead of password authentication.

NOTE: admin_password must be between 6-72 characters long and must satisfy at least 3 of password complexity requirements from the following: 1. Contains an uppercase character 2. Contains a lowercase character 3. Contains a numeric digit 4. Contains a special character

properties.name: custom_data
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies custom data to supply to the machine. On Linux-based systems, this can be used as a cloud-init script. On other systems, this will be copied as a file on disk. Internally, Terraform will base64 encode this value before sending it to the API. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
<hr/>
A os_profile_linux_config block supports the following:

properties.name: disable_password_authentication
properties.description: • disable_password_authentication - (Required) Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled. If set to false, an admin_password must be specified.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: • ssh_keys - (Optional) One or more ssh_keys blocks. This field is required if disable_password_authentication is set to true.
<hr/>
A os_profile_secrets block supports the following:

properties.name: source_vault_id
properties.description: • source_vault_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the Key Vault to use.

properties.name: vault_certificates
properties.description: • vault_certificates - (Required) One or more vault_certificates blocks.
<hr/>
A os_profile_windows_config block supports the following:

properties.name: provision_vm_agent
properties.description: (Optional) Should the Azure Virtual Machine Guest Agent be installed on this Virtual Machine? Defaults to false.
NOTE: This is different from the Default value used for this field within Azure.

properties.name: enable_automatic_upgrades
properties.description: • enable_automatic_upgrades - (Optional) Are automatic updates enabled on this Virtual Machine? Defaults to false.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone - (Optional) Specifies the time zone of the virtual machine, the possible values are defined here.

properties.name: winrm
properties.description: • winrm - (Optional) One or more winrm block.

properties.name: additional_unattend_config
properties.description: • additional_unattend_config - (Optional) A additional_unattend_config block.
<hr/>
A plan block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the image from the marketplace.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image.

properties.name: product
properties.description: • product - (Required) Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace.
<hr/>
A ssh_keys block supports the following:

properties.name: key_data
properties.description: (Required) The Public SSH Key which should be written to the path defined above.
NOTE: Rather than defining this in-line you can source this from a local file using the file function - for example key_data = file("~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub").

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Required) The path of the destination file on the virtual machine
NOTE: Due to a limitation in the Azure VM Agent the only allowed path is /home/{username}/.ssh/authorized_keys.
<hr/>
A storage_image_reference block supports the following:
This block provisions the Virtual Machine from one of two sources: an Azure Platform Image (e.g. Ubuntu/Windows Server) or a Custom Image.
To provision from an Azure Platform Image, the following fields are applicable:

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: • offer - (Required) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
To provision a Custom Image, the following fields are applicable:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the ID of the Custom Image which the Virtual Machine should be created from. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: An example of how to use this is available within the ./examples/virtual-machines/managed-disks/from-custom-image directory within the Github Repository
<hr/>
A storage_data_disk block supports the following:
NOTE: Data Disks can also be attached either using this block or the azurerm_virtual_machine_data_disk_attachment resource - but not both.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Data Disk.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: • caching - (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements for the Data Disk. Possible values include None, ReadOnly and ReadWrite.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: • create_option - (Required) Specifies how the data disk should be created. Possible values are Attach, FromImage and Empty.
NOTE: If using an image that does not have data to be written to the Data Disk, use Empty as the create option in order to create the desired disk without any data.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: • disk_size_gb - (Optional) Specifies the size of the data disk in gigabytes.

properties.name: lun
properties.description: • lun - (Required) Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk. This needs to be unique within all the Data Disks on the Virtual Machine.

properties.name: write_accelerator_enabled
properties.description: • write_accelerator_enabled - (Optional) Specifies if Write Accelerator is enabled on the disk. This can only be enabled on Premium_LRS managed disks with no caching and M-Series VMs. Defaults to false.
The following properties apply when using Managed Disks:

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Possible values are either Standard_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, Premium_LRS or UltraSSD_LRS.

Note: managed_disk_type of type UltraSSD_LRS is currently in preview and are not available to subscriptions that have not requested onboarding to Azure Ultra Disk Storage preview. Azure Ultra Disk Storage is only available in East US 2, North Europe, and Southeast Asia regions. For more information see the Azure Ultra Disk Storage product documentation, product blog and FAQ. You must also set additional_capabilities.ultra_ssd_enabled to true.

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of an Existing Managed Disk which should be attached to this Virtual Machine. When this field is set create_option must be set to Attach.
The following properties apply when using Unmanaged Disks:

properties.name: vhd_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the URI of the VHD file backing this Unmanaged Data Disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A storage_os_disk block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the OS Disk.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: • create_option - (Required) Specifies how the OS Disk should be created. Possible values are Attach (managed disks only) and FromImage.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: • caching - (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements for the OS Disk. Possible values include None, ReadOnly and ReadWrite.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: • disk_size_gb - (Optional) Specifies the size of the OS Disk in gigabytes.

properties.name: image_uri
properties.description: • image_uri - (Optional) Specifies the Image URI in the format publisherName:offer:skus:version. This field can also specify the VHD uri of a custom VM image to clone. When cloning a Custom (Unmanaged) Disk Image the os_type field must be set.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Optional) Specifies the Operating System on the OS Disk. Possible values are Linux and Windows.

properties.name: write_accelerator_enabled
properties.description: • write_accelerator_enabled - (Optional) Specifies if Write Accelerator is enabled on the disk. This can only be enabled on Premium_LRS managed disks with no caching and M-Series VMs. Defaults to false.
The following properties apply when using Managed Disks:

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: • managed_disk_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of an existing Managed Disk which should be attached as the OS Disk of this Virtual Machine. If this is set then the create_option must be set to Attach.

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: • managed_disk_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of Managed Disk which should be created. Possible values are Standard_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS or Premium_LRS.
The following properties apply when using Unmanaged Disks:

properties.name: vhd_uri
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the URI of the VHD file backing this Unmanaged OS Disk. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A vault_certificates block supports the following:

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Key Vault Secret. Stored secret is the Base64 encoding of a JSON Object that which is encoded in UTF-8 of which the contents need to be:

{
  "data":"<Base64-encoded-certificate>",
  "dataType":"pfx",
  "password":"<pfx-file-password>"
}
NOTE: If your certificate is stored in Azure Key Vault - this can be sourced from the secret_id property on the azurerm_key_vault_certificate resource.

properties.name: certificate_store
properties.description: (Required, on windows machines) Specifies the certificate store on the Virtual Machine where the certificate should be added to, such as My.
<hr/>
A winrm block supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Specifies the protocol of listener. Possible values are HTTP or HTTPS.

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: • certificate_url - (Optional) The ID of the Key Vault Secret which contains the encrypted Certificate which should be installed on the Virtual Machine. This certificate must also be specified in the vault_certificates block within the os_profile_secrets block.
NOTE: This can be sourced from the secret_id field on the azurerm_key_vault_certificate resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: virtual_machine_id
properties.description: • virtual_machine_id - (Required) The ID of the Virtual Machine to which the Data Disk should be attached. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: managed_disk_id
properties.description: • managed_disk_id - (Required) The ID of an existing Managed Disk which should be attached. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: lun
properties.description: • lun - (Required) The Logical Unit Number of the Data Disk, which needs to be unique within the Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: • caching - (Required) Specifies the caching requirements for this Data Disk. Possible values include None, ReadOnly and ReadWrite.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: • create_option - (Optional) The Create Option of the Data Disk, such as Empty or Attach. Defaults to Attach. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: write_accelerator_enabled
properties.description: • write_accelerator_enabled - (Optional) Specifies if Write Accelerator is enabled on the disk. This can only be enabled on Premium_LRS managed disks with no caching and M-Series VMs. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine extension peering. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the extension is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_machine_name
properties.description: • virtual_machine_name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: • publisher - (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers can be found by using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can be found using the Azure CLI.
Note: The Publisher and Type of Virtual Machine Extensions can be found using the Azure CLI, via: shell $ az vm extension image list --location westus -o table

properties.name: type_handler_version
properties.description: • type_handler_version - (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: auto_upgrade_minor_version
properties.description: • auto_upgrade_minor_version - (Optional) Specifies if the platform deploys the latest minor version update to the type_handler_version specified.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: • settings - (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

Please Note: Certain VM Extensions require that the keys in the settings block are case sensitive. If you're seeing unhelpful errors, please ensure the keys are consistent with how Azure is expecting them (for instance, for the JsonADDomainExtension extension, the keys are expected to be in TitleCase.)

properties.name: protected_settings
properties.description: (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

Please Note: Certain VM Extensions require that the keys in the protected_settings block are case sensitive. If you're seeing unhelpful errors, please ensure the keys are consistent with how Azure is expecting them (for instance, for the JsonADDomainExtension extension, the keys are expected to be in TitleCase.)

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the virtual machine scale set resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual machine scale set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_profile
properties.description: • network_profile - (Required) A collection of network profile block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile
properties.description: • os_profile - (Required) A Virtual Machine OS Profile block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_windows_config
properties.description: • os_profile_windows_config - (Required, when a windows machine) A Windows config block as documented below.

properties.name: os_profile_linux_config
properties.description: • os_profile_linux_config - (Required, when a linux machine) A Linux config block as documented below.

properties.name: proximity_placement_group_id
properties.description: • proximity_placement_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Proximity Placement Group to which this Virtual Machine should be assigned. Changing this forces a new resource to be created

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) A sku block as documented below.

properties.name: storage_profile_os_disk
properties.description: • storage_profile_os_disk - (Required) A storage profile os disk block as documented below

properties.name: upgrade_policy_mode
properties.description: • upgrade_policy_mode - (Required) Specifies the mode of an upgrade to virtual machines in the scale set. Possible values, Rolling, Manual, or Automatic. When choosing Rolling, you will need to set a health probe.
<hr/>

properties.name: automatic_os_upgrade
properties.description: • automatic_os_upgrade - (Optional) Automatic OS patches can be applied by Azure to your scaleset. This is particularly useful when upgrade_policy_mode is set to Rolling. Defaults to false.

properties.name: boot_diagnostics
properties.description: • boot_diagnostics - (Optional) A boot diagnostics profile block as referenced below.

properties.name: extension
properties.description: • extension - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to add extension profiles to the scale set. Each extension block supports the fields documented below.

properties.name: eviction_policy
properties.description: • eviction_policy - (Optional) Specifies the eviction policy for Virtual Machines in this Scale Set. Possible values are Deallocate and Delete.
NOTE: eviction_policy can only be set when priority is set to Low.

properties.name: health_probe_id
properties.description: • health_probe_id - (Optional) Specifies the identifier for the load balancer health probe. Required when using Rolling as your upgrade_policy_mode.

properties.name: license_type
properties.description: • license_type - (Optional, when a Windows machine) Specifies the Windows OS license type. If supplied, the only allowed values are Windows_Client and Windows_Server.

properties.name: os_profile_secrets
properties.description: • os_profile_secrets - (Optional) A collection of Secret blocks as documented below.

properties.name: overprovision
properties.description: • overprovision - (Optional) Specifies whether the virtual machine scale set should be overprovisioned.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: • plan - (Optional) A plan block as documented below.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Optional) Specifies the priority for the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set. Defaults to Regular. Possible values are Low and Regular.

properties.name: rolling_upgrade_policy
properties.description: • rolling_upgrade_policy - (Optional) A rolling_upgrade_policy block as defined below. This is only applicable when the upgrade_policy_mode is Rolling.

properties.name: single_placement_group
properties.description: • single_placement_group - (Optional) Specifies whether the scale set is limited to a single placement group with a maximum size of 100 virtual machines. If set to false, managed disks must be used. Default is true. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. See documentation for more information.

properties.name: storage_profile_data_disk
properties.description: • storage_profile_data_disk - (Optional) A storage profile data disk block as documented below

properties.name: storage_profile_image_reference
properties.description: • storage_profile_image_reference - (Optional) A storage profile image reference block as documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A collection of availability zones to spread the Virtual Machines over.
Please Note: Availability Zones are only supported in several regions at this time.
<hr/>
sku supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the size of virtual machines in a scale set.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the tier of virtual machines in a scale set. Possible values, standard or basic.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the number of virtual machines in the scale set.
rolling_upgrade_policy supports the following:

properties.name: max_batch_instance_percent
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum percent of total virtual machine instances that will be upgraded simultaneously by the rolling upgrade in one batch. As this is a maximum, unhealthy instances in previous or future batches can cause the percentage of instances in a batch to decrease to ensure higher reliability. Defaults to 20.

properties.name: max_unhealthy_instance_percent
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum percentage of the total virtual machine instances in the scale set that can be simultaneously unhealthy, either as a result of being upgraded, or by being found in an unhealthy state by the virtual machine health checks before the rolling upgrade aborts. This constraint will be checked prior to starting any batch. Defaults to 20.

properties.name: max_unhealthy_upgraded_instance_percent
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum percentage of upgraded virtual machine instances that can be found to be in an unhealthy state. This check will happen after each batch is upgraded. If this percentage is ever exceeded, the rolling update aborts. Defaults to 20.

properties.name: pause_time_between_batches
properties.description: (Optional) The wait time between completing the update for all virtual machines in one batch and starting the next batch. The time duration should be specified in ISO 8601 format for duration (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations). Defaults to 0 seconds represented as PT0S.
identity supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the identity type to be assigned to the scale set. Allowable values are SystemAssigned, UserAssigned, and SystemAssigned, UserAssigned. For the SystemAssigned identity the scale set's Service Principal ID (SPN) can be retrieved after the scale set has been created. See documentation for more information.

properties.name: identity_ids
properties.description: • identity_ids - (Optional) Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned to the VMSS. Required if type is UserAssigned.

resource "azurerm_virtual_machine_scale_set" "test" {
  name                = "vm-scaleset"
  resource_group_name = "${azurerm_resource_group.test.name}"
  location            = "${azurerm_resource_group.test.location}"

  sku {
    name     = "${var.vm_sku}"
    tier     = "Standard"
    capacity = "${var.instance_count}"
  }

  identity {
    type = "systemAssigned"
  }

  extension {
    name                 = "MSILinuxExtension"
    publisher            = "Microsoft.ManagedIdentity"
    type                 = "ManagedIdentityExtensionForLinux"
    type_handler_version = "1.0"
    settings             = "{\"port\": 50342}"
  }

  # ...
}

output "principal_id" {
  value = "${lookup(azurerm_virtual_machine_scale_set.test.identity[0], "principal_id")}"
}
os_profile supports the following:

properties.name: computer_name_prefix
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the computer name prefix for all of the virtual machines in the scale set. Computer name prefixes must be 1 to 9 characters long for windows images and 1

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the administrator account name to use for all the instances of virtual machines in the scale set.

properties.name: admin_password
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the administrator password to use for all the instances of virtual machines in a scale set.

properties.name: custom_data
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies custom data to supply to the machine. On linux-based systems, this can be used as a cloud-init script. On other systems, this will be copied as a file on disk. Internally, Terraform will base64 encode this value before sending it to the API. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
os_profile_secrets supports the following:

properties.name: source_vault_id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the key vault to use.

properties.name: vault_certificates
properties.description: (Required, on windows machines) A collection of Vault Certificates as documented below
vault_certificates support the following:

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Required) It is the Base64 encoding of a JSON Object that which is encoded in UTF-8 of which the contents need to be data, dataType and password.

properties.name: certificate_store
properties.description: (Required, on windows machines) Specifies the certificate store on the Virtual Machine where the certificate should be added to.
os_profile_windows_config supports the following:

properties.name: provision_vm_agent
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machines in the scale set.

properties.name: enable_automatic_upgrades
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machines in the scale set are enabled for automatic updates.

properties.name: winrm
properties.description: (Optional) A collection of WinRM configuration blocks as documented below.

properties.name: additional_unattend_config
properties.description: (Optional) An Additional Unattended Config block as documented below.
winrm supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the protocol of listener

properties.name: certificate_url
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies URL of the certificate with which new Virtual Machines is provisioned.
additional_unattend_config supports the following:

properties.name: pass
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to. The only allowable value is oobeSystem.

properties.name: component
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content. The only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

properties.name: setting_name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies. Possible values are: FirstLogonCommands and AutoLogon.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.
os_profile_linux_config supports the following:

properties.name: disable_password_authentication
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled. Defaults to false. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a collection of path and key_data to be placed on the virtual machine.
Note: Please note that the only allowed path is /home/<username>/.ssh/authorized_keys due to a limitation of Azure
network_profile supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the network interface configuration.

properties.name: primary
properties.description: (Required) Indicates whether network interfaces created from the network interface configuration will be the primary NIC of the VM.

properties.name: ip_configuration
properties.description: (Required) An ip_configuration block as documented below.

properties.name: accelerated_networking
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether to enable accelerated networking or not. Defaults to false.

properties.name: dns_settings
properties.description: (Optional) A dns_settings block as documented below.

properties.name: ip_forwarding
properties.description: (Optional) Whether IP forwarding is enabled on this NIC. Defaults to false.

properties.name: network_security_group_id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the identifier for the network security group.
dns_settings supports the following:

properties.name: dns_servers
properties.description: (Required) Specifies an array of dns servers.
ip_configuration supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies name of the IP configuration.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

properties.name: application_gateway_backend_address_pool_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an array of references to backend address pools of application gateways. A scale set can reference backend address pools of one application gateway. Multiple scale sets cannot use the same application gateway.

properties.name: load_balancer_backend_address_pool_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an array of references to backend address pools of load balancers. A scale set can reference backend address pools of one public and one internal load balancer. Multiple scale sets cannot use the same load balancer.

properties.name: load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an array of references to inbound NAT rules for load balancers.

properties.name: primary
properties.description: (Required) Specifies if this ip_configuration is the primary one.

properties.name: application_security_group_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies up to 20 application security group IDs.

properties.name: public_ip_address_configuration
properties.description: (Optional) Describes a virtual machines scale set IP Configuration's PublicIPAddress configuration. The public_ip_address_configuration is documented below.
public_ip_address_configuration supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the public ip address configuration

properties.name: idle_timeout
properties.description: (Required) The idle timeout in minutes. This value must be between 4 and 30.

properties.name: domain_name_label
properties.description: (Required) The domain name label for the dns settings.
storage_profile_os_disk supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the disk name. Must be specified when using unmanaged disk ('managed_disk_type' property not set).

properties.name: vhd_containers
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the vhd uri. Cannot be used when image or managed_disk_type is specified.

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value you must be either Standard_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS or Premium_LRS. Cannot be used when vhd_containers or image is specified.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: (Required) Specifies how the virtual machine should be created. The only possible option is FromImage.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: None (default), ReadOnly, ReadWrite.

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the blob uri for user image. A virtual machine scale set creates an os disk in the same container as the user image. Updating the osDisk image causes the existing disk to be deleted and a new one created with the new image. If the VM scale set is in Manual upgrade mode then the virtual machines are not updated until they have manualUpgrade applied to them. When setting this field os_type needs to be specified. Cannot be used when vhd_containers, managed_disk_type or storage_profile_image_reference are specified.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the operating system Type, valid values are windows, linux.
storage_profile_data_disk supports the following:

properties.name: lun
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the Logical Unit Number of the disk in each virtual machine in the scale set.

properties.name: create_option
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies how the data disk should be created. The only possible options are FromImage and Empty.

properties.name: caching
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: None (default), ReadOnly, ReadWrite.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the size of the disk in GB. This element is required when creating an empty disk.

properties.name: managed_disk_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value must be either Standard_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS or Premium_LRS.
storage_profile_image_reference supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of the (custom) image to use to create the virtual machine scale set, as in the example below.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machines.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machines.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machines.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machines.
boot_diagnostics supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: : (Required) Whether to enable boot diagnostics for the virtual machine.

properties.name: storage_uri
properties.description: : (Required) Blob endpoint for the storage account to hold the virtual machine's diagnostic files. This must be the root of a storage account, and not a storage container.
extension supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the extension.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers can be found by using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can be found using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: type_handler_version
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.

properties.name: auto_upgrade_minor_version
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether or not to use the latest minor version available.

properties.name: provision_after_extensions
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a dependency array of extensions required to be executed before, the array stores the name of each extension.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.

properties.name: protected_settings
properties.description: (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
plan supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the image from the marketplace.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image.

properties.name: product
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace.

properties.name: example-of-storage_profile_image_reference-with-id
properties.description: » Example of storage_profile_image_reference with id

resource "azurerm_image" "test" {
  name = "test"

  # ...
}

resource "azurerm_virtual_machine_scale_set" "test" {
  name = "test"

  # ...

  storage_profile_image_reference {
    id = "${azurerm_image.test.id}"
  }

  # ...
}
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) An identity block as defined below.
