Note: managed identities are not supported for containers in virtual networks.

properties.name: container
properties.description: • container - (Required) The definition of a container that is part of the group as documented in the container block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Required) The OS for the container group. Allowed values are Linux and Windows. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: if os_type is set to Windows currently only a single container block is supported. Windows containers are not supported in virtual networks.
<hr/>

properties.name: diagnostics
properties.description: • diagnostics - (Optional) A diagnostics block as documented below.

properties.name: dns_name_label
properties.description: • dns_name_label - (Optional) The DNS label/name for the container groups IP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: DNS label/name is not supported when deploying to virtual networks.

properties.name: ip_address_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ip address type of the container. Public or Private. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. If set to Private, network_profile_id also needs to be set.
Note: dns_name_label, identity and os_type set to windows are not compatible with Private ip_address_type

properties.name: network_profile_id
properties.description: • network_profile_id - (Optional) Network profile ID for deploying to virtual network.

properties.name: image_registry_credential
properties.description: • image_registry_credential - (Optional) A image_registry_credential block as documented below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: restart_policy
properties.description: • restart_policy - (Optional) Restart policy for the container group. Allowed values are Always, Never, OnFailure. Defaults to Always. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
An identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The Managed Service Identity Type of this container group. Possible values are SystemAssigned (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), UserAssigned where you can specify the Service Principal IDs in the identity_ids field, and SystemAssigned, UserAssigned which assigns both a system managed identity as well as the specified user assigned identities. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: When type is set to SystemAssigned, identity the Principal ID can be retrieved after the container group has been created. See documentation for more information.

properties.name: identity_ids
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned. Required if type is UserAssigned. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A container block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Required) The container image name. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: cpu
properties.description: • cpu - (Required) The required number of CPU cores of the containers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: memory
properties.description: • memory - (Required) The required memory of the containers in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gpu
properties.description: • gpu - (Optional) A gpu block as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: Gpu resources are currently only supported in Linux containers.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) A set of public ports for the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Set as documented in the ports block below.

properties.name: environment_variables
properties.description: • environment_variables - (Optional) A list of environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: secure_environment_variables
properties.description: • secure_environment_variables - (Optional) A list of sensitive environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: readiness_probe
properties.description: • readiness_probe - (Optional) The definition of a readiness probe for this container as documented in the readiness_probe block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: liveness_probe
properties.description: • liveness_probe - (Optional) The definition of a readiness probe for this container as documented in the liveness_probe block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: command
properties.description: • command - (Optional) A command line to be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: The field command has been deprecated in favor of commands to better match the API.

properties.name: commands
properties.description: • commands - (Optional) A list of commands which should be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: • volume - (Optional) The definition of a volume mount for this container as documented in the volume block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A diagnostics block supports:

properties.name: log_analytics
properties.description: (Required) A log_analytics block as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A image_registry_credential block supports:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The username with which to connect to the registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) The password with which to connect to the registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server
properties.description: • server - (Required) The address to use to connect to the registry without protocol ("https"/"http"). For example: "myacr.acr.io". Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A log_analytics block supports:

properties.name: log_type
properties.description: • log_type - (Optional) The log type which should be used. Possible values are ContainerInsights and ContainerInstanceLogs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: workspace_id
properties.description: • workspace_id - (Required) The Workspace ID of the Log Analytics Workspace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: workspace_key
properties.description: • workspace_key - (Required) The Workspace Key of the Log Analytics Workspace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Any metadata required for Log Analytics. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A ports block supports:

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) The port number the container will expose. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The network protocol associated with port. Possible values are TCP & UDP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
A gpu block supports:

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) The number of GPUs which should be assigned to this container. Allowed values are 1, 2, or 4. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) The Sku which should be used for the GPU. Possible values are K80, P100, or V100. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A volume block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the volume mount. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: mount_path
properties.description: • mount_path - (Required) The path on which this volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: read_only
properties.description: • read_only - (Optional) Specify if the volume is to be mounted as read only or not. The default value is false. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) The Azure storage account from which the volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_key
properties.description: • storage_account_key - (Required) The access key for the Azure Storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: share_name
properties.description: • share_name - (Required) The Azure storage share that is to be mounted as a volume. This must be created on the storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
The readiness_probe block supports:

properties.name: exec
properties.description: • exec - (Optional) Commands to be run to validate container readiness. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: httpget
properties.description: • httpget - (Optional) The definition of the httpget for this container as documented in the httpget block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: initial_delay_seconds
properties.description: • initial_delay_seconds - (Optional) Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness or readiness probes are initiated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: period_seconds
properties.description: • period_seconds - (Optional) How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. The default value is 10 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: failure_threshold
properties.description: • failure_threshold - (Optional) How many times to try the probe before restarting the container (liveness probe) or marking the container as unhealthy (readiness probe). The default value is 3 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: success_threshold
properties.description: • success_threshold - (Optional) Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. The default value is 1 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: timeout_seconds
properties.description: • timeout_seconds - (Optional) Number of seconds after which the probe times out. The default value is 1 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
The liveness_probe block supports:

properties.name: exec
properties.description: • exec - (Optional) Commands to be run to validate container readiness. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: httpget
properties.description: • httpget - (Optional) The definition of the httpget for this container as documented in the httpget block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: initial_delay_seconds
properties.description: • initial_delay_seconds - (Optional) Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness or readiness probes are initiated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: period_seconds
properties.description: • period_seconds - (Optional) How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. The default value is 10 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: failure_threshold
properties.description: • failure_threshold - (Optional) How many times to try the probe before restarting the container (liveness probe) or marking the container as unhealthy (readiness probe). The default value is 3 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: success_threshold
properties.description: • success_threshold - (Optional) Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. The default value is 1 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: timeout_seconds
properties.description: • timeout_seconds - (Optional) Number of seconds after which the probe times out. The default value is 1 and the minimum value is 1. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
The httpget block supports:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) Path to access on the HTTP server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) Number of the port to access on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: scheme
properties.description: • scheme - (Optional) Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Possible values are Http and Https. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: admin_enabled
properties.description: • admin_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether the admin user is enabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Required for Classic Sku - Forbidden otherwise) The ID of a Storage Account which must be located in the same Azure Region as the Container Registry.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Optional) The SKU name of the the container registry. Possible values are Classic (which was previously Basic), Basic, Standard and Premium.
NOTE: The Classic SKU is Deprecated and will no longer be available for new resources from the end of March 2019.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: georeplication_locations
properties.description: • georeplication_locations - (Optional) A list of Azure locations where the container registry should be geo-replicated.

properties.name: network_rule_set
properties.description: • network_rule_set - (Optional) A network_rule_set block as documented below.
network_rule_set supports the following:

properties.name: default_action
properties.description: • default_action - (Optional) The behaviour for requests matching no rules. Either Allow or Deny. Defaults to Allow

properties.name: ip_rule
properties.description: • ip_rule - (Optional) One or more ip_rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: virtual_network
properties.description: • virtual_network - (Optional) One or more virtual_network blocks as defined below.
NOTE: network_rule_set is only supported with the Premium SKU at this time.
ip_rule supports the following:

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) The behaviour for requests matching this rule. At this time the only supported value is Allow

properties.name: ip_range
properties.description: • ip_range - (Required) The CIDR block from which requests will match the rule.
virtual_network supports the following:

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) The behaviour for requests matching this rule. At this time the only supported value is Allow

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The subnet id from which requests will match the rule.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Registry Webhook. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Registry Webhook. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: registry_name
properties.description: • registry_name - (Required) The Name of Container registry this Webhook belongs to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: service_uri
properties.description: • service_uri - (Required) Specifies the service URI for the Webhook to post notifications.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: • actions - (Required) A list of actions that trigger the Webhook to post notifications. At least one action needs to be specified. Valid values are: push, delete, quarantine, chart_push, chart_delete

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - (Optional) Specifies if this Webhook triggers notifications or not. Valid values: enabled and disabled. Default is enabled.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: • scope - (Optional) Specifies the scope of repositories that can trigger an event. For example, 'foo:*' means events for all tags under repository 'foo'. 'foo:bar' means events for 'foo:bar' only. 'foo' is equivalent to 'foo:latest'. Empty means all events.

properties.name: custom_headers
properties.description: • custom_headers - (Optional) Custom headers that will be added to the webhook notifications request.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Container Service instance to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the Container Service instance should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the resource group where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: orchestration_platform
properties.description: • orchestration_platform - (Required) Specifies the Container Orchestration Platform to use. Currently can be either DCOS, Kubernetes or Swarm. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: master_profile
properties.description: • master_profile - (Required) A Master Profile block as documented below.

properties.name: linux_profile
properties.description: • linux_profile - (Required) A Linux Profile block as documented below.

properties.name: agent_pool_profile
properties.description: • agent_pool_profile - (Required) A Agent Pool Profile's block as documented below.

properties.name: service_principal
properties.description: • service_principal - (only Required when you're using Kubernetes as an Orchestration Platform) A Service Principal block as documented below.

properties.name: diagnostics_profile
properties.description: • diagnostics_profile - (Required) A VM Diagnostics Profile block as documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
master_profile supports the following:

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Required) Number of masters (VMs) in the container service cluster. Allowed values are 1, 3, and 5. The default value is 1.

properties.name: dns_prefix
properties.description: (Required) The DNS Prefix to use for the Container Service master nodes.
linux_profile supports the following:

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: (Required) The Admin Username for the Cluster.

properties.name: ssh_key
properties.description: (Required) An SSH Key block as documented below.
ssh_key supports the following:

properties.name: key_data
properties.description: (Required) The Public SSH Key used to access the cluster.
agent_pool_profile supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Unique name of the agent pool profile in the context of the subscription and resource group.

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Required) Number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive). The default value is 1.

properties.name: dns_prefix
properties.description: (Required) The DNS Prefix given to Agents in this Agent Pool.

properties.name: vm_size
properties.description: (Required) The VM Size of each of the Agent Pool VM's (e.g. Standard_F1 / Standard_D2v2).
service_principal supports the following:

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID for the Service Principal.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: (Required) The secret password associated with the service principal.
diagnostics_profile supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Should VM Diagnostics be enabled for the Container Service VM's
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Managed Kubernetes Cluster to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the Managed Kubernetes Cluster should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the Resource Group where the Managed Kubernetes Cluster should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: agent_pool_profile
properties.description: • agent_pool_profile - (Required) One or more agent_pool_profile blocks as defined below.

properties.name: dns_prefix
properties.description: • dns_prefix - (Required) DNS prefix specified when creating the managed cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: The dns_prefix must contain between 3 and 45 characters, and can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens. It must start with a letter and must end with a letter or a number.

properties.name: service_principal
properties.description: (Required) A service_principal block as documented below.
<hr/>
A aci_connector_linux block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is the virtual node addon enabled?

properties.name: subnet_name
properties.description: • subnet_name - (Required) The subnet name for the virtual nodes to run.
Note: AKS will add a delegation to the subnet named here. To prevent further runs from failing you should make sure that the subnet you create for virtual nodes has a delegation, like so.

resource "azurerm_subnet" "virtual" {

  ...

  delegation {
    name = "aciDelegation"
    service_delegation {
      name    = "Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups"
      actions = ["Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets/action"]
    }
  }
}
<hr/>

properties.name: addon_profile
properties.description: • addon_profile - (Optional) A addon_profile block.

properties.name: api_server_authorized_ip_ranges
properties.description: • api_server_authorized_ip_ranges - (Optional) The IP ranges to whitelist for incoming traffic to the masters.

NOTE: api_server_authorized_ip_ranges Is currently in Preview on an opt-in basis. To use it, enable feature APIServerSecurityPreview for namespace Microsoft.ContainerService. For an example of how to enable a Preview feature, please visit How to enable the Azure Firewall Public Preview

properties.name: kubernetes_version
properties.description: • kubernetes_version - (Optional) Version of Kubernetes specified when creating the AKS managed cluster. If not specified, the latest recommended version will be used at provisioning time (but won't auto-upgrade).

properties.name: linux_profile
properties.description: • linux_profile - (Optional) A linux_profile block.

properties.name: windows_profile
properties.description: • windows_profile - (Optional) A windows_profile block.

properties.name: network_profile
properties.description: • network_profile - (Optional) A network_profile block.
NOTE: If network_profile is not defined, kubenet profile will be used by default.

properties.name: role_based_access_control
properties.description: • role_based_access_control - (Optional) A role_based_access_control block. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: enable_pod_security_policy
properties.description: • enable_pod_security_policy - (Optional) Whether Pod Security Policies are enabled. Note that this also requires role based access control to be enabled.

NOTE: Support for enable_pod_security_policy is currently in Preview on an opt-in basis. To use it, enable feature PodSecurityPolicyPreview for namespace Microsoft.ContainerService. For an example of how to enable a Preview feature, please visit Register scale set feature provider.

properties.name: node_resource_group
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the Resource Group where the the Kubernetes Nodes should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: Azure requires that a new, non-existent Resource Group is used, as otherwise the provisioning of the Kubernetes Service will fail.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
A addon_profile block supports the following:

properties.name: aci_connector_linux
properties.description: (Optional) A aci_connector_linux block. For more details, please visit Create and configure an AKS cluster to use virtual nodes.

properties.name: http_application_routing
properties.description: (Optional) A http_application_routing block.

properties.name: oms_agent
properties.description: (Optional) A oms_agent block. For more details, please visit How to onboard Azure Monitor for containers.

properties.name: kube_dashboard
properties.description: (Optional) A kube_dashboard block.
<hr/>
A agent_pool_profile block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Unique name of the Agent Pool Profile in the context of the Subscription and Resource Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Optional) Number of Agents (VMs) in the Pool. Possible values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive). Defaults to 1.

properties.name: vm_size
properties.description: • vm_size - (Required) The size of each VM in the Agent Pool (e.g. Standard_F1). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: availability_zones
properties.description: • availability_zones - (Optional) Availability zones for nodes. The property type of the agent_pool_profile must be set to VirtualMachineScaleSets in order to use availability zones.

properties.name: enable_auto_scaling
properties.description: • enable_auto_scaling - (Optional) Whether to enable auto-scaler. Note that auto scaling feature requires the that the type is set to VirtualMachineScaleSets

properties.name: min_count
properties.description: • min_count - (Optional) Minimum number of nodes for auto-scaling

properties.name: max_count
properties.description: • max_count - (Optional) Maximum number of nodes for auto-scaling

properties.name: max_pods
properties.description: • max_pods - (Optional) The maximum number of pods that can run on each agent. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: os_disk_size_gb
properties.description: • os_disk_size_gb - (Optional) The Agent Operating System disk size in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Optional) The Operating System used for the Agents. Possible values are Linux and Windows. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to Linux.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Type of the Agent Pool. Possible values are AvailabilitySet and VirtualMachineScaleSets. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to AvailabilitySet.

properties.name: vnet_subnet_id
properties.description: • vnet_subnet_id - (Optional) The ID of the Subnet where the Agents in the Pool should be provisioned. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: A route table should be configured on this Subnet.

properties.name: node_taints
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Kubernetes taints which should be applied to nodes in the agent pool (e.g key=value:NoSchedule)
<hr/>
A azure_active_directory block supports the following:

properties.name: client_app_id
properties.description: • client_app_id - (Required) The Client ID of an Azure Active Directory Application. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server_app_id
properties.description: • server_app_id - (Required) The Server ID of an Azure Active Directory Application. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server_app_secret
properties.description: • server_app_secret - (Required) The Server Secret of an Azure Active Directory Application. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The Tenant ID used for Azure Active Directory Application. If this isn't specified the Tenant ID of the current Subscription is used. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A http_application_routing block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Is HTTP Application Routing Enabled? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A linux_profile block supports the following:

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: • admin_username - (Required) The Admin Username for the Cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ssh_key
properties.description: • ssh_key - (Required) An ssh_key block. Only one is currently allowed. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A windows_profile block supports the following:

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: • admin_username - (Required) The Admin Username for Windows VMs.

properties.name: admin_password
properties.description: • admin_password - (Required) The Admin Password for Windows VMs.
<hr/>
A network_profile block supports the following:

properties.name: network_plugin
properties.description: (Required) Network plugin to use for networking. Currently supported values are azure and kubenet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: When network_plugin is set to azure - the vnet_subnet_id field in the agent_pool_profile block must be set and pod_cidr must not be set.

properties.name: network_policy
properties.description: • network_policy - (Optional) Sets up network policy to be used with Azure CNI. Network policy allows us to control the traffic flow between pods. This field can only be set when network_plugin is set to azure. Currently supported values are calico and azure. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: dns_service_ip
properties.description: • dns_service_ip - (Optional) IP address within the Kubernetes service address range that will be used by cluster service discovery (kube-dns). This is required when network_plugin is set to azure. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: docker_bridge_cidr
properties.description: • docker_bridge_cidr - (Optional) IP address (in CIDR notation) used as the Docker bridge IP address on nodes. This is required when network_plugin is set to azure. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: pod_cidr
properties.description: • pod_cidr - (Optional) The CIDR to use for pod IP addresses. This field can only be set when network_plugin is set to kubenet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: service_cidr
properties.description: • service_cidr - (Optional) The Network Range used by the Kubernetes service. This is required when network_plugin is set to azure. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: This range should not be used by any network element on or connected to this VNet. Service address CIDR must be smaller than /12.
Examples of how to use AKS with Advanced Networking can be found in the ./examples/kubernetes/ directory in the Github repository.

properties.name: load_balancer_sku
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the SKU of the Load Balancer used for this Kubernetes Cluster. Possible values are basic and standard. Defaults to basic.
<hr/>
A oms_agent block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is the OMS Agent Enabled?

properties.name: log_analytics_workspace_id
properties.description: • log_analytics_workspace_id - (Required) The ID of the Log Analytics Workspace which the OMS Agent should send data to.
<hr/>
A kube_dashboard block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Is the Kubernetes Dashboard enabled?
<hr/>
A role_based_access_control block supports the following:

properties.name: azure_active_directory
properties.description: • azure_active_directory - (Optional) An azure_active_directory block. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is Role Based Access Control Enabled? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A service_principal block supports the following:

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: • client_id - (Required) The Client ID for the Service Principal.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Required) The Client Secret for the Service Principal.
<hr/>
A ssh_key block supports the following:

properties.name: key_data
properties.description: (Required) The Public SSH Key used to access the cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the CosmosDB Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the CosmosDB Account is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: offer_type
properties.description: • offer_type - (Required) Specifies the Offer Type to use for this CosmosDB Account - currently this can only be set to Standard.

properties.name: kind
properties.description: • kind - (Optional) Specifies the Kind of CosmosDB to create - possible values are GlobalDocumentDB and MongoDB. Defaults to GlobalDocumentDB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: consistency_policy
properties.description: • consistency_policy - (Required) Specifies a consistency_policy resource, used to define the consistency policy for this CosmosDB account.

properties.name: geo_location
properties.description: • geo_location - (Required) Specifies a geo_location resource, used to define where data should be replicated with the failover_priority 0 specifying the primary location.

properties.name: ip_range_filter
properties.description: • ip_range_filter - (Optional) CosmosDB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IP's for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.

properties.name: enable_automatic_failover
properties.description: • enable_automatic_failover - (Optional) Enable automatic fail over for this Cosmos DB account.

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: • capabilities - (Optional) The capabilities which should be enabled for this Cosmos DB account. Possible values are EnableAggregationPipeline, EnableCassandra, EnableGremlin, EnableTable, MongoDBv3.4, and mongoEnableDocLevelTTL.

properties.name: is_virtual_network_filter_enabled
properties.description: • is_virtual_network_filter_enabled - (Optional) Enables virtual network filtering for this Cosmos DB account.

properties.name: virtual_network_rule
properties.description: • virtual_network_rule - (Optional) Specifies a virtual_network_rules resource, used to define which subnets are allowed to access this CosmosDB account.

properties.name: enable_multiple_write_locations
properties.description: • enable_multiple_write_locations - (Optional) Enable multi-master support for this Cosmos DB account.
consistency_policy Configures the database consistency and supports the following:

properties.name: consistency_level
properties.description: (Required) The Consistency Level to use for this CosmosDB Account

properties.name: max_interval_in_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 5

properties.name: max_staleness_prefix
properties.description: (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 10 – 2147483647. Defaults to 100. Required when consistency_level is set to BoundedStaleness.
Note: max_interval_in_seconds and max_staleness_prefix can only be set to custom values when consistency_level is set to BoundedStaleness - otherwise they will return the default values shown above.
geo_location Configures the geographic locations the data is replicated to and supports the following:

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: (Optional) The string used to generate the document endpoints for this region. If not specified it defaults to ${cosmosdb_account.name}-${location}. Changing this causes the location to be deleted and re-provisioned and cannot be changed for the location with failover priority 0.

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Azure region to host replicated data.

properties.name: failover_priority
properties.description: (Required) The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions
capabilities Configures the capabilities to enable for this Cosmos DB account:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The capability to enable
NOTE: The prefix and failover_priority fields of a location cannot be changed for the location with a failover priority of 0.
virtual_network_rule Configures the virtual network subnets allowed to access this Cosmos DB account and supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the virtual network subnet.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: • account_name - (Required) The name of the Cosmos DB Cassandra KeySpace to create the table within. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NOTE: name must be between 1-128 characters long and must satisfy all of the requirements below: 1. Contains only alphanumeric and hyphen characters 2. Cannot start with a number or hyphen 3. Cannot end with a hyphen

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group where the MySQL server resides. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the subnet that the MySQL server will be connected to.

NOTE: Due to a bug in the Azure API this resource currently doesn't expose the ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint field and defaults this to false. Terraform will check during the provisioning of the Virtual Network Rule that the Subnet contains the Service Rule to verify that the Virtual Network Rule can be created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the SKU Name for this PostgreSQL Server. The name of the SKU, follows the tier + family + cores pattern (e.g. B_Gen4_1, GP_Gen5_8). For more information see the product documentation.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: • tier - (Required) The tier of the particular SKU. Possible values are Basic, GeneralPurpose, and MemoryOptimized. For more information see the product documentation.

properties.name: family
properties.description: • family - (Required) The family of hardware Gen4 or Gen5, before selecting your family check the product documentation for availability in your region.
<hr/>
storage_profile supports the following:

properties.name: storage_mb
properties.description: • storage_mb - (Required) Max storage allowed for a server. Possible values are between 5120 MB(5GB) and 1048576 MB(1TB) for the Basic SKU and between 5120 MB(5GB) and 4194304 MB(4TB) for General Purpose/Memory Optimized SKUs. For more information see the product documentation.

properties.name: backup_retention_days
properties.description: • backup_retention_days - (Optional) Backup retention days for the server, supported values are between 7 and 35 days.

properties.name: geo_redundant_backup
properties.description: • geo_redundant_backup - (Optional) Enable/Disable Geo-redundant for server backup. Valid values for this property are Enabled or Disabled, not supported for the basic tier. This allows you to choose between locally redundant or geo-redundant backup storage in the General Purpose and Memory Optimized tiers. When the backups are stored in geo-redundant backup storage, they are not only stored within the region in which your server is hosted, but are also replicated to a paired data center. This provides better protection and ability to restore your server in a different region in the event of a disaster. The Basic tier only offers locally redundant backup storage.

properties.name: auto_grow
properties.description: • auto_grow - (Optional) Enable/Disable auto-growing of the storage. Valid values for this property are Enabled or Disabled. Storage auto-grow prevents your server from running out of storage and becoming read-only. If storage auto grow is enabled, the storage automatically grows without impacting the workload. The default value if not explicitly specified is Enabled.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the PostgreSQL virtual network rule. Cannot be empty and must only contain alphanumeric characters and hyphens. Cannot start with a number, and cannot start or end with a hyphen. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NOTE: name must be between 1-128 characters long and must satisfy all of the requirements below: 1. Contains only alphanumeric and hyphen characters 2. Cannot start with a number or hyphen 3. Cannot end with a hyphen

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group where the PostgreSQL server resides. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server_name
properties.description: • server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server to which this PostgreSQL virtual network rule will be applied to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the subnet that the PostgreSQL server will be connected to.

properties.name: ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint
properties.description: • ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint - (Optional) Should the Virtual Network Rule be created before the Subnet has the Virtual Network Service Endpoint enabled? Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the database.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the database. This must be the same as Database Server resource group currently.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server_name
properties.description: • server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server on which to create the database.

properties.name: create_mode
properties.description: • create_mode - (Optional) Specifies how to create the database. Must be either Default to create a new database or PointInTimeRestore to restore from a snapshot. Defaults to Default.

properties.name: import
properties.description: • import - (Optional) A Database Import block as documented below. create_mode must be set to Default.

properties.name: source_database_id
properties.description: • source_database_id - (Optional) The URI of the source database if create_mode value is not Default.

properties.name: restore_point_in_time
properties.description: • restore_point_in_time - (Optional) The point in time for the restore. Only applies if create_mode is PointInTimeRestore e.g. 2013-11-08T22:00:40Z

properties.name: edition
properties.description: • edition - (Optional) The edition of the database to be created. Applies only if create_mode is Default. Valid values are: Basic, Standard, Premium, DataWarehouse, Business, BusinessCritical, Free, GeneralPurpose, Hyperscale, Premium, PremiumRS, Standard, Stretch, System, System2, or Web. Please see Azure SQL Database Service Tiers.

properties.name: collation
properties.description: • collation - (Optional) The name of the collation. Applies only if create_mode is Default. Azure default is SQL_LATIN1_GENERAL_CP1_CI_AS. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: max_size_bytes
properties.description: • max_size_bytes - (Optional) The maximum size that the database can grow to. Applies only if create_mode is Default. Please see Azure SQL Database Service Tiers.

properties.name: requested_service_objective_id
properties.description: • requested_service_objective_id - (Optional) Use requested_service_objective_id or requested_service_objective_name to set the performance level for the database. Please see Azure SQL Database Service Tiers.

properties.name: requested_service_objective_name
properties.description: • requested_service_objective_name - (Optional) Use requested_service_objective_name or requested_service_objective_id to set the performance level for the database. Valid values are: S0, S1, S2, S3, P1, P2, P4, P6, P11 and ElasticPool. Please see Azure SQL Database Service Tiers.

properties.name: source_database_deletion_date
properties.description: • source_database_deletion_date - (Optional) The deletion date time of the source database. Only applies to deleted databases where create_mode is PointInTimeRestore.

properties.name: elastic_pool_name
properties.description: • elastic_pool_name - (Optional) The name of the elastic database pool.

properties.name: threat_detection_policy
properties.description: • threat_detection_policy - (Optional) Threat detection policy configuration. The threat_detection_policy block supports fields documented below.

properties.name: read_scale
properties.description: • read_scale - (Optional) Read-only connections will be redirected to a high-available replica. Please see Use read-only replicas to load-balance read-only query workloads.

properties.name: tags

properties.name: storage_uri

properties.name: storage_key
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the access key for the storage account.

properties.name: storage_key_type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the type of access key for the storage account. Valid values are StorageAccessKey or SharedAccessKey.

properties.name: administrator_login
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the SQL administrator.

properties.name: administrator_login_password
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the password of the SQL administrator.

properties.name: authentication_type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the type of authentication used to access the server. Valid values are SQL or ADPassword.

properties.name: operation_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the type of import operation being performed. The only allowable value is Import.
<hr/>
threat_detection_policy supports the following:

properties.name: state
properties.description: (Required) The State of the Policy. Possible values are Enabled, Disabled or New.

properties.name: disabled_alerts
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a list of alerts which should be disabled. Possible values include Access_Anomaly, Sql_Injection and Sql_Injection_Vulnerability.

properties.name: email_account_admins
properties.description: (Optional) Should the account administrators be emailed when this alert is triggered?

properties.name: email_addresses
properties.description: (Optional) A list of email addresses which alerts should be sent to.

properties.name: retention_days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.

properties.name: storage_account_access_key
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account. Required if state is Enabled.

properties.name: storage_endpoint
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs. Required if state is Enabled.

properties.name: use_server_default
properties.description: (Optional) Should the default server policy be used? Defaults to Disabled.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the elastic pool. This needs to be globally unique. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the elastic pool. This must be the same as the resource group of the underlying SQL server.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server_name
properties.description: • server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server on which to create the elastic pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: edition
properties.description: • edition - (Required) The edition of the elastic pool to be created. Valid values are Basic, Standard, and Premium. Refer to Azure SQL Database Service Tiers for details. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: dtu
properties.description: • dtu - (Required) The total shared DTU for the elastic pool. Valid values depend on the edition which has been defined. Refer to Azure SQL Database Service Tiers for valid combinations.

properties.name: db_dtu_min
properties.description: • db_dtu_min - (Optional) The minimum DTU which will be guaranteed to all databases in the elastic pool to be created.

properties.name: db_dtu_max
properties.description: • db_dtu_max - (Optional) The maximum DTU which will be guaranteed to all databases in the elastic pool to be created.

properties.name: pool_size
properties.description: • pool_size - (Optional) The maximum size in MB that all databases in the elastic pool can grow to. The maximum size must be consistent with combination of edition and dtu and the limits documented in Azure SQL Database Service Tiers. If not defined when creating an elastic pool, the value is set to the size implied by edition and dtu.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the SQL virtual network rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be empty and must only contain alphanumeric characters and hyphens. Cannot start with a number, and cannot start or end with a hyphen.

NOTE: name must be between 1-128 characters long and must satisfy all of the requirements below: 1. Contains only alphanumeric and hyphen characters 2. Cannot start with a number or hyphen 3. Cannot end with a hyphen

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group where the SQL server resides. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: server_name
properties.description: • server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server to which this SQL virtual network rule will be applied to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the subnet that the SQL server will be connected to.

properties.name: ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint
properties.description: • ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint - (Optional) Create the virtual network rule before the subnet has the virtual network service endpoint enabled. The default value is false.

NOTE: If ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint is false, and the target subnet does not contain the Microsoft.SQL endpoint in the service_endpoints array, the deployment will fail when it tries to create the SQL virtual network rule.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Dev Test Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NOTE: The validation requirements for the Name change based on the os_type used in this Virtual Machine. For a Linux VM the name must be between 1-62 characters, and for a Windows VM the name must be between 1-15 characters. It must begin and end with a letter or number, and cannot be all numbers.

properties.name: lab_name
properties.description: • lab_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Dev Test Lab in which the Virtual Machine should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the Dev Test Lab resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the Dev Test Lab exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gallery_image_reference
properties.description: • gallery_image_reference - (Required) A gallery_image_reference block as defined below.

properties.name: lab_subnet_name
properties.description: • lab_subnet_name - (Required) The name of a Subnet within the Dev Test Virtual Network where this machine should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: lab_virtual_network_id
properties.description: • lab_virtual_network_id - (Required) The ID of the Dev Test Virtual Network where this Virtual Machine should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The Machine Size to use for this Virtual Machine, such as Standard_F2. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_type
properties.description: • storage_type - (Required) The type of Storage to use on this Virtual Machine. Possible values are Standard and Premium.

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The Username associated with the local administrator on this Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>

properties.name: allow_claim
properties.description: • allow_claim - (Optional) Can this Virtual Machine be claimed by users? Defaults to true.

properties.name: disallow_public_ip_address
properties.description: • disallow_public_ip_address - (Optional) Should the Virtual Machine be created without a Public IP Address? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: inbound_nat_rule
properties.description: • inbound_nat_rule - (Optional) One or more inbound_nat_rule blocks as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: If any inbound_nat_rule blocks are specified then disallow_public_ip_address must be set to true.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) Any notes about the Virtual Machine.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The Password associated with the username used to login to this Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ssh_key
properties.description: • ssh_key - (Optional) The SSH Key associated with the username used to login to this Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: One or either password or ssh_key must be specified.

properties.name: tags

properties.description: • ttl - (Required) The Time To Live (TTL) of the DNS record in seconds.

properties.name: record
properties.description: • record - (Required) A list of values that make up the txt record. Each record block supports fields documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The record block supports:

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value of the record.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the DNS Zone. Must be a valid domain name.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the resource group where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: registration_virtual_network_ids
properties.description: • registration_virtual_network_ids - (Optional) A list of Virtual Network ID's that register hostnames in this DNS zone. This field can only be set when zone_type is set to Private.

properties.name: resolution_virtual_network_ids
properties.description: • resolution_virtual_network_ids - (Optional) A list of Virtual Network ID's that resolve records in this DNS zone. This field can only be set when zone_type is set to Private.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zone_type
properties.description: • zone_type - (Optional / Deprecated) Specifies the type of this DNS zone. Possible values are Public or Private (Defaults to Public).
NOTE: This field was part of the initial Preview for Private DNS Zones - which has been replaced by the separate resource azurerm_private_dns_zone and will be removed in v2.0 of the Azure Provider.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the Front Door which is globally unique. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Name of the Resource group within the Azure subscription. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Resource location. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: backend_pool
properties.description: • backend_pool - (Required) A backend_pool block as defined below.

properties.name: backend_pool_health_probe
properties.description: • backend_pool_health_probe - (Required) A backend_pool_health_probe block as defined below.

properties.name: backend_pool_load_balancing
properties.description: • backend_pool_load_balancing - (Required) A backend_pool_load_balancing block as defined below.

properties.name: enforce_backend_pools_certificate_name_check
properties.description: • enforce_backend_pools_certificate_name_check - (Required) Whether to enforce certificate name check on HTTPS requests to all backend pools. No effect on non-HTTPS requests. Permitted values are true or false.

properties.name: load_balancer_enabled
properties.description: • load_balancer_enabled - (Optional) Operational status of the Front Door load balancer. Permitted values are true or false Defaults to true.

properties.name: friendly_name
properties.description: • friendly_name - (Optional) A friendly name for the Front Door service.

properties.name: frontend_endpoint
properties.description: • frontend_endpoint - (Required) A frontend_endpoint block as defined below.

properties.name: routing_rule
properties.description: • routing_rule - (Required) A routing_rule block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) Resource tags.
<hr/>
The backend_pool block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Backend Pool.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Required) A backend block as defined below.

properties.name: load_balancing_name
properties.description: • load_balancing_name - (Required) The name property of the backend_pool_load_balancing block whithin this resource to use for the Backend Pool.

properties.name: health_probe_name
properties.description: • health_probe_name - (Required) The name property of a backend_pool_health_probe block whithin this resource to use for the Backend Pool.
<hr/>
The backend block supports the following:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) Location of the backend (IP address or FQDN)

properties.name: host_header
properties.description: • host_header - (Required) The value to use as the host header sent to the backend.

properties.name: http_port
properties.description: • http_port - (Required) The HTTP TCP port number. Possible values are between 1 - 65535.

properties.name: https_port
properties.description: • https_port - (Required) The HTTPS TCP port number. Possible values are between 1 - 65535.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Optional) Priority to use for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority backend is healthy. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: • weight - (Optional) Weight of this endpoint for load balancing purposes. Defaults to 50.
<hr/>
The frontend_endpoint block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Frontend Endpoint.

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Required) The host name of the Frontend Endpoint. Must be a domain name.

properties.name: session_affinity_enabled
properties.description: • session_affinity_enabled - (Optional) Whether to allow session affinity on this host. Valid options are true or false Defaults to false.

properties.name: session_affinity_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • session_affinity_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The TTL to use in seconds for session affinity, if applicable. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: enable_custom_https_provisioning
properties.description: • enable_custom_https_provisioning - (Required) Name of the Frontend Endpoint.

properties.name: web_application_firewall_policy_link_id
properties.description: • web_application_firewall_policy_link_id - (Optional) Defines the Web Application Firewall policy ID for each host.
<hr/>
The backend_pool_health_probe block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Azure Front Door Backend Health Probe.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The path to use for the Backend Health Probe. Default is /.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) Protocol scheme to use for the Backend Health Probe. Defaults to Http.

properties.name: interval_in_seconds
properties.description: • interval_in_seconds - (Optional) The number of seconds between health probes. Defaults to 120.
<hr/>
The backend_pool_load_balancing block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Azure Front Door Backend Load Balancer.

properties.name: sample_size
properties.description: • sample_size - (Optional) The number of samples to consider for load balancing decisions. Defaults to 4.

properties.name: successful_samples_required
properties.description: • successful_samples_required - (Optional) The number of samples within the sample period that must succeed. Defaults to 2.

properties.name: additional_latency_milliseconds
properties.description: • additional_latency_milliseconds - (Optional) The additional latency in milliseconds for probes to fall into the lowest latency bucket. Defaults to 0.
<hr/>
The routing_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Front Door Backend Routing Rule.

properties.name: frontend_endpoints
properties.description: • frontend_endpoints - (Required) The names of the frontend_endpoint blocks whithin this resource to associate with this routing_rule.

properties.name: accepted_protocols
properties.description: • accepted_protocols - (Optional) Protocol schemes to match for the Backend Routing Rule. Defaults to Http.

properties.name: patterns_to_match
properties.description: • patterns_to_match - (Optional) The route patterns for the Backend Routing Rule. Defaults to /*.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enable or Disable use of this Backend Routing Rule. Permitted values are true or false. Defaults to true.

properties.name: forwarding_configuration
properties.description: • forwarding_configuration - (Optional) A forwarding_configuration block as defined below.
<hr/>
The forwarding_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: backend_pool_name
properties.description: • backend_pool_name - (Required) The name of the Front Door Backend Pool.

properties.name: cache_use_dynamic_compression
properties.description: • cache_use_dynamic_compression - (Optional) Whether to use dynamic compression when caching. Valid options are true or false. Defaults to true.

properties.name: cache_query_parameter_strip_directive
properties.description: • cache_query_parameter_strip_directive - (Optional) Defines cache behavior in releation to query string parameters. Valid options are StripAll or StripNone. Defaults to StripNone

properties.name: custom_forwarding_path
properties.description: • custom_forwarding_path - (Optional) Path to use when constructing the request to forward to the backend. This functions as a URL Rewrite. Default behavior preserves the URL path.

properties.name: forwarding_protocol
properties.description: • forwarding_protocol - (Optional) Protocol to use when redirecting. Valid options are HTTPOnly, HTTPSOnly, or MatchRequest. Defaults to MatchRequest.
<hr/>
The custom_https_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: certificate_source
properties.description: (Optional) Certificate source to encrypted HTTPS traffic with. Allowed values are FrontDoor or AzureKeyVault. Defaults to FrontDoor.
The following attributes are only valid if certificate_source is set to AzureKeyVault:

properties.name: azure_key_vault_certificate_vault_id
properties.description: • azure_key_vault_certificate_vault_id - (Required) The id of the Key Vault containing the SSL certificate.

properties.name: azure_key_vault_certificate_secret_name
properties.description: • azure_key_vault_certificate_secret_name - (Required) The name of the Key Vault secret representing the full certificate PFX.

properties.name: azure_key_vault_certificate_secret_version
properties.description: • azure_key_vault_certificate_secret_version - (Required) The version of the Key Vault secret representing the full certificate PFX.

Note: In order to enable the use of your own custom HTTPS certificate you must grant Azure Front Door Service access to your key vault. For instuctions on how to configure your Key Vault correctly please refer to the product documentation.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the policy. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Is the policy a enabled state or disabled state. Defaults to true.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) The firewall policy mode. Possible values are Detection, Prevention and defaults to Prevention.

properties.name: redirect_url
properties.description: • redirect_url - (Optional) If action type is redirect, this field represents redirect URL for the client.

properties.name: custom_rule
properties.description: • custom_rule - (Optional) One or more custom_rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: custom_block_response_status_code
properties.description: • custom_block_response_status_code - (Optional) If a custom_rule block's action type is block, this is the response status code. Possible values are 200, 403, 405, 406, or 429.

properties.name: custom_block_response_body
properties.description: • custom_block_response_body - (Optional) If a custom_rule block's action type is block, this is the response body. The body must be specified in base64 encoding.

properties.name: managed_rule
properties.description: • managed_rule - (Optional) One or more managed_rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Web Application Firewall Policy.
<hr/>
The custom_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Gets name of the resource that is unique within a policy. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) The action to perform when the rule is matched. Possible values are Allow, Block, Log, or Redirect.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Is the rule is enabled or disabled? Defaults to true.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Required) The priority of the rule. Rules with a lower value will be evaluated before rules with a higher value. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The the type of rule. Possible values are MatchRule or RateLimitRule.

properties.name: match_condition
properties.description: • match_condition - (Required) One or more match_condition block defined below.

properties.name: rate_limit_duration_in_minutes
properties.description: • rate_limit_duration_in_minutes - (Optional) The rate limit duration in minutes. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: rate_limit_threshold
properties.description: • rate_limit_threshold - (Optional) The rate limit threshold. Defaults to 10.
<hr/>
The match_condition block supports the following:

properties.name: match_variable
properties.description: • match_variable - (Required) The request variable to compare with. Possible values are Cookies, PostArgs, QueryString, RemoteAddr, RequestBody, RequestHeader, RequestMethod, or RequestURI.

properties.name: match_values
properties.description: • match_values - (Required) Up to 100 possible values to match.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: • operator - (Required) Comparison type to use for matching with the variable value. Possible values are Any, BeginsWith, Contains, EndsWith, Equal, GeoMatch, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, IPMatch, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual or RegEx.

properties.name: selector
properties.description: • selector - (Optional) Match against a specific key if the match_variable is QueryString, PostArgs, RequestHeader or Cookies.

properties.name: negation_condition
properties.description: • negation_condition - (Optional) Should the result of the condition be negated.

properties.name: transforms
properties.description: • transforms - (Optional) Up to 5 transforms to apply. Possible values are Lowercase, RemoveNulls, Trim, Uppercase, URLDecode orURLEncode.
<hr/>
The managed_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The name of the managed rule to use with this resource.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) The version on the managed rule to use with this resource.

properties.name: override
properties.description: • override - (Optional) One or more override blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
The override block supports the following:

properties.name: rule_group_name
properties.description: • rule_group_name - (Required) The managed rule group to override.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) One or more rule blocks as defined below. If none are specified, all of the rules in the group will be disabled.
<hr/>
The rule block supports the following:

properties.name: rule_id
properties.description: • rule_id - (Required) Identifier for the managed rule.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) The action to be applied when the rule matches. Possible values are Allow, Block, Log, or Redirect.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Is the managed rule override enabled or disabled. Defaults to false
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name for this HDInsight Hadoop Cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Resource Group in which this HDInsight Hadoop Cluster should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the Azure Region which this HDInsight Hadoop Cluster should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: cluster_version
properties.description: • cluster_version - (Required) Specifies the Version of HDInsights which should be used for this Cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: component_version
properties.description: • component_version - (Required) A component_version block as defined below.

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: • gateway - (Required) A gateway block as defined below.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: • roles - (Required) A roles block as defined below.

properties.name: storage_account
properties.description: • storage_account - (Required) One or more storage_account block as defined below.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: • tier - (Required) Specifies the Tier which should be used for this HDInsight Hadoop Cluster. Possible values are Standard or Premium. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A map of Tags which should be assigned to this HDInsight Hadoop Cluster.

A component_version block supports the following:

properties.name: hadoop
properties.description: (Required) The version of Hadoop which should be used for this HDInsight Hadoop Cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

A gateway block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is the Ambari portal enabled? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) The password used for the Ambari Portal. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: This password must be different from the one used for the head_node, worker_node and zookeeper_node roles.

properties.name: username
properties.description: (Required) The username used for the Ambari Portal. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A head_node block supports the following:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The Username of the local administrator for the Head Nodes. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vm_size
properties.description: • vm_size - (Required) The Size of the Virtual Machine which should be used as the Head Nodes. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The Password associated with the local administrator for the Head Nodes. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NOTE: If specified, this password must be at least 10 characters in length and must contain at least one digit, one uppercase and one lower case letter, one non-alphanumeric character (except characters ' " ` ).

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: (Optional) A list of SSH Keys which should be used for the local administrator on the Head Nodes. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: Either a password or one or more ssh_keys must be specified - but not both.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Optional) The ID of the Subnet within the Virtual Network where the Head Nodes should be provisioned within. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_network_id
properties.description: • virtual_network_id - (Optional) The ID of the Virtual Network where the Head Nodes should be provisioned within. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
