properties.name: head_node
properties.description: • head_node - (Required) A head_node block as defined above.

properties.name: worker_node
properties.description: • worker_node - (Required) A worker_node block as defined below.

properties.name: zookeeper_node
properties.description: • zookeeper_node - (Required) A zookeeper_node block as defined below.

properties.description: (Required) Is this the Default Storage Account for the HDInsight Hadoop Cluster? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: One of the storage_account blocks must be marked as the default.

properties.name: storage_account_key
properties.description: • storage_account_key - (Required) The Access Key which should be used to connect to the Storage Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_container_id
properties.description: • storage_container_id - (Required) The ID of the Storage Container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: This can be obtained from the id of the azurerm_storage_container resource.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Key Vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Key Vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Optional Deprecated)) A sku block as described below.

properties.name: sku_name
properties.description: • sku_name - (Optional) The Name of the SKU used for this Key Vault. Possible values are standard and premium.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

properties.name: access_policy
properties.description: • access_policy - (Optional) A list of up to 16 objects describing access policies, as described below.

NOTE: It's possible to define Key Vault Access Policies both within the azurerm_key_vault resource via the access_policy block and by using the azurerm_key_vault_access_policy resource. However it's not possible to use both methods to manage Access Policies within a KeyVault, since there'll be conflicts.

properties.name: enabled_for_deployment
properties.description: • enabled_for_deployment - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault. Defaults to false.

properties.name: enabled_for_disk_encryption
properties.description: • enabled_for_disk_encryption - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys. Defaults to false.

properties.name: enabled_for_template_deployment
properties.description: • enabled_for_template_deployment - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault. Defaults to false.

properties.name: network_acls
properties.description: • network_acls - (Optional) A network_acls block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
A sku block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The Name of the SKU used for this Key Vault. Possible values are standard and premium.
<hr/>
A access_policy block supports the following:
Elements of access_policy support:

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault. Must match the tenant_id used above.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: • object_id - (Required) The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must be unique for the list of access policies.

properties.name: application_id
properties.description: • application_id - (Optional) The object ID of an Application in Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: certificate_permissions
properties.description: • certificate_permissions - (Optional) List of certificate permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, create, delete, deleteissuers, get, getissuers, import, list, listissuers, managecontacts, manageissuers, purge, recover, restore, setissuers and update.

properties.name: key_permissions
properties.description: • key_permissions - (Optional) List of key permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, create, decrypt, delete, encrypt, get, import, list, purge, recover, restore, sign, unwrapKey, update, verify and wrapKey.

properties.name: secret_permissions
properties.description: • secret_permissions - (Optional) List of secret permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, delete, get, list, purge, recover, restore and set.

properties.name: storage_permissions
properties.description: • storage_permissions - (Optional) List of storage permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, delete, deletesas, get, getsas, list, listsas, purge, recover, regeneratekey, restore, set, setsas and update.
<hr/>
A network_acls block supports the following:

properties.name: bypass
properties.description: • bypass - (Required) Specifies which traffic can bypass the network rules. Possible values are AzureServices and None.

properties.name: default_action
properties.description: • default_action - (Required) The Default Action to use when no rules match from ip_rules / virtual_network_subnet_ids. Possible values are Allow and Deny.

properties.name: ip_rules
properties.description: • ip_rules - (Optional) One or more IP Addresses, or CIDR Blocks which should be able to access the Key Vault.

properties.name: virtual_network_subnet_ids
properties.description: • virtual_network_subnet_ids - (Optional) One or more Subnet ID's which should be able to access this Key Vault.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: key_vault_id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the id of the Key Vault resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NOTE: At this time the Key Vault <-> Key Vault Access Policy associations need to be configured using the field key_vault_id or using both fields vault_name and resource_group_name. These fields are now deprecated and will be removed in favour of key_vault_id in the next major version (2.0) of the AzureRM Provider.

properties.name: vault_name
properties.description: • vault_name - (Required / Deprecated) Specifies the name of the Key Vault resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required / Deprecated) The name of the resource group in which to create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: • object_id - (Required) The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must be unique for the list of access policies. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: application_id
properties.description: • application_id - (Optional) The object ID of an Application in Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: certificate_permissions
properties.description: • certificate_permissions - (Optional) List of certificate permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, create, delete, deleteissuers, get, getissuers, import, list, listissuers, managecontacts, manageissuers, purge, recover, restore, setissuers and update.

properties.name: key_permissions
properties.description: • key_permissions - (Required) List of key permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, create, decrypt, delete, encrypt, get, import, list, purge, recover, restore, sign, unwrapKey, update, verify and wrapKey.

properties.name: secret_permissions
properties.description: • secret_permissions - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more from the following: backup, delete, get, list, purge, recover, restore and set.

properties.name: storage_permissions

properties.name: name

properties.name: key_vault_id
properties.description: • key_vault_id - (Required) The ID of the Key Vault where the Key should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: key_type
properties.description: • key_type - (Required) Specifies the Key Type to use for this Key Vault Key. Possible values are EC (Elliptic Curve), EC-HSM, Oct (Octet), RSA and RSA-HSM. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: key_size
properties.description: • key_size - (Optional) Specifies the Size of the RSA key to create in bytes. For example, 1024 or 2048. Note: This field is required if key_type is RSA or RSA-HSM. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: curve
properties.description: • curve - (Optional) Specifies the curve to use when creating an EC key. Possible values are P-256, P-384, P-521, and SECP256K1. This field will be required in a future release if key_type is EC or EC-HSM. The API will default to P-256 if nothing is specified. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: key_opts
properties.description: • key_opts - (Required) A list of JSON web key operations. Possible values include: decrypt, encrypt, sign, unwrapKey, verify and wrapKey. Please note these values are case sensitive.

properties.description: (Optional) One or multiple frontend_ip_configuration blocks as documented below.

properties.description: • sku - (Optional) The SKU of the Azure Load Balancer. Accepted values are Basic and Standard. Defaults to Basic.

properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
frontend_ip_configuration supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the frontend ip configuration.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: The ID of the Subnet which should be associated with the IP Configuration.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: (Optional) Private IP Address to assign to the Load Balancer. The last one and first four IPs in any range are reserved and cannot be manually assigned.

properties.name: private_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: (Optional) The allocation method for the Private IP Address used by this Load Balancer. Possible values as Dynamic and Static.

properties.name: public_ip_address_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of a Public IP Address which should be associated with the Load Balancer.

properties.name: public_ip_prefix_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of a Public IP Prefix which should be associated with the Load Balancer. Public IP Prefix can only be used with outbound rules.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Availability Zones which the Load Balancer's IP Addresses should be created in.
Please Note: Availability Zones are only supported in several regions at this time.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Backend Address Pool.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the Backend Address Pool.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the LB Rule.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the Rule.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration to which the rule is associated.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are Tcp, Udp or All.

properties.name: frontend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each Rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Possible values range between 0 and 65534, inclusive.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: (Required) The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Possible values range between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

properties.name: backend_address_pool_id
properties.description: (Optional) A reference to a Backend Address Pool over which this Load Balancing Rule operates.

properties.name: probe_id
properties.description: (Optional) A reference to a Probe used by this Load Balancing Rule.

properties.name: enable_floating_ip
properties.description: (Optional) Floating IP is pertinent to failover scenarios: a "floating” IP is reassigned to a secondary server in case the primary server fails. Floating IP is required for SQL AlwaysOn.

properties.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the timeout for the Tcp idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to Tcp.

properties.name: load_distribution
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the load balancing distribution type to be used by the Load Balancer. Possible values are: Default – The load balancer is configured to use a 5 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. SourceIP – The load balancer is configured to use a 2 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. SourceIPProtocol – The load balancer is configured to use a 3 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. Also known as Session Persistence, where the options are called None, Client IP and Client IP and Protocol respectively.

properties.name: disable_outbound_snat
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether outbound snat is disabled or enabled. Default false. ## Attributes Reference
The following attributes are exported:

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the Load Balancer to which the resource is attached.

properties.description: (Optional) Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

properties.name: allocated_outbound_ports
properties.description: (Optional) The number of outbound ports to be used for NAT.

properties.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
properties.description: (Optional) The timeout for the TCP idle connection

properties.description: (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.

properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the NAT pool.

properties.description: (Required) The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

properties.name: frontend_port_end
properties.description: (Required) The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Probe.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT Rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the protocol of the end point. Possible values are Http, Https or Tcp. If Tcp is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If Http is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URI is required for the probe to be successful.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) Port on which the Probe queries the backend endpoint. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.

properties.name: request_path
properties.description: (Optional) The URI used for requesting health status from the backend endpoint. Required if protocol is set to Http. Otherwise, it is not allowed.

properties.name: interval_in_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) The interval, in seconds between probes to the backend endpoint for health status. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.

properties.name: number_of_probes
properties.description: (Optional) The number of failed probe attempts after which the backend endpoint is removed from rotation. The default value is 2. NumberOfProbes multiplied by intervalInSeconds value must be greater or equal to 10.Endpoints are returned to rotation when at least one probe is successful.

properties.description: • workflow_version - (Optional) Specifies the version of the Schema used for this Logic App Workflow. Defaults to 1.0.0.0. Changing this forces a new resource to be create.d

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - (Optional) A map of Key-Value pairs.
NOTE: Any parameters specified must exist in the Schema defined in workflow_schema.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Management Lock. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: • scope - (Required) Specifies the scope at which the Management Lock should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: lock_level
properties.description: • lock_level - (Required) Specifies the Level to be used for this Lock. Possible values are CanNotDelete and ReadOnly. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: CanNotDelete means authorized users are able to read and modify the resources, but not delete. ReadOnly means authorized users can only read from a resource, but they can't modify or delete it.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies some notes about the lock. Maximum of 512 characters. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: group_id
properties.description: • group_id - (Optional) The UUID for this Management Group, which needs to be unique across your tenant - which will be generated if not provided. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) A friendly name for this Management Group. If not specified, this'll be the same as the group_id.

properties.name: parent_management_group_id
properties.description: • parent_management_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Parent Management Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: subscription_ids
properties.description: • subscription_ids - (Optional) A list of Subscription GUIDs which should be assigned to the Management Group.

NOTE: Whilst multiple storage_account blocks can be specified - one of them must be set to the primary

<hr/>

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the EventHub Namespace resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: namespace_name
properties.description: • namespace_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the EventHub Namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the EventHub's parent Namespace exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: partition_count
properties.description: • partition_count - (Required) Specifies the current number of shards on the Event Hub. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: message_retention
properties.description: • message_retention - (Required) Specifies the number of days to retain the events for this Event Hub. Needs to be between 1 and 7 days; or 1 day when using a Basic SKU for the parent EventHub Namespace.

properties.name: capture_description
properties.description: • capture_description - (Optional) A capture_description block as defined below.
<hr/>
A capture_description block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Specifies if the Capture Description is Enabled.

properties.name: encoding
properties.description: • encoding - (Required) Specifies the Encoding used for the Capture Description. Possible values are Avro and AvroDeflate.

properties.name: interval_in_seconds
properties.description: • interval_in_seconds - (Optional) Specifies the time interval in seconds at which the capture will happen. Values can be between 60 and 900 seconds. Defaults to 300 seconds.

properties.name: size_limit_in_bytes
properties.description: • size_limit_in_bytes - (Optional) Specifies the amount of data built up in your EventHub before a Capture Operation occurs. Value should be between 10485760 and 524288000 bytes. Defaults to 314572800 bytes.

properties.name: skip_empty_archives
properties.description: • skip_empty_archives - (Optional) Specifies if empty files should not be emitted if no events occur during the Capture time window. Defaults to false.

properties.name: destination
properties.description: • destination - (Required) A destination block as defined below.
A destination block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The Name of the Destination where the capture should take place. At this time the only supported value is EventHubArchive.AzureBlockBlob.
At this time it's only possible to Capture EventHub messages to Blob Storage. There's a Feature Request for the Azure SDK to add support for Capturing messages to Azure Data Lake here.

properties.name: archive_name_format
properties.description: • archive_name_format - The Blob naming convention for archiving. e.g. {Namespace}/{EventHub}/{PartitionId}/{Year}/{Month}/{Day}/{Hour}/{Minute}/{Second}. Here all the parameters (Namespace,EventHub .. etc) are mandatory irrespective of order

properties.name: blob_container_name
properties.description: • blob_container_name - (Required) The name of the Container within the Blob Storage Account where messages should be archived.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Required) The ID of the Blob Storage Account where messages should be archived.

properties.name: resource_group_name

NOTE At least one of the 3 permissions below needs to be set.

properties.name: listen
properties.description: • listen - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Listen to the Event Hub? Defaults to false.

properties.name: send
properties.description: • send - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Send to the Event Hub? Defaults to false.

properties.name: manage
properties.description: • manage - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Manage to the Event Hub? When this property is true - both listen and send must be too. Defaults to false.

<hr/>
A sku block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the sku. Possible values are B1, B2, B3, F1, S1, S2, and S3.

NOTE: Only one IotHub can be on the Free tier per subscription.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: (Required) The number of provisioned IoT Hub units.
<hr/>
An endpoint block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of the endpoint. Possible values are AzureIotHub.StorageContainer, AzureIotHub.ServiceBusQueue, AzureIotHub.ServiceBusTopic or AzureIotHub.EventHub.

properties.name: connection_string
properties.description: • connection_string - (Required) The connection string for the endpoint.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the endpoint. The name must be unique across endpoint types. The following names are reserved: events, operationsMonitoringEvents, fileNotifications and $default.

properties.name: batch_frequency_in_seconds
properties.description: • batch_frequency_in_seconds - (Optional) Time interval at which blobs are written to storage. Value should be between 60 and 720 seconds. Default value is 300 seconds. This attribute is mandatory for endpoint type AzureIotHub.StorageContainer.

properties.name: max_chunk_size_in_bytes
properties.description: • max_chunk_size_in_bytes - (Optional) Maximum number of bytes for each blob written to storage. Value should be between 10485760(10MB) and 524288000(500MB). Default value is 314572800(300MB). This attribute is mandatory for endpoint type AzureIotHub.StorageContainer.

properties.name: container_name
properties.description: • container_name - (Optional) The name of storage container in the storage account. This attribute is mandatory for endpoint type AzureIotHub.StorageContainer.

properties.name: encoding
properties.description: • encoding - (Optional) Encoding that is used to serialize messages to blobs. Supported values are 'avro' and 'avrodeflate'. Default value is 'avro'. This attribute is mandatory for endpoint type AzureIotHub.StorageContainer.

properties.name: file_name_format
properties.description: • file_name_format - (Optional) File name format for the blob. Default format is {iothub}/{partition}/{YYYY}/{MM}/{DD}/{HH}/{mm}. All parameters are mandatory but can be reordered. This attribute is mandatory for endpoint type AzureIotHub.StorageContainer.
<hr/>
An ip_filter_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the filter.

properties.name: ip_mask
properties.description: • ip_mask - (Required) The IP address range in CIDR notation for the rule.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) The desired action for requests captured by this rule. Possible values are Accept, Reject
<hr/>
A route block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route.

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Required) The source that the routing rule is to be applied to, such as DeviceMessages. Possible values include: RoutingSourceInvalid, RoutingSourceDeviceMessages, RoutingSourceTwinChangeEvents, RoutingSourceDeviceLifecycleEvents, RoutingSourceDeviceJobLifecycleEvents.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition - (Optional) The condition that is evaluated to apply the routing rule. If no condition is provided, it evaluates to true by default. For grammar, see: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-query-language.

properties.name: endpoint_names
properties.description: • endpoint_names - (Required) The list of endpoints to which messages that satisfy the condition are routed.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Used to specify whether a route is enabled.
<hr/>
A fallback_route block supports the following:

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Optional) The source that the routing rule is to be applied to, such as DeviceMessages. Possible values include: RoutingSourceInvalid, RoutingSourceDeviceMessages, RoutingSourceTwinChangeEvents, RoutingSourceDeviceLifecycleEvents, RoutingSourceDeviceJobLifecycleEvents.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition - (Optional) The condition that is evaluated to apply the routing rule. If no condition is provided, it evaluates to true by default. For grammar, see: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-query-language.

properties.name: endpoint_names
properties.description: • endpoint_names - (Optional) The endpoints to which messages that satisfy the condition are routed. Currently only 1 endpoint is allowed.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Used to specify whether the fallback route is enabled.
<hr/>
A file_upload block supports the following:

properties.name: connection_string
properties.description: • connection_string - (Required) The connection string for the Azure Storage account to which files are uploaded.

properties.name: container_name
properties.description: • container_name - (Required) The name of the root container where you upload files. The container need not exist but should be creatable using the connection_string specified.

properties.name: sas_ttl
properties.description: • sas_ttl - (Optional) The period of time for which the SAS URI generated by IoT Hub for file upload is valid, specified as an ISO 8601 timespan duration. This value must be between 1 minute and 24 hours, and evaluates to 'PT1H' by default.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: • notifications - (Optional) Used to specify whether file notifications are sent to IoT Hub on upload. It evaluates to false by default.

properties.name: lock_duration
properties.description: • lock_duration - (Optional) The lock duration for the file upload notifications queue, specified as an ISO 8601 timespan duration. This value must be between 5 and 300 seconds, and evaluates to 'PT1M' by default.

properties.name: default_ttl
properties.description: • default_ttl - (Optional) The period of time for which a file upload notification message is available to consume before it is expired by the IoT hub, specified as an ISO 8601 timespan duration. This value must be between 1 minute and 48 hours, and evaluates to 'PT1H' by default.

properties.name: max_delivery_count
properties.description: • max_delivery_count - (Optional) The number of times the IoT hub attempts to deliver a file upload notification message. It evaluates to 10 by default.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.description: • eventhub_endpoint_name - (Required) The name of the Event Hub-compatible endpoint in the IoT hub. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group that contains the IoT hub. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: iothub_name
properties.description: • iothub_name - (Required) The name of the IoTHub to which this Shared Access Policy belongs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: registry_read
properties.description: • registry_read - (Optional) Adds RegistryRead permission to this Shared Access Account. It allows read access to the identity registry.

properties.name: registry_write
properties.description: • registry_write - (Optional) Adds RegistryWrite permission to this Shared Access Account. It allows write access to the identity registry.
NOTE When registry_write is set to true, registry_read must also be set to true. This is a limitation of the Azure REST API

properties.name: service_connect
properties.description: • service_connect - (Optional) Adds ServiceConnect permission to this Shared Access Account. It allows sending and receiving on the cloud-side endpoints.

properties.name: device_connect
properties.description: • device_connect - (Optional) Adds DeviceConnect permission to this Shared Access Account. It allows sending and receiving on the device-side endpoints.
NOTE At least one of registry_read, registry_write, service_connect, device_connect permissions must be set to true.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the ServiceBus Namespace resource . Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • sku - (Required) Defines which tier to use. Options are basic, standard or premium.

properties.description: • capacity - (Optional) Specifies the capacity. When sku is Premium can be 1, 2 or 4. When sku is Basic or Standard can be 0 only.

properties.description: • zone_redundant - (Optional) Whether or not this resource is zone redundant. sku needs to be Premium. Defaults to false.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the ServiceBus Namespace Authorization Rule resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: namespace_name
properties.description: • namespace_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the ServiceBus Namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the ServiceBus Namespace exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE At least one of the 3 permissions below needs to be set.

properties.name: listen
properties.description: • listen - (Optional) Grants listen access to this this Authorization Rule. Defaults to false.

properties.name: send
properties.description: • send - (Optional) Grants send access to this this Authorization Rule. Defaults to false.

properties.name: manage

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the ServiceBus Queue resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: namespace_name
properties.description: • namespace_name - (Required) The name of the ServiceBus Namespace to create this queue in. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Optional / Deprecated) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: auto_delete_on_idle
properties.description: • auto_delete_on_idle - (Optional) The ISO 8601 timespan duration of the idle interval after which the Queue is automatically deleted, minimum of 5 minutes.

properties.name: default_message_ttl
properties.description: • default_message_ttl - (Optional) The ISO 8601 timespan duration of the TTL of messages sent to this queue. This is the default value used when TTL is not set on message itself.

properties.name: duplicate_detection_history_time_window
properties.description: • duplicate_detection_history_time_window - (Optional) The ISO 8601 timespan duration during which duplicates can be detected. Default value is 10 minutes. (PT10M)

properties.name: enable_express
properties.description: • enable_express - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage. Defaults to false for Basic and Standard. For Premium, it MUST be set to false.
NOTE: Service Bus Premium namespaces do not support Express Entities, so enable_express MUST be set to false.

properties.name: enable_partitioning
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether to enable the queue to be partitioned across multiple message brokers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false for Basic and Standard. For Premium, it MUST be set to true.

NOTE: Partitioning is available at entity creation for all queues and topics in Basic or Standard SKUs. It is not available for the Premium messaging SKU, but any previously existing partitioned entities in Premium namespaces continue to work as expected. Please see the documentation for more information.

properties.name: lock_duration
properties.description: • lock_duration - (Optional) The ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. Maximum value is 5 minutes. Defaults to 1 minute. (PT1M)

properties.name: max_size_in_megabytes
properties.description: • max_size_in_megabytes - (Optional) Integer value which controls the size of memory allocated for the queue. For supported values see the "Queue/topic size" section of this document.

properties.name: requires_duplicate_detection
properties.description: • requires_duplicate_detection - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether the Queue requires duplicate detection. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false.

properties.name: requires_session
properties.description: • requires_session - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether the Queue requires sessions. This will allow ordered handling of unbounded sequences of related messages. With sessions enabled a queue can guarantee first-in-first-out delivery of messages. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false.

properties.name: dead_lettering_on_message_expiration
properties.description: • dead_lettering_on_message_expiration - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether the Queue has dead letter support when a message expires. Defaults to false.

properties.name: max_delivery_count
properties.description: • max_delivery_count - (Optional) Integer value which controls when a message is automatically deadlettered. Defaults to 10.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Authorization Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: queue_name
properties.description: • queue_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the ServiceBus Queue. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: send

properties.name: manage
properties.description: • manage - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have Manage permissions to the ServiceBus Queue? When this property is true - both listen and send must be too. Defaults to false.

properties.name: scale_action
properties.description: • scale_action - (Required) A scale_action block as defined below.
<hr/>
A metric_trigger block supports the following:

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the metric that defines what the rule monitors, such as Percentage CPU for Virtual Machine Scale Sets and CpuPercentage for App Service Plan.
NOTE: The allowed value of metric_name highly depends on the targeting resource type, please visit Supported metrics with Azure Monitor for more details.

properties.name: metric_resource_id
properties.description: • metric_resource_id - (Required) The ID of the Resource which the Rule monitors.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: • operator - (Required) Specifies the operator used to compare the metric data and threshold. Possible values are: Equals, NotEquals, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual.

properties.name: statistic
properties.description: • statistic - (Required) Specifies how the metrics from multiple instances are combined. Possible values are Average, Min and Max.

properties.name: time_aggregation
properties.description: • time_aggregation - (Required) Specifies how the data that's collected should be combined over time. Possible values include Average, Count, Maximum, Minimum, Last and Total. Defaults to Average.

properties.name: time_grain
properties.description: • time_grain - (Required) Specifies the granularity of metrics that the rule monitors, which must be one of the pre-defined values returned from the metric definitions for the metric. This value must be between 1 minute and 12 hours an be formatted as an ISO 8601 string.

properties.name: time_window
properties.description: • time_window - (Required) Specifies the time range for which data is collected, which must be greater than the delay in metric collection (which varies from resource to resource). This value must be between 5 minutes and 12 hours and be formatted as an ISO 8601 string.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: • threshold - (Required) Specifies the threshold of the metric that triggers the scale action.
<hr/>
A scale_action block supports the following:

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: • cooldown - (Required) The amount of time to wait since the last scaling action before this action occurs. Must be between 1 minute and 1 week and formatted as a ISO 8601 string.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Required) The scale direction. Possible values are Increase and Decrease.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of action that should occur. Possible values are ChangeCount, ExactCount and PercentChangeCount.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The number of instances involved in the scaling action. Defaults to 1.
<hr/>
A fixed_date block supports the following:

properties.name: end
properties.description: • end - (Required) Specifies the end date for the profile, formatted as an RFC3339 date string.

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) Specifies the start date for the profile, formatted as an RFC3339 date string.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone (Optional) The Time Zone of the start and end times. A list of possible values can be found here. Defaults to UTC.
<hr/>
A recurrence block supports the following:

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone - (Required) The Time Zone used for the hours field. A list of possible values can be found here. Defaults to UTC.

properties.name: days
properties.description: • days - (Required) A list of days that this profile takes effect on. Possible values include Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

properties.name: hours
properties.description: • hours - (Required) A list containing a single item, which specifies the Hour interval at which this recurrence should be triggered (in 24-hour time). Possible values are from 0 to 23.

properties.name: minutes
properties.description: • minutes - (Required) A list containing a single item which specifies the Minute interval at which this recurrence should be triggered.
<hr/>
A notification block supports the following:

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email - (Required) A email block as defined below.

properties.name: webhook
properties.description: • webhook - (Optional) One or more webhook blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A email block supports the following:

properties.name: send_to_subscription_administrator
properties.description: • send_to_subscription_administrator - (Optional) Should email notifications be sent to the subscription administrator? Defaults to false.

properties.name: send_to_subscription_co_administrator
properties.description: • send_to_subscription_co_administrator - (Optional) Should email notifications be sent to the subscription co-administrator? Defaults to false.

properties.name: custom_emails
properties.description: • custom_emails - (Optional) Specifies a list of custom email addresses to which the email notifications will be sent.
<hr/>
A webhook block supports the following:

properties.name: service_uri
properties.description: • service_uri - (Required) The HTTPS URI which should receive scale notifications.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: • properties - (Optional) A map of settings.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Action Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Action Group instance.

properties.name: short_name
properties.description: (Required) The short name of the action group. This will be used in SMS messages.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action group is enabled. If an action group is not enabled, then none of its receivers will receive communications. Defaults to true.

properties.name: email_receiver
properties.description: (Optional) One or more email_receiver blocks as defined below.

properties.name: sms_receiver
properties.description: (Optional) One or more sms_receiver blocks as defined below.

properties.name: webhook_receiver
properties.description: (Optional) One or more webhook_receiver blocks as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
email_receiver supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the email receiver. Names must be unique (case-insensitive) across all receivers within an action group.

properties.name: email_address
properties.description: (Required) The email address of this receiver.
<hr/>
sms_receiver supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the SMS receiver. Names must be unique (case-insensitive) across all receivers within an action group.

properties.name: country_code
properties.description: (Required) The country code of the SMS receiver.

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: (Required) The phone number of the SMS receiver.
<hr/>
webhook_receiver supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the webhook receiver. Names must be unique (case-insensitive) across all receivers within an action group.

properties.name: service_uri
properties.description: (Required) The URI where webhooks should be sent.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the activity log alert. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the activity log alert instance.

properties.name: scopes
properties.description: (Required) The Scope at which the Activity Log should be applied, for example a the Resource ID of a Subscription or a Resource (such as a Storage Account).

properties.name: criteria
properties.description: (Required) A criteria block as defined below.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Optional) One or more action blocks as defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Should this Activity Log Alert be enabled? Defaults to true.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of this activity log alert.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
An action block supports the following:

properties.name: action_group_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Action Group can be sourced from the azurerm_monitor_action_group resource.

properties.name: webhook_properties
properties.description: (Optional) The map of custom string properties to include with the post operation. These data are appended to the webhook payload.
<hr/>
A criteria block supports the following:

properties.name: category
properties.description: (Required) The category of the operation. Possible values are Administrative, Autoscale, Policy, Recommendation, Security and Service Health.

properties.name: operation_name
properties.description: (Optional) The Resource Manager Role-Based Access Control operation name. Supported operation should be of the form: <resourceProvider>/<resourceType>/<operation>.

properties.name: resource_provider
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the resource provider monitored by the activity log alert.

properties.name: resource_type
properties.description: (Optional) The resource type monitored by the activity log alert.

properties.name: resource_group
properties.description: (Optional) The name of resource group monitored by the activity log alert.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: (Optional) The specific resource monitored by the activity log alert. It should be within one of the scopes.

properties.name: caller
properties.description: (Optional) The email address or Azure Active Directory identifier of the user who performed the operation.

properties.name: level
properties.description: (Optional) The severity level of the event. Possible values are Verbose, Informational, Warning, Error, and Critical.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional) The status of the event. For example, Started, Failed, or Succeeded.

properties.name: sub_status
properties.description: (Optional) The sub status of the event.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the AutoScale Setting. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in the AutoScale Setting should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the AutoScale Setting should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: profile
properties.description: • profile - (Required) Specifies one or more (up to 20) profile blocks as defined below.

properties.name: target_resource_id
properties.description: • target_resource_id - (Required) Specifies the resource ID of the resource that the autoscale setting should be added to.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether automatic scaling is enabled for the target resource. Defaults to true.

properties.name: notification
properties.description: • notification - (Optional) Specifies a notification block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
A profile block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the profile.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) A capacity block as defined below.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Required) One or more (up to 10) rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: fixed_date
properties.description: • fixed_date - (Optional) A fixed_date block as defined below. This cannot be specified if a recurrence block is specified.

properties.name: recurrence
properties.description: • recurrence - (Optional) A recurrence block as defined below. This cannot be specified if a fixed_date block is specified.
<hr/>
A capacity block supports the following:

properties.name: default
properties.description: • default - (Required) The number of instances that are available for scaling if metrics are not available for evaluation. The default is only used if the current instance count is lower than the default. Valid values are between 0 and 1000.

properties.name: maximum
properties.description: • maximum - (Required) The maximum number of instances for this resource. Valid values are between 0 and 1000.
NOTE: The maximum number of instances is also limited by the amount of Cores available in the subscription.

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: (Required) The minimum number of instances for this resource. Valid values are between 0 and 1000.
<hr/>
A rule block supports the following:

properties.name: metric_trigger
properties.description: • metric_trigger - (Required) A metric_trigger block as defined below.

properties.name: scale_action

A email block supports the following:

properties.name: service_uri

properties.name: properties
properties.description: • properties - (Optional) A map of settings.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Diagnostic Setting. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: target_resource_id
properties.description: • target_resource_id - (Required) The ID of an existing Resource on which to configure Diagnostic Settings. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: eventhub_name
properties.description: • eventhub_name - (Optional) Specifies the name of the Event Hub where Diagnostics Data should be sent. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: If this isn't specified then the default Event Hub will be used.

properties.name: eventhub_authorization_rule_id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of an Event Hub Namespace Authorization Rule used to send Diagnostics Data. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: This can be sourced from the azurerm_eventhub_namespace_authorization_rule resource and is different from a azurerm_eventhub_authorization_rule resource.
NOTE: One of eventhub_authorization_rule_id, log_analytics_workspace_id and storage_account_id must be specified.

properties.name: log
properties.description: (Optional) One or more log blocks as defined below.
NOTE: At least one log or metric block must be specified.

properties.name: log_analytics_workspace_id
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the ID of a Log Analytics Workspace where Diagnostics Data should be sent. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: One of eventhub_authorization_rule_id, log_analytics_workspace_id and storage_account_id must be specified.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: (Optional) One or more metric blocks as defined below.
NOTE: At least one log or metric block must be specified.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: (Optional) With this parameter you can specify a storage account which should be used to send the logs to. Parameter must be a valid Azure Resource ID. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: One of eventhub_authorization_rule_id, log_analytics_workspace_id and storage_account_id must be specified.

properties.name: log_analytics_destination_type
properties.description: (Optional) When set to 'Dedicated' logs sent to a Log Analytics workspace will go into resource specific tables, instead of the legacy AzureDiagnostics table.

NOTE: This setting will only have an effect if a log_analytics_workspace_id is provided, and the resource is available for resource-specific logs. As of July 2019, this only includes Azure Data Factory. Please see the documentation for more information.
<hr/>
A log block supports the following:

properties.name: category
properties.description: (Required) The name of a Diagnostic Log Category for this Resource.

NOTE: The Log Categories available vary depending on the Resource being used. You may wish to use the azurerm_monitor_diagnostic_categories Data Source to identify which categories are available for a given Resource.

properties.name: retention_policy
properties.description: • retention_policy - (Required) A retention_policy block as defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Is this Diagnostic Log enabled? Defaults to true.
<hr/>
A metric block supports the following:

properties.name: category
properties.description: (Required) The name of a Diagnostic Metric Category for this Resource.

NOTE: The Metric Categories available vary depending on the Resource being used. You may wish to use the azurerm_monitor_diagnostic_categories Data Source to identify which categories are available for a given Resource.

properties.name: retention_policy
properties.description: • retention_policy - (Required) A retention_policy block as defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Is this Diagnostic Metric enabled? Defaults to true.
<hr/>
A retention_policy block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is this Retention Policy enabled?

properties.name: days
properties.description: • days - (Optional) The number of days for which this Retention Policy should apply.
NOTE: Setting this to 0 will retain the events indefinitely.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Log Profile. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: categories
properties.description: • categories - (Required) List of categories of the logs.

properties.name: locations
properties.description: • locations - (Required) List of regions for which Activity Log events are stored or streamed.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Optional) The resource ID of the storage account in which the Activity Log is stored. At least one of storage_account_id or servicebus_rule_id must be set.

properties.name: servicebus_rule_id
properties.description: • servicebus_rule_id - (Optional) The service bus (or event hub) rule ID of the service bus (or event hub) namespace in which the Activity Log is streamed to. At least one of storage_account_id or servicebus_rule_id must be set.

properties.name: retention_policy
properties.description: • retention_policy - (Required) A retention_policy block as documented below. A retention policy for how long Activity Logs are retained in the storage account.
<hr/>
The retention_policy block supports:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) A boolean value to indicate whether the retention policy is enabled.

properties.name: days
properties.description: • days - (Optional) The number of days for the retention policy. Defaults to 0.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Metric Alert. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Metric Alert instance.

properties.name: scopes
properties.description: (Required) A set of strings of resource IDs at which the metric criteria should be applied.

properties.name: criteria
properties.description: (Required) One or more criteria blocks as defined below.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Optional) One or more action blocks as defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Should this Metric Alert be enabled? Defaults to true.

properties.name: auto_mitigate
properties.description: (Optional) Should the alerts in this Metric Alert be auto resolved? Defaults to false.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of this Metric Alert.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: (Optional) The evaluation frequency of this Metric Alert, represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Possible values are PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M and PT1H. Defaults to PT1M.

properties.name: severity
properties.description: (Optional) The severity of this Metric Alert. Possible values are 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4. Defaults to 3.

properties.name: window_size
properties.description: (Optional) The period of time that is used to monitor alert activity, represented in ISO 8601 duration format. This value must be greater than frequency. Possible values are PT1M, PT5M, PT15M, PT30M, PT1H, PT6H, PT12H and P1D. Defaults to PT5M.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: action_group_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Action Group can be sourced from the azurerm_monitor_action_group resource

properties.name: webhook_properties

properties.description: (Required) One of the metric namespaces to be monitored.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: (Required) One of the metric names to be monitored.

properties.name: aggregation
properties.description: (Required) The statistic that runs over the metric values. Possible values are Average, Count, Minimum, Maximum and Total.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Required) The criteria operator. Possible values are Equals, NotEquals, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan and LessThanOrEqual.

properties.description: • aggregation - (Required) Defines how the metric data is combined over time. Possible values are Average, Minimum, Maximum, Total, and Last.
<hr/>

properties.name: email_action
properties.description: • email_action - (Optional) A email_action block as defined below.

properties.name: webhook_action
properties.description: • webhook_action - (Optional) A webhook_action block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
email_action supports the following:

properties.name: send_to_service_owners
properties.description: • send_to_service_owners - (Optional) If true, the administrators (service and co-administrators) of the subscription are notified when the alert is triggered. Defaults to false.

properties.name: custom_emails
properties.description: • custom_emails - (Optional) A list of email addresses to be notified when the alert is triggered.

webhook_action supports the following:

properties.name: service_uri
properties.description: • service_uri - (Required) The service uri of the webhook to POST the notification when the alert is triggered.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: • properties - (Optional) A dictionary of custom properties to include with the webhook POST operation payload.

properties.name: name

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to the Application Gateway should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure region where the Application Gateway should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: backend_address_pool
properties.description: • backend_address_pool - (Required) One or more backend_address_pool blocks as defined below.

properties.name: backend_http_settings
properties.description: • backend_http_settings - (Required) One or more backend_http_settings blocks as defined below.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration
properties.description: • frontend_ip_configuration - (Required) One or more frontend_ip_configuration blocks as defined below.

properties.name: frontend_port
properties.description: • frontend_port - (Required) One or more frontend_port blocks as defined below.

properties.name: gateway_ip_configuration
properties.description: • gateway_ip_configuration - (Required) One or more gateway_ip_configuration blocks as defined below.

properties.name: http_listener
properties.description: • http_listener - (Required) One or more http_listener blocks as defined below.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) A identity block.

properties.name: request_routing_rule
properties.description: • request_routing_rule - (Required) One or more request_routing_rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) A sku block as defined below.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A collection of availability zones to spread the Application Gateway over.
Please Note: Availability Zones are only supported in several regions at this time. They are also only supported for v2 SKUs

properties.name: authentication_certificate

properties.description: • trusted_root_certificate - (Optional) One or more trusted_root_certificate blocks as defined below.

properties.name: disabled_ssl_protocols
properties.description: • disabled_ssl_protocols - (Optional / Deprecated) A list of SSL Protocols which should be disabled on this Application Gateway. Possible values are TLSv1_0, TLSv1_1 and TLSv1_2. ~> NOTE: disabled_ssl_protocols has been deprecated in favour of disabled_protocols in the ssl_policy block.

properties.name: ssl_policy
properties.description: • ssl_policy (Optional) a ssl policy block as defined below.

properties.name: enable_http2
properties.description: • enable_http2 - (Optional) Is HTTP2 enabled on the application gateway resource? Defaults to false.

properties.name: probe

properties.description: • ssl_certificate - (Optional) One or more ssl_certificate blocks as defined below.

properties.name: tags

properties.name: url_path_map
properties.description: • url_path_map - (Optional) One or more url_path_map blocks as defined below.

properties.description: • waf_configuration - (Optional) A waf_configuration block as defined below.

A trusted_root_certificate block supports the following:

properties.name: name

properties.name: data
properties.description: • data - (Required) The contents of the Authentication Certificate which should be used.

A authentication_certificate block, within the backend_http_settings block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Authentication Certificate.

A backend_address_pool block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Backend Address Pool.

properties.name: fqdns
properties.description: • fqdns - (Optional) A list of FQDN's which should be part of the Backend Address Pool.

properties.name: fqdn_list
properties.description: • fqdn_list - (Optional Deprecated) A list of FQDN's which should be part of the Backend Address Pool. This field has been deprecated in favour of fqdns and will be removed in v2.0 of the AzureRM Provider.

properties.name: ip_addresses
properties.description: • ip_addresses - (Optional) A list of IP Addresses which should be part of the Backend Address Pool.

properties.name: ip_address_list
properties.description: • ip_address_list - (Optional Deprecated) A list of IP Addresses which should be part of the Backend Address Pool. This field has been deprecated in favour of ip_addresses and will be removed in v2.0 of the AzureRM Provider.
<hr/>
A backend_http_settings block supports the following:

properties.name: cookie_based_affinity
properties.description: • cookie_based_affinity - (Required) Is Cookie-Based Affinity enabled? Possible values are Enabled and Disabled.

properties.name: affinity_cookie_name
properties.description: • affinity_cookie_name - (Optional) The name of the affinity cookie.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Backend HTTP Settings Collection.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The Path which should be used as a prefix for all HTTP requests.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port- (Required) The port which should be used for this Backend HTTP Settings Collection.

properties.name: probe_name
properties.description: • probe_name - (Required) The name of an associated HTTP Probe.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol- (Required) The Protocol which should be used. Possible values are Http and Https.

properties.name: request_timeout
properties.description: • request_timeout - (Required) The request timeout in seconds, which must be between 1 and 86400 seconds.

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Optional) Host header to be sent to the backend servers. Cannot be set if pick_host_name_from_backend_address is set to true.

properties.name: pick_host_name_from_backend_address
properties.description: • pick_host_name_from_backend_address - (Optional) Whether host header should be picked from the host name of the backend server. Defaults to false.

properties.name: authentication_certificate
properties.description: • authentication_certificate - (Optional) One or more authentication_certificate blocks.

properties.name: connection_draining
properties.description: • connection_draining - (Optional) A connection_draining block as defined below.

A connection_draining block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) If connection draining is enabled or not.

properties.name: drain_timeout_sec
properties.description: • drain_timeout_sec - (Required) The number of seconds connection draining is active. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 3600 seconds.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Frontend IP Configuration.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the Subnet which the Application Gateway should be connected to.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: • private_ip_address - (Optional) The Private IP Address to use for the Application Gateway.

properties.name: public_ip_address_id
properties.description: • public_ip_address_id - (Optional) The ID of a Public IP Address which the Application Gateway should use.
NOTE: The Allocation Method for this Public IP Address should be set to Dynamic.

properties.name: private_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: (Optional) The Allocation Method for the Private IP Address. Possible values are Dynamic and Static.
<hr/>
A frontend_port block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Frontend Port.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) The port used for this Frontend Port.

A gateway_ip_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Gateway IP Configuration.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of a Subnet.
<hr/>
A http_listener block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of the HTTP Listener.

properties.name: frontend_ip_configuration_name
properties.description: • frontend_ip_configuration_name - (Required) The Name of the Frontend IP Configuration used for this HTTP Listener.

properties.name: frontend_port_name
properties.description: • frontend_port_name - (Required) The Name of the Frontend Port use for this HTTP Listener.

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Optional) The Hostname which should be used for this HTTP Listener.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The Protocol to use for this HTTP Listener. Possible values are Http and Https.

properties.description: • require_sni - (Optional) Should Server Name Indication be Required? Defaults to false.

properties.description: • ssl_certificate_name - (Optional) The name of the associated SSL Certificate which should be used for this HTTP Listener.

A identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The Managed Service Identity Type of this Application Gateway. The only possible value is UserAssigned. Defaults to UserAssigned.

properties.name: identity_ids
properties.description: • identity_ids - (Required) Specifies a list with a single user managed identity id to be assigned to the Application Gateway.

properties.name: body
properties.description: • body - (Optional) A snippet from the Response Body which must be present in the Response. Defaults to *.

properties.name: status_code

<hr/>
A path_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name

properties.description: • backend_address_pool_name - (Optional) The Name of the Backend Address Pool to use for this Path Rule. Cannot be set if redirect_configuration_name is set.

properties.name: backend_http_settings_name
properties.description: • backend_http_settings_name - (Optional) The Name of the Backend HTTP Settings Collection to use for this Path Rule. Cannot be set if redirect_configuration_name is set.

properties.name: redirect_configuration_name
properties.description: • redirect_configuration_name - (Optional) The Name of a Redirect Configuration to use for this Path Rule. Cannot be set if backend_address_pool_name or backend_http_settings_name is set.

properties.name: rewrite_rule_set_name
properties.description: • rewrite_rule_set_name - (Optional) The Name of the Rewrite Rule Set which should be used for this URL Path Map. Only valid for v2 SKUs.

A probe block support the following:

properties.name: host
properties.description: • host - (Optional) The Hostname used for this Probe. If the Application Gateway is configured for a single site, by default the Host name should be specified as ‘127.0.0.1’, unless otherwise configured in custom probe. Cannot be set if pick_host_name_from_backend_http_settings is set to true.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: • interval - (Required) The Interval between two consecutive probes in seconds. Possible values range from 1 second to a maximum of 86,400 seconds.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of the Probe.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The Protocol used for this Probe. Possible values are Http and Https.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The Path used for this Probe.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Required) The Timeout used for this Probe, which indicates when a probe becomes unhealthy. Possible values range from 1 second to a maximum of 86,400 seconds.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Required) The Unhealthy Threshold for this Probe, which indicates the amount of retries which should be attempted before a node is deemed unhealthy. Possible values are from 1 - 20 seconds.

properties.name: pick_host_name_from_backend_http_settings
properties.description: • pick_host_name_from_backend_http_settings - (Optional) Whether the host header should be picked from the backend http settings. Defaults to false.

properties.name: match
properties.description: • match - (Optional) A match block as defined above.

properties.name: minimum_servers
properties.description: • minimum_servers - (Optional) The minimum number of servers that are always marked as healthy. Defaults to 0.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Request Routing Rule.

properties.name: rule_type
properties.description: • rule_type - (Required) The Type of Routing that should be used for this Rule. Possible values are Basic and PathBasedRouting.

properties.name: http_listener_name
properties.description: • http_listener_name - (Required) The Name of the HTTP Listener which should be used for this Routing Rule.

properties.name: backend_address_pool_name
properties.description: • backend_address_pool_name - (Optional) The Name of the Backend Address Pool which should be used for this Routing Rule. Cannot be set if redirect_configuration_name is set.

properties.name: backend_http_settings_name
properties.description: • backend_http_settings_name - (Optional) The Name of the Backend HTTP Settings Collection which should be used for this Routing Rule. Cannot be set if redirect_configuration_name is set.

properties.name: redirect_configuration_name
properties.description: • redirect_configuration_name - (Optional) The Name of the Redirect Configuration which should be used for this Routing Rule. Cannot be set if either backend_address_pool_name or backend_http_settings_name is set.

properties.name: rewrite_rule_set_name
properties.description: • rewrite_rule_set_name - (Optional) The Name of the Rewrite Rule Set which should be used for this Routing Rule. Only valid for v2 SKUs.

properties.name: url_path_map_name
properties.description: • url_path_map_name - (Optional) The Name of the URL Path Map which should be associated with this Routing Rule.
<hr/>
A sku block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of the SKU to use for this Application Gateway. Possible values are Standard_Small, Standard_Medium, Standard_Large, Standard_v2, WAF_Medium, WAF_Large, and WAF_v2.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: • tier - (Required) The Tier of the SKU to use for this Application Gateway. Possible values are Standard, Standard_v2, WAF and WAF_v2.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) The Capacity of the SKU to use for this Application Gateway - which must be between 1 and 10, optional if autoscale_configuration is set
<hr/>
