properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Password for the pfx file specified in data.
<hr/>
A url_path_map block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of the URL Path Map.

properties.name: default_backend_address_pool_name
properties.description: • default_backend_address_pool_name - (Optional) The Name of the Default Backend Address Pool which should be used for this URL Path Map. Cannot be set if default_redirect_configuration_name is set.

properties.name: default_backend_http_settings_name
properties.description: • default_backend_http_settings_name - (Optional) The Name of the Default Backend HTTP Settings Collection which should be used for this URL Path Map. Cannot be set if default_redirect_configuration_name is set.

properties.name: default_redirect_configuration_name
properties.description: • default_redirect_configuration_name - (Optional) The Name of the Default Redirect Configuration which should be used for this URL Path Map. Cannot be set if either default_backend_address_pool_name or default_backend_http_settings_name is set.

properties.name: default_rewrite_rule_set_name
properties.description: • default_rewrite_rule_set_name - (Optional) The Name of the Default Rewrite Rule Set which should be used for this URL Path Map. Only valid for v2 SKUs.

properties.name: path_rule
properties.description: • path_rule - (Required) One or more path_rule blocks as defined above.
<hr/>
A ssl_policy block supports the following:

properties.name: disabled_protocols
properties.description: (Optional) A list of SSL Protocols which should be disabled on this Application Gateway. Possible values are TLSv1_0, TLSv1_1 and TLSv1_2.
NOTE: disabled_protocols cannot be set when policy_name or policy_type are set.

properties.name: policy_type
properties.description: (Optional) The Type of the Policy. Possible values are Predefined and Custom.
NOTE: policy_type is Required when policy_name is set - cannot be set if disabled_protocols is set.
When using a policy_type of Predefined the following fields are supported:

properties.name: policy_name
properties.description: (Optional) The Name of the Policy e.g AppGwSslPolicy20170401S. Required if policy_type is set to Predefined. Possible values can change over time and are published here https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/application-gateway/application-gateway-ssl-policy-overview. Not compatible with disabled_protocols.
When using a policy_type of Custom the following fields are supported:

properties.name: cipher_suites
properties.description: • cipher_suites - (Required) A List of accepted cipher suites. Possible values are: TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 and TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384.

properties.name: min_protocol_version
properties.description: • min_protocol_version - (Required) The minimal TLS version. Possible values are TLSv1_0, TLSv1_1 and TLSv1_2.
<hr/>
A waf_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Is the Web Application Firewall be enabled?

properties.name: firewall_mode
properties.description: • firewall_mode - (Required) The Web Application Firewall Mode. Possible values are Detection and Prevention.

properties.name: rule_set_type
properties.description: • rule_set_type - (Required) The Type of the Rule Set used for this Web Application Firewall.

properties.name: rule_set_version
properties.description: • rule_set_version - (Required) The Version of the Rule Set used for this Web Application Firewall. Possible values are 2.2.9, 3.0, and 3.1.

properties.name: disabled_rule_group
properties.description: • disabled_rule_group - (Optional) one or more disabled_rule_group blocks as defined below.

properties.name: file_upload_limit_mb
properties.description: • file_upload_limit_mb - (Optional) The File Upload Limit in MB. Accepted values are in the range 1MB to 500MB. Defaults to 100MB.

properties.name: request_body_check
properties.description: • request_body_check - (Optional) Is Request Body Inspection enabled? Defaults to true.

properties.name: max_request_body_size_kb
properties.description: • max_request_body_size_kb - (Optional) The Maximum Request Body Size in KB. Accepted values are in the range 1KB to 128KB. Defaults to 128KB.

properties.name: exclusion
properties.description: • exclusion - (Optional) one or more exclusion blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A disabled_rule_group block supports the following:

properties.name: rule_group_name
properties.description: • rule_group_name - (Required) The rule group where specific rules should be disabled. Accepted values are: crs_20_protocol_violations, crs_21_protocol_anomalies, crs_23_request_limits, crs_30_http_policy, crs_35_bad_robots, crs_40_generic_attacks, crs_41_sql_injection_attacks, crs_41_xss_attacks, crs_42_tight_security, crs_45_trojans, General, REQUEST-911-METHOD-ENFORCEMENT, REQUEST-913-SCANNER-DETECTION, REQUEST-920-PROTOCOL-ENFORCEMENT, REQUEST-921-PROTOCOL-ATTACK, REQUEST-930-APPLICATION-ATTACK-LFI, REQUEST-931-APPLICATION-ATTACK-RFI, REQUEST-932-APPLICATION-ATTACK-RCE, REQUEST-933-APPLICATION-ATTACK-PHP, REQUEST-941-APPLICATION-ATTACK-XSS, REQUEST-942-APPLICATION-ATTACK-SQLI, REQUEST-943-APPLICATION-ATTACK-SESSION-FIXATION

properties.name: rules
properties.description: • rules - (Optional) A list of rules which should be disabled in that group. Disables all rules in the specified group if rules is not specified.
<hr/>
A exclusion block supports the following:

properties.name: match_variable
properties.description: • match_variable - (Required) Match variable of the exclusion rule to exclude header, cookie or GET arguments. Possible values are RequestHeaderNames, RequestArgNames and RequestCookieNames

properties.name: selector_match_operator
properties.description: • selector_match_operator - (Optional) Operator which will be used to search in the variable content. Possible values are Equals, StartsWith, EndsWith, Contains. If empty will exclude all traffic on this match_variable

properties.name: selector
properties.description: • selector - (Optional) String value which will be used for the filter operation. If empty will exclude all traffic on this match_variable
<hr/>
A custom_error_configuration block supports the following:

properties.description: • status_code - (Required) Status code of the application gateway customer error. Possible values are HttpStatus403 and HttpStatus502

properties.name: custom_error_page_url
properties.description: • custom_error_page_url - (Required) Error page URL of the application gateway customer error.
<hr/>
A redirect_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Unique name of the redirect configuration block

properties.name: redirect_type
properties.description: • redirect_type - (Required) The type of redirect. Possible values are Permanent, Temporary, Found and SeeOther

properties.name: target_listener_name
properties.description: • target_listener_name - (Optional) The name of the listener to redirect to. Cannot be set if target_url is set.

properties.name: target_url
properties.description: • target_url - (Optional) The Url to redirect the request to. Cannot be set if target_listener_name is set.

properties.name: include_path
properties.description: • include_path - (Optional) Whether or not to include the path in the redirected Url. Defaults to false

properties.name: include_query_string
properties.description: • include_query_string - (Optional) Whether or not to include the query string in the redirected Url. Default to false
<hr/>
A autoscale_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: min_capacity
properties.description: • min_capacity - (Required) Minimum capacity for autoscaling.

properties.name: max_capacity
properties.description: • max_capacity - (Optional) Maximum capacity for autoscaling.
<hr/>

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Unique name of the rewrite rule set block

properties.name: rewrite_rule
properties.description: • rewrite_rule - (Required) One or more rewrite_rule blocks as defined above.
<hr/>
A rewrite_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Unique name of the rewrite rule block

properties.name: rule_sequence
properties.description: • rule_sequence - (Required) Rule sequence of the rewrite rule that determines the order of execution in a set.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition - (Optional) One or more condition blocks as defined above.

properties.name: request_header_configuration
properties.description: • request_header_configuration - (Optional) One or more request_header_configuration blocks as defined above.

properties.name: response_header_configuration
properties.description: • response_header_configuration - (Optional) One or more response_header_configuration blocks as defined above.
<hr/>
A condition block supports the following:

properties.name: variable
properties.description: • variable - (Required) The variable of the condition.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: • pattern - (Required) The pattern, either fixed string or regular expression, that evaluates the truthfulness of the condition.

properties.name: ignore_case
properties.description: • ignore_case - (Optional) Perform a case in-sensitive comparison. Defaults to false

properties.name: negate
properties.description: • negate - (Optional) Negate the result of the condition evaluation. Defaults to false
<hr/>
A request_header_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: header_name
properties.description: • header_name - (Required) Header name of the header configuration.

properties.name: header_value
properties.description: • header_value - (Required) Header value of the header configuration.
<hr/>
A response_header_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: header_name
properties.description: • header_name - (Required) Header name of the header configuration.

properties.name: header_value
properties.description: • header_value - (Required) Header value of the header configuration.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name

NOTE: You can migrate from MeteredData to UnlimitedData, but not the other way around.

NOTE: only one Peering of each Type can be created. Attempting to create multiple peerings of the same type will overwrite the original peering.

properties.name: shared_key

Elements of security_rule support:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 characters.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Network protocol this rule applies to. Can be Tcp, Udp or * to match both.

properties.name: source_port_range
properties.description: • source_port_range - (Optional) Source Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any. This is required if source_port_ranges is not specified.

properties.name: destination_port_range
properties.description: • destination_port_range - (Optional) Destination Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any. This is required if destination_port_ranges is not specified.

properties.name: destination_port_ranges
properties.description: • destination_port_ranges - (Optional) List of destination ports or port ranges. This is required if destination_port_range is not specified.

properties.description: • source_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or source IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used. This is required if source_address_prefixes is not specified.

properties.name: source_address_prefixes
properties.description: • source_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of source address prefixes. Tags may not be used. This is required if source_address_prefix is not specified.

properties.name: source_application_security_group_ids
properties.description: • source_application_security_group_ids - (Optional) A List of source Application Security Group ID's

properties.name: destination_address_prefix
properties.description: • destination_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or destination IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used. This is required if destination_address_prefixes is not specified.

properties.name: destination_address_prefixes
properties.description: • destination_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of destination address prefixes. Tags may not be used. This is required if destination_address_prefix is not specified.

properties.name: destination_application_security_group_ids
properties.description: • destination_application_security_group_ids - (Optional) A List of destination Application Security Group ID's

properties.name: access
properties.description: • access - (Required) Specifies whether network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are Allow and Deny.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Required) Specifies the priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Required) The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic. Possible values are Inbound and Outbound.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security rule. This needs to be unique across all Rules in the Network Security Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Network Security Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_security_group_name
properties.description: • network_security_group_name - (Required) The name of the Network Security Group that we want to attach the rule to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 characters.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Network protocol this rule applies to. Possible values include Tcp, Udp or * (which matches both).

properties.name: source_port_range
properties.description: • source_port_range - (Optional) Source Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any. This is required if source_port_ranges is not specified.

properties.name: source_port_ranges
properties.description: • source_port_ranges - (Optional) List of source ports or port ranges. This is required if source_port_range is not specified.

properties.name: destination_port_range
properties.description: • destination_port_range - (Optional) Destination Port or Range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535 or * to match any. This is required if destination_port_ranges is not specified.

properties.name: destination_port_ranges
properties.description: • destination_port_ranges - (Optional) List of destination ports or port ranges. This is required if destination_port_range is not specified.

properties.name: source_address_prefix
properties.description: • source_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or source IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used. This is required if source_address_prefixes is not specified.

properties.name: source_address_prefixes
properties.description: • source_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of source address prefixes. Tags may not be used. This is required if source_address_prefix is not specified.

properties.name: source_application_security_group_ids
properties.description: • source_application_security_group_ids - (Optional) A List of source Application Security Group ID's

properties.name: destination_address_prefix
properties.description: • destination_address_prefix - (Optional) CIDR or destination IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as ‘VirtualNetwork’, ‘AzureLoadBalancer’ and ‘Internet’ can also be used. This is required if destination_address_prefixes is not specified.

properties.name: destination_address_prefixes
properties.description: • destination_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of destination address prefixes. Tags may not be used. This is required if destination_address_prefix is not specified.

properties.name: destination_application_security_group_ids
properties.description: • destination_application_security_group_ids - (Optional) A List of destination Application Security Group ID's

properties.name: access
properties.description: • access - (Required) Specifies whether network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are Allow and Deny.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Required) Specifies the priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

properties.name: direction

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Network Watcher. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Network Watcher. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name to use for this Packet Capture. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_watcher_name
properties.description: • network_watcher_name - (Required) The name of the Network Watcher. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the Network Watcher exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: target_resource_id
properties.description: • target_resource_id - (Required) The ID of the Resource to capture packets from. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: Currently only Virtual Machines ID's are supported.

properties.name: maximum_bytes_per_packet
properties.description: • maximum_bytes_per_packet - (Optional) The number of bytes captured per packet. The remaining bytes are truncated. Defaults to 0 (Entire Packet Captured). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: maximum_bytes_per_session
properties.description: • maximum_bytes_per_session - (Optional) Maximum size of the capture in Bytes. Defaults to 1073741824 (1GB). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: maximum_capture_duration
properties.description: • maximum_capture_duration - (Optional) The maximum duration of the capture session in seconds. Defaults to 18000 (5 hours). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_location
properties.description: • storage_location - (Required) A storage_location block as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Optional) One or more filter blocks as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A storage_location block contains:

properties.name: file_path
properties.description: • file_path - (Optional) A valid local path on the targeting VM. Must include the name of the capture file (*.cap). For linux virtual machine it must start with /var/captures.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Optional) The ID of the storage account to save the packet capture session
NOTE: At least one of file_path or storage_account_id must be specified.
A filter block contains:

properties.name: local_ip_address
properties.description: • local_ip_address - (Optional) The local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: local_port
properties.description: • local_port - (Optional) The local port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The Protocol to be filtered on. Possible values include Any, TCP and UDP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: remote_ip_address
properties.description: • remote_ip_address - (Optional) The remote IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported.. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: remote_port
properties.description: • remote_port - (Optional) The remote port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP resource . Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the public ip.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Optional) The SKU of the Public IP. Accepted values are Basic and Standard. Defaults to Basic.
Note Public IP Standard SKUs require allocation_method to be set to Static.

properties.name: allocation_method
properties.description: (Required) Defines the allocation method for this IP address. Possible values are Static or Dynamic.
Note Dynamic Public IP Addresses aren't allocated until they're assigned to a resource (such as a Virtual Machine or a Load Balancer) by design within Azure - more information is available below.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: (Optional) The IP Version to use, IPv6 or IPv4.
Note Only dynamic IP address allocation is supported for IPv6.

properties.name: idle_timeout_in_minutes
properties.description: • idle_timeout_in_minutes - (Optional) Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.

properties.name: domain_name_label
properties.description: • domain_name_label - (Optional) Label for the Domain Name. Will be used to make up the FQDN. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

properties.name: reverse_fqdn
properties.description: • reverse_fqdn - (Optional) A fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.

properties.name: public_ip_prefix_id
properties.description: • public_ip_prefix_id - (Optional) If specified then public IP address allocated will be provided from the public IP prefix resource.
Please Note: Public IP Prefix are currently in Public Preview. You can find more information about Public IP Preifx Preview here.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A collection containing the availability zone to allocate the Public IP in.
Please Note: Availability Zones are only supported in several regions at this time.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP resource . Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the public IP.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Optional) The SKU of the Public IP Prefix. Accepted values are Standard. Defaults to Standard. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note Public IP Prefix can only be created with Standard SKUs at this time.

properties.name: prefix_length
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of bits of the prefix. The value can be set between 24 (256 addresses) and 31 (2 addresses). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Please Note:: There may be Public IP address limits on the subscription . More information available here

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A collection containing the availability zone to allocate the Public IP in.
Please Note: Availability Zones are only supported in several regions at this time.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: route_table_name
properties.description: • route_table_name - (Required) The name of the route table within which create the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The destination CIDR to which the route applies, such as 10.1.0.0/16

properties.name: next_hop_type
properties.description: • next_hop_type - (Required) The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to. Possible values are VirtualNetworkGateway, VnetLocal, Internet, VirtualAppliance and None

properties.name: next_hop_in_ip_address
properties.description: • next_hop_in_ip_address - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the route table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: route
properties.description: • route - (Optional) List of objects representing routes. Each object accepts the arguments documented below.

properties.name: disable_bgp_route_propagation
properties.description: • disable_bgp_route_propagation - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls propagation of routes learned by BGP on that route table. True means disable.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
Elements of route support:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The destination CIDR to which the route applies, such as 10.1.0.0/16

properties.name: next_hop_type
properties.description: • next_hop_type - (Required) The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to. Possible values are VirtualNetworkGateway, VnetLocal, Internet, VirtualAppliance and None.

properties.name: next_hop_in_ip_address
properties.description: • next_hop_in_ip_address - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: • virtual_network_name - (Required) The name of the virtual network to which to attach the subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.

properties.name: network_security_group_id
properties.description: • network_security_group_id - (Optional / Deprecated) The ID of the Network Security Group to associate with the subnet.

NOTE: At this time Subnet <-> Network Security Group associations need to be configured both using this field (which is now Deprecated) and/or using the azurerm_subnet_network_security_group_association resource. This field is deprecated and will be removed in favour of that resource in the next major version (2.0) of the AzureRM Provider.

properties.name: route_table_id
properties.description: (Optional / Deprecated) The ID of the Route Table to associate with the subnet.

NOTE: At this time Subnet <-> Route Table associations need to be configured both using this field (which is now Deprecated) and/or using the azurerm_subnet_route_table_association resource. This field is deprecated and will be removed in favour of that resource in the next major version (2.0) of the AzureRM Provider.

properties.name: service_endpoints
properties.description: • service_endpoints - (Optional) The list of Service endpoints to associate with the subnet. Possible values include: Microsoft.AzureActiveDirectory, Microsoft.AzureCosmosDB, Microsoft.ContainerRegistry, Microsoft.EventHub, Microsoft.KeyVault, Microsoft.ServiceBus, Microsoft.Sql, Microsoft.Storage and Microsoft.Web.

properties.name: delegation
properties.description: • delegation - (Optional) One or more delegation blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A delegation block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name (Required) A name for this delegation.

properties.name: service_delegation
properties.description: • service_delegation (Required) A service_delegation block as defined below.
<hr/>
A service_delegation block supports the following:
NOTE: Delegating to services may not be available in all regions. Check that the service you are delegating to is available in your region using the Azure CLI

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of service to delegate to. Possible values include Microsoft.BareMetal/AzureVMware, Microsoft.BareMetal/CrayServers, Microsoft.Batch/batchAccounts, Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups, Microsoft.Databricks/workspaces, Microsoft.HardwareSecurityModules/dedicatedHSMs, Microsoft.Logic/integrationServiceEnvironments, Microsoft.Netapp/volumes, Microsoft.ServiceFabricMesh/networks, Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances, Microsoft.Sql/servers, Microsoft.Web/hostingEnvironments and Microsoft.Web/serverFarms.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: • actions - (Required) A list of Actions which should be delegated. Possible values include Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets/prepareNetworkPolicies/action, Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets/action and Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets/join/action.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: network_security_group_id
properties.description: • network_security_group_id - (Required) The ID of the Network Security Group which should be associated with the Subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the Subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: route_table_id
properties.description: • route_table_id - (Required) The ID of the Route Table which should be associated with the Subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the Subnet. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Traffic Manager endpoint. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Traffic Manager endpoint.

properties.name: profile_name
properties.description: • profile_name - (Required) The name of the Traffic Manager Profile to attach create the Traffic Manager endpoint.

properties.name: endpoint_status
properties.description: • endpoint_status - (Optional) The status of the Endpoint, can be set to either Enabled or Disabled. Defaults to Enabled.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: type - (Required) The Endpoint type, must be one of:

properties.name: azureEndpoints
externalEndpoints
nestedEndpoints
target
properties.description: • target - (Optional) The FQDN DNS name of the target. This argument must be provided for an endpoint of type externalEndpoints, for other types it will be computed.

properties.name: target_resource_id
properties.description: • target_resource_id - (Optional) The resource id of an Azure resource to target. This argument must be provided for an endpoint of type azureEndpoints or nestedEndpoints.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: • weight - (Optional) Specifies how much traffic should be distributed to this endpoint, this must be specified for Profiles using the Weighted traffic routing method. Supports values between 1 and 1000.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Optional) Specifies the priority of this Endpoint, this must be specified for Profiles using the Priority traffic routing method. Supports values between 1 and 1000, with no Endpoints sharing the same value. If omitted the value will be computed in order of creation.

properties.name: endpoint_location
properties.description: • endpoint_location - (Optional) Specifies the Azure location of the Endpoint, this must be specified for Profiles using the Performance routing method if the Endpoint is of either type nestedEndpoints or externalEndpoints. For Endpoints of type azureEndpoints the value will be taken from the location of the Azure target resource.

properties.name: min_child_endpoints
properties.description: • min_child_endpoints - (Optional) This argument specifies the minimum number of endpoints that must be ‘online’ in the child profile in order for the parent profile to direct traffic to any of the endpoints in that child profile. This argument only applies to Endpoints of type nestedEndpoints and defaults to 1.

properties.name: geo_mappings
properties.description: • geo_mappings - (Optional) A list of Geographic Regions used to distribute traffic, such as WORLD, UK or DE. The same location can't be specified in two endpoints. See the Geographic Hierarchies documentation for more information.

properties.name: custom_header
properties.description: • custom_header - (Optional) One or more custom_header blocks as defined below

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Optional) One or more subnet blocks as defined below
<hr/>
A custom_header block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the custom header.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The value of custom header. Applicable for Http and Https protocol.
A subnet block supports the following:

properties.name: first
properties.description: • first - (Required) The First IP....

properties.name: last
properties.description: • last - (Optional) The Last IP...

properties.name: scope
properties.description: • scope - (Optional) The Scope...
NOTE: One and only one of either last (in case of IP range) or scope (in case of CIDR) must be specified.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network.

properties.name: profile_status
properties.description: • profile_status - (Optional) The status of the profile, can be set to either Enabled or Disabled. Defaults to Enabled.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: traffic_routing_method - (Required) Specifies the algorithm used to route traffic, possible values are:

properties.name: Geographic
properties.description: Traffic is routed based on Geographic regions specified in the Endpoint.

properties.name: MultiValue
properties.description: - All healthy Endpoints are returned.  MultiValue routing method works only if all the endpoints of type ‘External’ and are specified as IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

properties.name: Performance
properties.description: Traffic is routed via the User's closest Endpoint

properties.name: Priority
properties.description: Traffic is routed to the Endpoint with the lowest priority value.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.description: Traffic is routed based on a mapping of sets of end-user IP address ranges to a specific Endpoint within a Traffic Manager profile.

properties.name: Weighted
properties.description: Traffic is spread across Endpoints proportional to their weight value.

properties.name: dns_config
properties.description: • dns_config - (Required) This block specifies the DNS configuration of the Profile, it supports the fields documented below.

properties.name: monitor_config
properties.description: • monitor_config - (Required) This block specifies the Endpoint monitoring configuration for the Profile, it supports the fields documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The dns_config block supports:

properties.name: relative_name
properties.description: • relative_name - (Required) The relative domain name, this is combined with the domain name used by Traffic Manager to form the FQDN which is exported as documented below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Required) The TTL value of the Profile used by Local DNS resolvers and clients.
The monitor_config block supports:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol used by the monitoring checks, supported values are HTTP, HTTPS and TCP.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) The port number used by the monitoring checks.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The path used by the monitoring checks. Required when protocol is set to HTTP or HTTPS - cannot be set when protocol is set to TCP.

properties.name: interval_in_seconds
properties.description: • interval_in_seconds - (Optional) The interval used to check the endpoint health from a Traffic Manager probing agent. You can specify two values here: 30 (normal probing) and 10 (fast probing). The default value is 30.

properties.name: timeout_in_seconds
properties.description: • timeout_in_seconds - (Optional) The amount of time the Traffic Manager probing agent should wait before considering that check a failure when a health check probe is sent to the endpoint. If interval_in_seconds is set to 30, then timeout_in_seconds can be between 5 and 10. The default value is 10. If interval_in_seconds is set to 10, then valid values are between 5 and 9 and timeout_in_seconds is required.

properties.name: tolerated_number_of_failures
properties.description: • tolerated_number_of_failures - (Optional) The number of failures a Traffic Manager probing agent tolerates before marking that endpoint as unhealthy. Valid values are between 0 and 9. The default value is 3
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network.

properties.name: address_space
properties.description: • address_space - (Required) The address space that is used the virtual network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the virtual network is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ddos_protection_plan
properties.description: • ddos_protection_plan - (Optional) A ddos_protection_plan block as documented below.

properties.name: dns_servers
properties.description: • dns_servers - (Optional) List of IP addresses of DNS servers

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple subnets. Each subnet block supports fields documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
A ddos_protection_plan block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) The Resource ID of DDoS Protection Plan.

properties.name: enable
properties.description: • enable - (Required) Enable/disable DDoS Protection Plan on Virtual Network.
<hr/>
The subnet block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the subnet.

properties.name: address_prefix
properties.description: • address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.

properties.name: security_group
properties.description: • security_group - (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with the subnet. (Referenced by id, ie. azurerm_network_security_group.test.id)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Virtual Network Gateway. Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Virtual Network Gateway. Changing the resource group name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the Virtual Network Gateway is located. Changing the location/region forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of the Virtual Network Gateway. Valid options are Vpn or ExpressRoute. Changing the type forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vpn_type
properties.description: • vpn_type - (Optional) The routing type of the Virtual Network Gateway. Valid options are RouteBased or PolicyBased. Defaults to RouteBased.

properties.name: enable_bgp
properties.description: • enable_bgp - (Optional) If true, BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) will be enabled for this Virtual Network Gateway. Defaults to false.

properties.name: active_active
properties.description: • active_active - (Optional) If true, an active-active Virtual Network Gateway will be created. An active-active gateway requires a HighPerformance or an UltraPerformance sku. If false, an active-standby gateway will be created. Defaults to false.

properties.name: default_local_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • default_local_network_gateway_id - (Optional) The ID of the local network gateway through which outbound Internet traffic from the virtual network in which the gateway is created will be routed (forced tunneling). Refer to the Azure documentation on forced tunneling. If not specified, forced tunneling is disabled.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) Configuration of the size and capacity of the virtual network gateway. Valid options are Basic, Standard, HighPerformance, UltraPerformance, ErGw1AZ, ErGw2AZ, ErGw3AZ, VpnGw1, VpnGw2, VpnGw3, VpnGw1AZ, VpnGw2AZ, and VpnGw3AZ and depend on the type and vpn_type arguments. A PolicyBased gateway only supports the Basic sku. Further, the UltraPerformance sku is only supported by an ExpressRoute gateway.

properties.name: ip_configuration
properties.description: • ip_configuration (Required) One or two ip_configuration blocks documented below. An active-standby gateway requires exactly one ip_configuration block whereas an active-active gateway requires exactly two ip_configuration blocks.

properties.name: vpn_client_configuration
properties.description: • vpn_client_configuration (Optional) A vpn_client_configuration block which is documented below. In this block the Virtual Network Gateway can be configured to accept IPSec point-to-site connections.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The ip_configuration block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A user-defined name of the IP configuration. Defaults to vnetGatewayConfig.

properties.name: private_ip_address_allocation
properties.description: • private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Defines how the private IP address of the gateways virtual interface is assigned. Valid options are Static or Dynamic. Defaults to Dynamic.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the gateway subnet of a virtual network in which the virtual network gateway will be created. It is mandatory that the associated subnet is named GatewaySubnet. Therefore, each virtual network can contain at most a single Virtual Network Gateway.

properties.name: public_ip_address_id
properties.description: • public_ip_address_id - (Optional) The ID of the public ip address to associate with the Virtual Network Gateway.
The vpn_client_configuration block supports:

properties.name: address_space
properties.description: (Required) The address space out of which ip addresses for vpn clients will be taken. You can provide more than one address space, e.g. in CIDR notation.

properties.name: root_certificate
properties.description: • root_certificate - (Optional) One or more root_certificate blocks which are defined below. These root certificates are used to sign the client certificate used by the VPN clients to connect to the gateway. This setting is incompatible with the use of radius_server_address and radius_server_secret.

properties.name: revoked_certificate
properties.description: • revoked_certificate - (Optional) One or more revoked_certificate blocks which are defined below. This setting is incompatible with the use of radius_server_address and radius_server_secret.

properties.name: radius_server_address
properties.description: • radius_server_address - (Optional) The address of the Radius server. This setting is incompatible with the use of root_certificate and revoked_certificate.

properties.name: radius_server_secret
properties.description: • radius_server_secret - (Optional) The secret used by the Radius server. This setting is incompatible with the use of root_certificate and revoked_certificate.

properties.name: vpn_client_protocols
properties.description: • vpn_client_protocols - (Optional) List of the protocols supported by the vpn client. The supported values are SSTP, IkeV2 and OpenVPN.
NOTE: Support for OpenVPN as a Client Protocol is currently in Public Preview - you can register for this Preview using this link.
The bgp_settings block supports:

properties.name: asn
properties.description: • asn - (Optional) The Autonomous System Number (ASN) to use as part of the BGP.

properties.name: peering_address
properties.description: • peering_address - (Optional) The BGP peer IP address of the virtual network gateway. This address is needed to configure the created gateway as a BGP Peer on the on-premises VPN devices. The IP address must be part of the subnet of the Virtual Network Gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: peer_weight
properties.description: • peer_weight - (Optional) The weight added to routes which have been learned through BGP peering. Valid values can be between 0 and 100.
The root_certificate block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A user-defined name of the root certificate.

properties.name: public_cert_data
properties.description: • public_cert_data - (Required) The public certificate of the root certificate authority. The certificate must be provided in Base-64 encoded X.509 format (PEM). In particular, this argument must not include the -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- or -----END CERTIFICATE----- markers.
The root_revoked_certificate block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A user-defined name of the revoked certificate.

properties.name: public_cert_data
properties.description: • public_cert_data - (Required) The SHA1 thumbprint of the certificate to be revoked.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the connection. Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the connection Changing the name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location/region where the connection is located. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of connection. Valid options are IPsec (Site-to-Site), ExpressRoute (ExpressRoute), and Vnet2Vnet (VNet-to-VNet). Each connection type requires different mandatory arguments (refer to the examples above). Changing the connection type will force a new connection to be created.

properties.name: virtual_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • virtual_network_gateway_id - (Required) The ID of the Virtual Network Gateway in which the connection will be created. Changing the gateway forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: authorization_key
properties.description: • authorization_key - (Optional) The authorization key associated with the Express Route Circuit. This field is required only if the type is an ExpressRoute connection.

properties.name: express_route_circuit_id
properties.description: • express_route_circuit_id - (Optional) The ID of the Express Route Circuit when creating an ExpressRoute connection (i.e. when type is ExpressRoute). The Express Route Circuit can be in the same or in a different subscription.

properties.name: peer_virtual_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • peer_virtual_network_gateway_id - (Optional) The ID of the peer virtual network gateway when creating a VNet-to-VNet connection (i.e. when type is Vnet2Vnet). The peer Virtual Network Gateway can be in the same or in a different subscription.

properties.name: local_network_gateway_id
properties.description: • local_network_gateway_id - (Optional) The ID of the local network gateway when creating Site-to-Site connection (i.e. when type is IPsec).

properties.name: routing_weight
properties.description: • routing_weight - (Optional) The routing weight. Defaults to 10.

properties.name: shared_key
properties.description: • shared_key - (Optional) The shared IPSec key. A key must be provided if a Site-to-Site or VNet-to-VNet connection is created whereas ExpressRoute connections do not need a shared key.

properties.name: enable_bgp
properties.description: • enable_bgp - (Optional) If true, BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) is enabled for this connection. Defaults to false.

properties.name: express_route_gateway_bypass
properties.description: • express_route_gateway_bypass - (Optional) If true, data packets will bypass ExpressRoute Gateway for data forwarding This is only valid for ExpressRoute connections.

properties.name: use_policy_based_traffic_selectors
properties.description: • use_policy_based_traffic_selectors - (Optional) If true, policy-based traffic selectors are enabled for this connection. Enabling policy-based traffic selectors requires an ipsec_policy block. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ipsec_policy
properties.description: • ipsec_policy (Optional) A ipsec_policy block which is documented below. Only a single policy can be defined for a connection. For details on custom policies refer to the relevant section in the Azure documentation.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The ipsec_policy block supports:

properties.name: dh_group
properties.description: • dh_group - (Required) The DH group used in IKE phase 1 for initial SA. Valid options are DHGroup1, DHGroup14, DHGroup2, DHGroup2048, DHGroup24, ECP256, ECP384, or None.

properties.name: ike_encryption
properties.description: • ike_encryption - (Required) The IKE encryption algorithm. Valid options are AES128, AES192, AES256, DES, or DES3.

properties.name: ike_integrity
properties.description: • ike_integrity - (Required) The IKE integrity algorithm. Valid options are MD5, SHA1, SHA256, or SHA384.

properties.name: ipsec_encryption
properties.description: • ipsec_encryption - (Required) The IPSec encryption algorithm. Valid options are AES128, AES192, AES256, DES, DES3, GCMAES128, GCMAES192, GCMAES256, or None.

properties.name: ipsec_integrity
properties.description: • ipsec_integrity - (Required) The IPSec integrity algorithm. Valid options are GCMAES128, GCMAES192, GCMAES256, MD5, SHA1, or SHA256.

properties.name: pfs_group
properties.description: • pfs_group - (Required) The DH group used in IKE phase 2 for new child SA. Valid options are ECP256, ECP384, PFS1, PFS2, PFS2048, PFS24, or None.

properties.name: sa_datasize
properties.description: • sa_datasize - (Optional) The IPSec SA payload size in KB. Must be at least 1024 KB. Defaults to 102400000 KB.

properties.name: sa_lifetime
properties.description: • sa_lifetime - (Optional) The IPSec SA lifetime in seconds. Must be at least 300 seconds. Defaults to 27000 seconds.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the virtual network peering. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: • virtual_network_name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: remote_virtual_network_id
properties.description: • remote_virtual_network_id - (Required) The full Azure resource ID of the remote virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: allow_virtual_network_access
properties.description: • allow_virtual_network_access - (Optional) Controls if the VMs in the remote virtual network can access VMs in the local virtual network. Defaults to false.

properties.name: allow_forwarded_traffic
properties.description: • allow_forwarded_traffic - (Optional) Controls if forwarded traffic from VMs in the remote virtual network is allowed. Defaults to false.

properties.name: allow_gateway_transit
properties.description: • allow_gateway_transit - (Optional) Controls gatewayLinks can be used in the remote virtual network’s link to the local virtual network.

properties.name: use_remote_gateways
properties.description: • use_remote_gateways - (Optional) Controls if remote gateways can be used on the local virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allow_gateway_transit on the remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Defaults to false.
NOTE: use_remote_gateways must be set to false if using Global Virtual Network Peerings.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the policy. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Optional) Resource location. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: custom_rules
properties.description: • custom_rules - (Optional) One or more custom_rule blocks as defined below.

properties.name: policy_settings
properties.description: • policy_settings - (Optional) A policy_setting block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Web Application Firewall Policy.
<hr/>
The custom_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Gets name of the resource that is unique within a policy. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Required) Describes priority of the rule. Rules with a lower value will be evaluated before rules with a higher value

properties.name: rule_type
properties.description: • rule_type - (Required) Describes the type of rule

properties.name: match_conditions
properties.description: • match_conditions - (Required) One or more match_condition block defined below.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) Type of Actions
<hr/>
The match_condition block supports the following:

properties.name: match_variables
properties.description: • match_variables - (Required) One or more match_variable block defined below.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: • operator - (Required) Describes operator to be matched

properties.name: negation_condition
properties.description: • negation_condition - (Optional) Describes if this is negate condition or not

properties.name: match_values
properties.description: • match_values - (Required) Match value
<hr/>
The match_variable block supports the following:

properties.name: variable_name
properties.description: • variable_name - (Required) The name of the Match Variable

properties.name: selector
properties.description: • selector - (Optional) Describes field of the matchVariable collection
<hr/>
The policy_setting block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Describes if the policy is in enabled state or disabled state Defaults to Enabled.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) Describes if it is in detection mode or prevention mode at the policy level Defaults to Prevention.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Virtual WAN. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Virtual WAN. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: disable_vpn_encryption
properties.description: • disable_vpn_encryption - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether VPN encryption is disabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: security_provider_name
properties.description: • security_provider_name - (Optional) The name of the Security Provider.

properties.name: allow_branch_to_branch_traffic
properties.description: • allow_branch_to_branch_traffic - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether branch to branch traffic is allowed. Defaults to true.

properties.name: allow_vnet_to_vnet_traffic
properties.description: • allow_vnet_to_vnet_traffic - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether VNet to VNet traffic is allowed. Defaults to false.

properties.name: office365_local_breakout_category
properties.description: • office365_local_breakout_category - (Optional) Specifies the Office365 local breakout category. Possible values include: Optimize, OptimizeAndAllow, All, None. Defaults to None.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Virtual WAN.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Policy Assignment. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: • scope- (Required) The Scope at which the Policy Assignment should be applied, which must be a Resource ID (such as Subscription e.g. /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-000000000000 or a Resource Group e.g./subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myResourceGroup). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: policy_definition_id
properties.description: • policy_definition_id - (Required) The ID of the Policy Definition to be applied at the specified Scope.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) An identity block.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Optional) The Azure location where this policy assignment should exist. This is required when an Identity is assigned. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description to use for this Policy Assignment. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) A friendly display name to use for this Policy Assignment. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - (Optional) Parameters for the policy definition. This field is a JSON object that maps to the Parameters field from the Policy Definition. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: This value is required when the specified Policy Definition contains the parameters field.

properties.name: not_scopes
properties.description: (Optional) A list of the Policy Assignment's excluded scopes. The list must contain Resource IDs (such as Subscriptions e.g. /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-000000000000 or Resource Groups e.g./subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myResourceGroup).
<hr/>
An identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The Managed Service Identity Type of this Policy Assignment. Possible values are SystemAssigned (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), or None (no use of a Managed Service Identity).
NOTE: When type is set to SystemAssigned, identity the Principal ID can be retrieved after the policy has been assigned.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the policy definition. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: policy_type
properties.description: • policy_type - (Required) The policy type. The value can be "BuiltIn", "Custom" or "NotSpecified". Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Required) The policy mode that allows you to specify which resource types will be evaluated. The value can be "All", "Indexed" or "NotSpecified". Changing this resource forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The display name of the policy definition.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the policy definition.

properties.name: management_group_id
properties.description: • management_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Management Group where this policy should be defined. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: if you are using azurerm_management_group to assign a value to management_group_id, be sure to use .group_id and not .id.

properties.name: policy_rule
properties.description: • policy_rule - (Optional) The policy rule for the policy definition. This is a json object representing the rule that contains an if and a then block.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) The metadata for the policy definition. This is a json object representing additional metadata that should be stored with the policy definition.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - (Optional) Parameters for the policy definition. This field is a json object that allows you to parameterize your policy definition.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the policy set definition. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: policy_type

properties.name: display_name

properties.name: policy_definitions

properties.name: description

properties.name: management_group_id
properties.description: • management_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Management Group where this policy should be defined. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Note: if you are using azurerm_management_group to assign a value to management_group_id, be sure to use .group_id and not .id.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) The metadata for the policy set definition. This is a json object representing additional metadata that should be stored with the policy definition.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - (Optional) Parameters for the policy set definition. This field is a json object that allows you to parameterize your policy definition.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: resource_group_name

properties.name: location

properties.name: dashboard_properties

properties.name: zone_name

properties.name: TTL

properties.name: record

properties.name: resource_group_name

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Private DNS Zone Virtual Network Link. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: private_dns_zone_name
properties.description: • private_dns_zone_name - (Required) The name of the Private DNS zone (without a terminating dot). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: name
