properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Recovery Services Protected VM. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: recovery_vault_name
properties.description: • recovery_vault_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Recovery Services Vault to use. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: backup
properties.description: • backup - (Required) Configures the Policy backup frequecent, times & days as documented in the backup block below.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone - (Optional) Specifies the timezone. Defaults to UTC

properties.name: retention_daily
properties.description: • retention_daily - (Optional) Configures the policy daily retention as documented in the retention_daily block below. Required when backup frequency is Daily.

properties.name: retention_weekly
properties.description: • retention_weekly - (Optional) Configures the policy weekly retention as documented in the retention_weekly block below. Required when backup frequency is Weekly.

properties.name: retention_monthly
properties.description: • retention_monthly - (Optional) Configures the policy monthly retention as documented in the retention_monthly block below.

properties.name: retention_yearly
properties.description: • retention_yearly - (Optional) Configures the policy yearly retention as documented in the retention_yearly block below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
<hr/>
The backup block supports:

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: • frequency - (Required) Sets the backup frequency. Must be either Daily orWeekly.

properties.name: times
properties.description: • times - (Required) The time of day to perform the backup in 24hour format.

properties.name: weekdays
properties.description: • weekdays - (Optional) The days of the week to perform backups on. Must be one of Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday or Saturday.
<hr/>
The retention_daily block supports:

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Required) The number of daily backups to keep. Must be between 1 and 9999
<hr/>
The retention_weekly block supports:

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) The number of weekly backups to keep. Must be between 1 and 9999

properties.name: weekdays
properties.description: • weekdays - (Required) The weekday backups to retain. Must be one of Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday or Saturday.
<hr/>
The retention_monthly block supports:

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) The number of monthly backups to keep. Must be between 1 and 9999

properties.name: weekdays
properties.description: • weekdays - (Required) The weekday backups to retain . Must be one of Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday or Saturday.

properties.name: weeks
properties.description: • weeks - (Required) The weeks of the month to retain backups of. Must be one of First, Second, Third, Fourth, Last.
<hr/>
The retention_yearly block supports:

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) The number of yearly backups to keep. Must be between 1 and 9999

properties.name: weekdays
properties.description: • weekdays - (Required) The weekday backups to retain . Must be one of Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday or Saturday.

properties.name: weeks
properties.description: • weeks - (Required) The weeks of the month to retain backups of. Must be one of First, Second, Third, Fourth, Last.

properties.name: months
properties.description: • months - (Required) The months of the year to retain backups of. Must be one of January, February, March, April, May, June, July, Augest, September, October, November and December.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Recovery Services Protected VM. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: recovery_vault_name
properties.description: • recovery_vault_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Recovery Services Vault to use. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_vm_id
properties.description: • source_vm_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the VM to backup. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: backup_policy_id
properties.description: • backup_policy_id - (Required) Specifies the id of the backup policy to use.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Recovery Services Vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Recovery Services Vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) Sets the vault's SKU. Possible values include: Standard, RS0.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Redis instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location of the resource group.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Redis instance.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) The size of the Redis cache to deploy. Valid values for a SKU family of C (Basic/Standard) are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and for P (Premium) family are 1, 2, 3, 4.

properties.name: family
properties.description: • family - (Required) The SKU family/pricing group to use. Valid values are C (for Basic/Standard SKU family) and P (for Premium)

properties.name: sku_name
properties.description: • sku_name - (Required) The SKU of Redis to use. Possible values are Basic, Standard and Premium.
<hr/>

properties.name: enable_non_ssl_port
properties.description: • enable_non_ssl_port - (Optional) Enable the non-SSL port (6379) - disabled by default.

properties.name: minimum_tls_version
properties.description: • minimum_tls_version - (Optional) The minimum TLS version. Defaults to 1.0.

properties.name: patch_schedule
properties.description: • patch_schedule - (Optional) A list of patch_schedule blocks as defined below - only available for Premium SKU's.

properties.name: private_static_ip_address
properties.description: • private_static_ip_address - (Optional) The Static IP Address to assign to the Redis Cache when hosted inside the Virtual Network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: redis_configuration
properties.description: • redis_configuration - (Optional) A redis_configuration as defined below - with some limitations by SKU - defaults/details are shown below.

properties.name: shard_count
properties.description: • shard_count - (Optional) Only available when using the Premium SKU The number of Shards to create on the Redis Cluster.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Optional) Only available when using the Premium SKU The ID of the Subnet within which the Redis Cache should be deployed. This Subnet must only contain Azure Cache for Redis instances without any other type of resources. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: zones
properties.description: • zones - (Optional) A list of a single item of the Availability Zone which the Redis Cache should be allocated in.

Please Note: Availability Zones are in Preview and only supported in several regions at this time - as such you must be opted into the Preview to use this functionality. You can opt into the Availability Zones Preview in the Azure Portal.
<hr/>
A redis_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: enable_authentication
properties.description: (Optional) If set to false, the Redis instance will be accessible without authentication. Defaults to true.
NOTE: enable_authentication can only be set to false if a subnet_id is specified; and only works if there aren't existing instances within the subnet with enable_authentication set to true.

properties.name: maxmemory_reserved
properties.description: (Optional) Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage e.g. failover. Defaults are shown below.

properties.name: maxmemory_delta
properties.description: (Optional) The max-memory delta for this Redis instance. Defaults are shown below.

properties.name: maxmemory_policy
properties.description: • maxmemory_policy - (Optional) How Redis will select what to remove when maxmemory is reached. Defaults are shown below.

properties.name: maxfragmentationmemory_reserved
properties.description: • maxfragmentationmemory_reserved - (Optional) Value in megabytes reserved to accommodate for memory fragmentation. Defaults are shown below.

properties.name: rdb_backup_enabled
properties.description: • rdb_backup_enabled - (Optional) Is Backup Enabled? Only supported on Premium SKU's.

properties.name: rdb_backup_frequency
properties.description: • rdb_backup_frequency - (Optional) The Backup Frequency in Minutes. Only supported on Premium SKU's. Possible values are: 15, 30, 60, 360, 720 and 1440.

properties.name: rdb_backup_max_snapshot_count
properties.description: • rdb_backup_max_snapshot_count - (Optional) The maximum number of snapshots to create as a backup. Only supported for Premium SKU's.

properties.name: rdb_storage_connection_string
properties.description: • rdb_storage_connection_string - (Optional) The Connection String to the Storage Account. Only supported for Premium SKU's. In the format: DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;BlobEndpoint=${azurerm_storage_account.test.primary_blob_endpoint};AccountName=${azurerm_storage_account.test.name};AccountKey=${azurerm_storage_account.test.primary_access_key}.

NOTE: There's a bug in the Redis API where the original storage connection string isn't being returned, which is being tracked in this issue. In the interim you can use the ignore_changes attribute to ignore changes to this field e.g.:

resource "azurerm_redis_cache" "test" {
  # ...
  ignore_changes = ["redis_configuration.0.rdb_storage_connection_string"]
}

properties.name: notify_keyspace_events
properties.description: (Optional) Keyspace notifications allows clients to subscribe to Pub/Sub channels in order to receive events affecting the Redis data set in some way. Reference

redis_configuration {
  maxmemory_reserved = 10
  maxmemory_delta    = 2
  maxmemory_policy   = "allkeys-lru"
}

properties.name: default-redis-configuration-values
properties.description: » Default Redis Configuration Values

NOTE: The maxmemory_reserved, maxmemory_delta and maxfragmentationmemory-reserved settings are only available for Standard and Premium caches. More details are available in the Relevant Links section below._
<hr/>
A patch_schedule block supports the following:

properties.name: day_of_week
properties.description: • day_of_week (Required) the Weekday name - possible values include Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday etc.

properties.name: start_hour_utc
properties.description: • start_hour_utc - (Optional) the Start Hour for maintenance in UTC - possible values range from 0 - 23.
Note: The Patch Window lasts for 5 hours from the start_hour_utc.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which this Redis Cache exists.

properties.name: start_ip

properties.name: end_ip

NOTE At least one of error_action_web or action_storage_queue needs to be set.

properties.name: action_storage_queue
properties.description: • action_storage_queue - (Optional) A action_storage_queue block defining a storage queue job action as described below. Note this is identical to an error_action_storage_queue block.

properties.name: state

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the URL of the web request. Must be HTTPS for authenticated requests.

action_storage_queue & error_action_storage_queue block supports the following:

properties.description: (Required) Specifies the the storage account name.

properties.name: storage_queue_name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the the storage account queue.

properties.description: (Required) Specifies a SAS token/key to authenticate with.

properties.description: (Required) The message to send into the queue.
retry block supports the following:

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the duration between retries.

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the number of times a retry should be attempted.
recurrence block supports the following:

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the frequency of recurrence. Must be one of Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the interval between executions. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of times that the job should run.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the time at which the job will cease running. Must be less then 500 days into the future.

properties.name: minutes
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the minutes of the hour that the job should execute at. Must be between 0 and 59

properties.name: hours
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the hours of the day that the job should execute at. Must be between 0 and 23

properties.name: week_days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the days of the week that the job should execute on. Must be one of Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. Only applies when Week is used for frequency.

properties.name: month_days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the days of the month that the job should execute on. Must be non zero and between -1 and 31. Only applies when Month is used for frequency.

properties.name: monthly_occurrences
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies specific monthly occurrences like "last sunday of the month" with monthly_occurrences blocks. Only applies when Month is used for frequency.
monthly_occurrences block supports the following:

properties.name: day
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the day of the week that the job should execute on. Must be one of one of Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday.

properties.name: occurrence
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the week the job should run on. For example 1 for the first week, -1 for the last week of the month. Must be between -5 and 5.

properties.description: • sku - (Required) Valid values are basic, free and standard. standard2 and standard3 are also valid, but can only be used when it's enabled on the backend by Microsoft support. free provisions the service in shared clusters. standard provisions the service in dedicated clusters. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • replica_count - (Optional) Default is 1. Valid values include 1 through 12. Valid only when sku is standard. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: partition_count

properties.description: (Required) The email of the Security Center Contact.

properties.description: (Optional) The phone number of the Security Center Contact.

properties.name: alert_notifications
properties.description: (Required) Whether to send security alerts notifications to the security contact.

properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Service Fabric Cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

NOTE: The Reliability Level of the Cluster depends on the number of nodes in the Cluster: Platinum requires at least 9 VM's, Gold requires at least 7 VM's, Silver requires at least 5 VM's, Bronze requires at least 3 VM's.

properties.description: • management_endpoint - (Required) Specifies the Management Endpoint of the cluster such as http://example.com. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.description: • is_primary - (Required) Is this the Primary Node Type? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: client_endpoint_port
properties.description: • client_endpoint_port - (Required) The Port used for the Client Endpoint for this Node Type. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: http_endpoint_port
properties.description: • http_endpoint_port - (Required) The Port used for the HTTP Endpoint for this Node Type. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: durability_level
properties.description: • durability_level - (Optional) The Durability Level for this Node Type. Possible values include Bronze, Gold and Silver. Defaults to Bronze. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: application_ports
properties.description: • application_ports - (Optional) A application_ports block as defined below.

properties.name: ephemeral_ports
properties.description: • ephemeral_ports - (Optional) A ephemeral_ports block as defined below.

properties.name: reverse_proxy_endpoint_port
properties.description: • reverse_proxy_endpoint_port - (Optional) The Port used for the Reverse Proxy Endpoint for this Node Type. Changing this will upgrade the cluster.
<hr/>
A application_ports block supports the following:

properties.name: start_port
properties.description: • start_port - (Required) The start of the Application Port Range on this Node Type.

properties.name: end_port
properties.description: • end_port - (Required) The end of the Application Port Range on this Node Type.
<hr/>
A ephemeral_ports block supports the following:

properties.name: start_port
properties.description: • start_port - (Required) The start of the Ephemeral Port Range on this Node Type.

properties.name: end_port
properties.description: • end_port - (Required) The end of the Ephemeral Port Range on this Node Type.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Stream Analytics Job. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group where the Stream Analytics Job should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure Region in which the Resource Group exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: compatibility_level
properties.description: • compatibility_level - (Required) Specifies the compatibility level for this job - which controls certain runtime behaviors of the streaming job. Possible values are 1.0 and 1.1`.
NOTE: Support for Compatibility Level 1.2 is dependent on a new version of the Stream Analytics API, which being tracked in this issue.

properties.name: data_locale
properties.description: • data_locale - (Optional) Specifies the Data Locale of the Job, which should be a supported .NET Culture.

properties.name: events_late_arrival_max_delay_in_seconds
properties.description: • events_late_arrival_max_delay_in_seconds - (Optional) Specifies the maximum tolerable delay in seconds where events arriving late could be included. Supported range is -1 (indefinite) to 1814399 (20d 23h 59m 59s). Default is 0.

properties.name: events_out_of_order_max_delay_in_seconds
properties.description: • events_out_of_order_max_delay_in_seconds - (Optional) Specifies the maximum tolerable delay in seconds where out-of-order events can be adjusted to be back in order. Supported range is 0 to 599 (9m 59s). Default is 5.

properties.name: events_out_of_order_policy
properties.description: • events_out_of_order_policy - (Optional) Specifies the policy which should be applied to events which arrive out of order in the input event stream. Possible values are Adjust and Drop. Default is Adjust.

properties.name: output_error_policy
properties.description: • output_error_policy - (Optional) Specifies the policy which should be applied to events which arrive at the output and cannot be written to the external storage due to being malformed (such as missing column values, column values of wrong type or size). Possible values are Drop and Stop. Default is Drop.

properties.name: streaming_units
properties.description: • streaming_units - (Required) Specifies the number of streaming units that the streaming job uses. Supported values are 1, 3, 6 and multiples of 6 up to 120.

properties.name: transformation_query
properties.description: • transformation_query - (Required) Specifies the query that will be run in the streaming job, written in Stream Analytics Query Language (SAQL).

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - A mapping of tags assigned to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the JavaScript UDF Function. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group where the Stream Analytics Job exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: stream_analytics_job_name
properties.description: • stream_analytics_job_name - (Required) The name of the Stream Analytics Job where this Function should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: input
properties.description: • input - (Required) One or more input blocks as defined below.

properties.name: output
properties.description: • output - (Required) An output blocks as defined below.

properties.name: script
properties.description: • script - (Required) The JavaScript of this UDF Function.
<hr/>
A input block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Data Type for the Input Argument of this JavaScript Function. Possible values include array, any, bigint, datetime, float, nvarchar(max) and record.
<hr/>
A output block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Data Type output from this JavaScript Function. Possible values include array, any, bigint, datetime, float, nvarchar(max) and record.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.description: • stream_analytics_job_name - (Required) The name of the Stream Analytics Job. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: date_format
properties.description: • date_format - (Required) The date format. Wherever {date} appears in path_pattern, the value of this property is used as the date format instead.

properties.name: path_pattern
properties.description: • path_pattern - (Required) The blob path pattern. Not a regular expression. It represents a pattern against which blob names will be matched to determine whether or not they should be included as input or output to the job.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) The name of the Storage Account.

properties.name: storage_account_key
properties.description: • storage_account_key - (Required) The Access Key which should be used to connect to this Storage Account.

properties.name: storage_container_name
properties.description: • storage_container_name - (Required) The name of the Container within the Storage Account.

properties.name: time_format
properties.description: • time_format - (Required) The time format. Wherever {time} appears in path_pattern, the value of this property is used as the time format instead.

properties.description: • encoding - (Optional) The encoding of the incoming data in the case of input and the encoding of outgoing data in the case of output. It currently can only be set to UTF8.
NOTE: This is required when type is set to Csv or Json.

properties.name: field_delimiter
properties.description: (Optional) The delimiter that will be used to separate comma-separated value (CSV) records. Possible values are (space), , (comma), (tab), | (pipe) and ;.
NOTE: This is required when type is set to Csv.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the format of the JSON the output will be written in. Possible values are Array and LineSeparated.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the storage account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This must be unique across the entire Azure service, not just within the resource group.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: account_kind
properties.description: • account_kind - (Optional) Defines the Kind of account. Valid options are BlobStorage, BlockBlobStorage, FileStorage, Storage and StorageV2. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to Storage.

properties.name: account_tier
properties.description: • account_tier - (Required) Defines the Tier to use for this storage account. Valid options are Standard and Premium. For FileStorage accounts only Premium is valid. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: account_replication_type
properties.description: • account_replication_type - (Required) Defines the type of replication to use for this storage account. Valid options are LRS, GRS, RAGRS and ZRS.

properties.name: access_tier
properties.description: • access_tier - (Optional) Defines the access tier for BlobStorage, FileStorage and StorageV2 accounts. Valid options are Hot and Cool, defaults to Hot.

properties.name: enable_blob_encryption
properties.description: • enable_blob_encryption - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls if Encryption Services are enabled for Blob storage, see here for more information. Defaults to true.

properties.name: enable_file_encryption
properties.description: • enable_file_encryption - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls if Encryption Services are enabled for File storage, see here for more information. Defaults to true.

properties.name: enable_https_traffic_only
properties.description: • enable_https_traffic_only - (Optional) Boolean flag which forces HTTPS if enabled, see here for more information.

properties.name: is_hns_enabled
properties.description: • is_hns_enabled - (Optional) Is Hierarchical Namespace enabled? This can be used with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen 2 (see here for more information). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: account_encryption_source
properties.description: • account_encryption_source - (Optional) The Encryption Source for this Storage Account. Possible values are Microsoft.Keyvault and Microsoft.Storage. Defaults to Microsoft.Storage.

properties.name: custom_domain
properties.description: • custom_domain - (Optional) A custom_domain block as documented below.

properties.name: enable_advanced_threat_protection
properties.description: • enable_advanced_threat_protection (Optional) Boolean flag which controls if advanced threat protection is enabled, see here for more information. Defaults to false.
Note: enable_advanced_threat_protection is not supported in all regions.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) A identity block as defined below.

properties.name: queue_properties
properties.description: • queue_properties - (Optional) A queue_properties block as defined below.
NOTE: queue_properties cannot be set when the access_tier is set to BlobStorage

properties.name: network_rules
properties.description: • network_rules - (Optional) A network_rules block as documented below.

properties.name: allowed_origins
properties.description: • allowed_origins - (Required) A list of origin domains that will be allowed by CORS.

properties.name: exposed_headers
properties.description: • exposed_headers - (Required) A list of response headers that are exposed to CORS clients.

properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether traffic is bypassed for Logging/Metrics/AzureServices. Valid options are any combination of Logging, Metrics, AzureServices, or None.

properties.name: ip_rules
properties.description: (Optional) List of public IP or IP ranges in CIDR Format. Only IPV4 addresses are allowed. Private IP address ranges (as defined in RFC 1918) are not allowed.

Note: If specifying network_rules, one of either ip_rules or virtual_network_subnet_ids must be specified and default_action must be set to Deny.

properties.description: • size - (Optional) Used only for page blobs to specify the size in bytes of the blob to be created. Must be a multiple of 512. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: access_tier
properties.description: • access_tier - (Optional) The access tier of the storage blob. Possible values are Archive, Cool and Hot.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Optional) The content type of the storage blob. Cannot be defined if source_uri is defined. Defaults to application/octet-stream.

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Optional) An absolute path to a file on the local system. This field cannot be specified for Append blobs and annot be specified if source_content or source_uri is specified.

properties.name: source_content
properties.description: • source_content - (Optional) The content for this blob which should be defined inline. This field can only be specified for Block blobs and cannot be specified if source or source_uri is specified.

properties.name: source_uri
properties.description: • source_uri - (Optional) The URI of an existing blob, or a file in the Azure File service, to use as the source contents for the blob to be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This field cannot be specified for Append blobs and cannot be specified if source or source_content is specified.

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: • parallelism - (Optional) The number of workers per CPU core to run for concurrent uploads. Defaults to 8.
NOTE: parallelism is only applicable for Page blobs - support for Block Blobs is blocked on the upstream issue.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A map of custom blob metadata.

properties.name: attempts
properties.description: • attempts - (Optional / Deprecated) The number of attempts to make per page or block when uploading. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Optional / Deprecated) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage container.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Container which should be created within the Storage Account.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) The name of the Storage Account where the Container should be created.

properties.name: container_access_type
properties.description: • container_access_type - (Optional) The Access Level configured for this Container. Possible values are blob, container or private. Defaults to private.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A mapping of MetaData for this Container.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Optional / Deprecated) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage container. This field is no longer used and will be removed in 2.0.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Data Lake Gen2 File System which should be created within the Storage Account. Must be unique within the storage account the queue is located. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the Storage Account in which the Data Lake Gen2 File System should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: • properties - (Optional) A mapping of Key to Base64-Encoded Values which should be assigned to this Data Lake Gen2 File System.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: storage_account_id
properties.description: • storage_account_id - (Required) Specifies the id of the storage account to apply the management policy to.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) A rule block as documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A rule name can contain any combination of alpha numeric characters. Rule name is case-sensitive. It must be unique within a policy.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Boolean to specify whether the rule is enabled.

properties.name: filters
properties.description: • filters - A filter block as documented below.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: • actions - An actions block as documented below.
<hr/>
filters supports the following:

properties.name: prefix_match
properties.description: An array of strings for prefixes to be matched.

properties.name: blob_types
properties.description: An array of predefined values. Only blockBlob is supported.
<hr/>
actions supports the following:

properties.name: base_blob
properties.description: A base_blob block as documented below.

properties.name: snapshot
properties.description: A snapshot block as documented below.
<hr/>
base_blob supports the following:

properties.name: tier_to_cool_after_days_since_modification_greater_than
properties.description: The age in days after last modification to tier blobs to cool storage. Supports blob currently at Hot tier. Must be at least 0.

properties.name: tier_to_archive_after_days_since_modification_greater_than
properties.description: The age in days after last modification to tier blobs to archive storage. Supports blob currently at Hot or Cool tier. Must be at least 0.

properties.name: delete_after_days_since_modification_greater_than
properties.description: The age in days after last modification to delete the blob. Must be at least 0.
<hr/>
snapshot supports the following:

properties.name: delete_after_days_since_creation_greater_than
properties.description: The age in days after create to delete the snaphot. Must be at least 0.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Queue which should be created within the Storage Account. Must be unique within the storage account the queue is located.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the Storage Account in which the Storage Queue should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Optional / Deprecated) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage queue.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A mapping of MetaData which should be assigned to this Storage Queue.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the share. Must be unique within the storage account where the share is located.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the share. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: • acl - (Optional) One or more acl blocks as defined below.

properties.name: quota
properties.description: • quota - (Optional) The maximum size of the share, in gigabytes. Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5 TB (5120 GB) for Standard storage accounts or 100 TB (102400 GB) for Premium storage accounts. Default is 5120.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A mapping of MetaData for this File Share.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Optional / Deprecated) The name of the resource group in which to create the share. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
<hr/>
A acl block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) The ID which should be used for this Shared Identifier.

properties.name: access_policy
properties.description: • access_policy - (Required) An access_policy block as defined below.
<hr/>
A access_policy block supports the following:

properties.name: expiry
properties.description: • expiry - (Required) The ISO8061 UTC time at which this Access Policy should be valid until.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: • permissions - (Required) The permissions which should associated with this Shared Identifier.

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) The ISO8061 UTC time at which this Access Policy should be valid from.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name (or path) of the Directory that should be created within this File Share. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: share_name
properties.description: • share_name - (Required) The name of the File Share where this Directory should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) The name of the Storage Account within which the File Share is located. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A mapping of metadata to assign to this Directory.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the storage table. Must be unique within the storage account the table is located.

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Optional / Deprecated) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage table.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: • acl - (Optional) One or more acl blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A acl block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) The ID which should be used for this Shared Identifier.

properties.name: access_policy
properties.description: • access_policy - (Required) An access_policy block as defined below.
<hr/>
A access_policy block supports the following:

properties.name: expiry
properties.description: • expiry - (Required) The ISO8061 UTC time at which this Access Policy should be valid until.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: • permissions - (Required) The permissions which should associated with this Shared Identifier.

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) The ISO8061 UTC time at which this Access Policy should be valid from.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: storage_account_name
properties.description: • storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage table entity. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: table_name
properties.description: • table_name - (Required) The name of the storage table in which to create the storage table entity. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: partition_key
properties.description: • partition_key - (Required) The key for the partition where the entity will be inserted/merged. Changing this forces a new resource.

properties.name: row_key
properties.description: • row_key - (Required) The key for the row where the entity will be inserted/merged. Changing this forces a new resource.

properties.name: entity
properties.description: • entity - (Required) A map of key/value pairs that describe the entity to be inserted/merged in to the storage table.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the template deployment. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the template deployment.

properties.name: deployment_mode
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the mode that is used to deploy resources. This value could be either Incremental or Complete. Note that you will almost always want this to be set to Incremental otherwise the deployment will destroy all infrastructure not specified within the template, and Terraform will not be aware of this.

properties.name: template_body
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the JSON definition for the template.
Note: There's a file function available which allows you to read this from an external file, which helps makes this more resource more readable.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - (Optional) Specifies the name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template.

properties.name: parameters_body
properties.description: • parameters_body - (Optional) Specifies a valid Azure JSON parameters file that define the deployment parameters. It can contain KeyVault references
Note: There's a file function available which allows you to read this from an external file, which helps makes this more resource more readable.
